review: A really easy hidden object game. The story is a great B-movie and also does not take itself serious The HO scenes as well as the other riddles did not pose a challenge. But again, it was like having fun with a B-movie and with two hours time for solving the same length as well. I had my fun.

author: {'steamid': '76561199010042150', 'num_games_owned': 3874, 'num_reviews': 2454, 'playtime_forever': 193, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 193, 'last_played': 1666084795}
review:
I am 32 years old.

My ex-wife and I have a daughter together, and we adopted our son together. Both are now 4 years old.

When we were going through our separation, I felt lost and unhappy. I was self-destructive. One day, I was so angry with everything spiraling out of control that I punched a concrete wall in a moment of overwhelming emotion. This resulted in breaking my fifth metacarpal in my right hand‚Äîthe hand I worked with, played games with, and used to carry my children to bed‚Äîthe hand I desperately needed to ensure I could continue providing.

Upon learning the severity of the self-inflicted damage, I became almost suicidal. Keep in mind that just a few months before this, I was the happiest man, with no history of depression or anxiety. I had never experienced anger outbursts, nor was I the type to break down and cry, but I was in a tough situation that truly prevented me from seeing the light on the other side.

With nothing better to do, I looked for a game I could play WITH ONE HAND while recovering. Somehow, I stumbled upon this game and read some of the comments. I decided it was worth a try... I must admit I didn't beat the game, nor did I play as much as some of you. In fact, I may have played this game for only a day or two. That being said, after doing so, I had a new joy and hope for life. I managed to leave behind the pain and suffering that had been thrust upon me. I could experience the joy and happiness of other people. I relaxed for 5 ‚ô•‚ô•‚ô•‚ô• minutes listening to this music, long enough to realize that I would be okay.

After realizing this, I turned off the game and went back to work. My hand hurt a lot, but I was motivated. I stopped feeling so sorry for myself and became the father I needed to be at that moment, not the weak boy I was behaving like.

Today, I am close friends with the mother of my children. We don't fight, argue, or say hurtful things to each other. We are parents and friends.

Now I have 3 children. My third child is, wait, ALSO 4 YEARS OLD. The woman I am with was going through a very similar situation at the time of my separation, and we just unexpectedly stumbled into each other's lives. We have been dating for a year and are very happy together.

Moral of the story: you never know what life has in store for you, and if I had given up when all odds were against me, I wouldn't be where I am today. This silly little game helped me realize that.

Thank you.

review:
To run this game on Win 10, you have to fiddle around with the compatibility settings for the executable.
The screen is stretched, the characters are insufferable, the puzzles are tedious, the protagonist clips through the scenery.
This is by far the worst HOG I have ever played.

Not worth anyones time.

My rating 0/10, not recommended.

review:
Acabo de publicar mi rese√±a sobre Alchemy Mysteries y ahora es el turno de este.
El juego est√° bueno. Es mucho m√°s breve que el anterior mencionado (lo jugu√© tres veces en 5 horas). 
Hay dos dificultades: una f√°cil/normal y otra avanzada. Si me preguntan qu√© diferencias not√©... les dir√≠a que pr√°cticamente ninguna.
Adem√°s de ser m√°s breve, tambi√©n tiene puzzles much√≠simo m√°s simples. En s√≠, la dificultad avanzada simplemente te indica menos cosas.
La historia est√° buena, bien contada. A diferencia del Alchemy M., donde se respira misterio, esta historia es un poco m√°s c√≥mica. 
Quiz√° me gust√≥ un poco menos, pero a√∫n as√≠ me lo pas√© bien.
Tuve un √∫nico problema, y es que cuando me lo estaba terminando por segunta vez y ya no me quedaba nada, se me bugue√≥ un poco y no me dejaba hacer clic sobre el item que necesitaba. Lo tuve que empezar de nuevo, porque no lo pude arreglar de otro modo. Recomiendo que si lo van a comprar para probarlo, eviten dar tantos clics a lo bestia en objetos que no necesitan, porque... quiz√° venga por ah√≠ el bug.

author: {'steamid': '76561198010162373', 'num_games_owned': 796, 'num_reviews': 71, 'playtime_forever': 733, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 733, 'last_played': 1700254991}
review:
A rather unique hidden-object-game that subverts many HOG tropes.
For starters, you play as a male protagonist looking for his fiance, which is already somewhat rare in this genre. Even more rare is how deliberately goofy the game is. It's both a parody and a satire on vampire fiction, with lots of references to vampire books and movies. It's all rather tongue-in-cheek and breaks the fourth wall frequently.

The game is also entirely in 3D, except of course for the minigames and backgrounds, complete with animated talking. By the way, all characters voice-acted (and the voice acting isn't half bad either! It really fits the campy style of the game).
There are many hidden object scenes and only a few puzzles, but it's a great game for people who prefer to focus on "look and find" puzzles that actually have a bit of challenge to them.

The only downside is that the game is a bit janky. There are times where you have to leave to the menu then return to the game to avoid a glitch that doesn't let you click on anything. Sometimes, areas for you to search aren't immediately obvious unless you click around or play with highlights enabled. Also, I have played this game a few times and discovered that if I uninstalled the game, then re-installed it, all of my achievements are wiped out and I have to obtain them anew (maybe this bug has been fixed by now, however).

All in all, I recommend this for the sheer novelty and campiness alone. HOGs are often cliche'd, serious and cozy, but this HOG breaks the mould.

author: {'steamid': '76561198025839453', 'num_games_owned': 733, 'num_reviews': 79, 'playtime_forever': 134, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 134, 'last_played': 1699857380}
review:
First thing you need to know: This game does not take itself seriously. It is meant to be funny/cringey.

Now with that out of the way I'll share my notes.

Game has both achievements and cloud save which is a plus.
It only has Easy or Advanced difficulties. 
It has VO and so far so good, Also, in case it wasn't clear at the beginning of my review, the game starts with a funny gimmicky intro, just so that you aware of the tone it is setting. 

The game has really easy/decent puzzles and somewhat okay HO scenarios, It also blends a slight point and click movement mechanic. 

For the price, this game is entertaining enough. As i mentioned, it is a bit cringe but I think that's what they were aiming for. I actually do recommend the game if only just for the giggles. 

'Now one con I must point out is that I did encounter a bug where I could not enter the HO locations and was just stuck. I had to close and re-open the game to continue. No progress was lost and this was pretty early on in the game so it didn't really affect much.

author: {'steamid': '76561197994336777', 'num_games_owned': 1764, 'num_reviews': 95, 'playtime_forever': 374, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 374, 'last_played': 1695795712}
review:
This game is NOT for everyone, but if you are a fan of campy horror or B-Movies, then this might be right up your alley.
The graphics are dated, and the gameplay is very standard hidden-object, but the plot, voice acting and dialog is really funny.

I don't want to give everything away, but suffice to say that this is NOT a standard Vampire tale. It's quirky, campy, silly, & fun.

Again, not for everyone, so if what I wrote doesn't tickle your fancy, then this game is definitely not for you.

review: Very low quality HO game. The story as dumb as usually, but still might be the strongest part of the game because of the parodic elements. The graphics, the controls, the gui and the visibility of the hidden object scenes are terrible. And the only reason I couldn't get the last achievement is because the skipping in conversation, and the continuing the conversation is the same button for some fuckedup reason, which makes it extremly hard not skipping something accidentally.

author: {'steamid': '76561197989637471', 'num_games_owned': 1493, 'num_reviews': 92, 'playtime_forever': 117, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 117, 'last_played': 1662549336}
review:
The story is amusing, especially if you don't know what's coming, and goes from generic to insane in record time. The gameplay however is best described as "uninspired". The hidden object sections are plentiful and because some items are hidden behind unrelated items that you need to move to the side, and there's no penalty for wrong clicks, the game encourages you to just click on everything on screen mindlessly. Other mini-games are fine, I guess. I dunno, it's a mild chore to play but the story scenes almost make it worth it.

100% Completion time: 1 hour 57 minutes
5/10

author: {'steamid': '76561198084605790', 'num_games_owned': 1308, 'num_reviews': 33, 'playtime_forever': 241, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 241, 'last_played': 1661519702}
review:
Cheesy, the puzzles are not even that good but most of these games aren't exactly master pieces. Sometimes I just like a simple hidden objects game with a cheesy story. 
My biggest problem is the bugs. My first attempt was met with a bug in the first few minutes of game play. Ok sure let me restart the game, I was like 10 minutes in so whatever. Then I played for another 2 hours, only for the game to completely break when I [spoiler] Freed Nina [/spoiler] and no matter what I did I could not get out of that state. I ended up having to restart the whole game... After being just a few screens away from beating it. 

If you do decide to get and play this game please take your time clicking on things, do not skip dialog... Anything a bit too fast or forceful outside hidden objects part can break the game.

author: {'steamid': '76561198047845894', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 514, 'playtime_forever': 236, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 236, 'last_played': 1509178905}
review:
Not only did I beat this game completely, I bought a hard copy of it. I don't know why. I don't remember anything about it except for a scene on a bridge or something. I think I forced myself to complete it as some kind of test of will or endurance? It's already been five years since I played it? Yikes.

If you've played one hidden object game, you've played them all. And if you haven't played any, then play Sinister City.

EDIT: According to my review for Prague Legends, I supposedly enjoyed playing Sinister City. Maybe I like vampires. I guess I'll change the review to recommended then...

author: {'steamid': '76561198047160036', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 66, 'playtime_forever': 305, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 305, 'last_played': 1656350776}
review:
Sadly I cant recommend this game. I played it a few years ago and managed to get every achievment but after I wanted to replay it I am just shocked and disappointed. All achievments are reset and I think no worries I will just do them again it was a nice game, but nope I cant play it! If I try to start it, it instantly crashes and after some searching online it is because of my steam nickname. It is the only game that doesnt like characters or symbols in it and I dont see why I should change my name just cause a game is bad programmed.

IT is just sad that a good game for a low price isnt playable for a few people. It also crashed in the past whiel interacting with a mirror puzzle and I had to restart from a save point. The developers sadly dont fix this problem.

author: {'steamid': '76561198062678111', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 187, 'playtime_forever': 199, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 199, 'last_played': 1655502439}
review:
Yes, I recommend. Even after overcoming the compatibility hurtle to get it running (I found good help in the community discussion), and a couple of crashes.  It also took a while for me to get used to how different it plays from most other adventure HOGs.  

You talk to several other characters. The dialogue was funny at times!  Good writing,  "Where else would a blood sucker with the gift of persuasion work? - at a real estate agency in the Vampire State Building."

You have a nice map to drive around on.  You'll know when you need to go somewhere.  

You have to click around to find the HOS. In addition to the objects in the list, you have to find a few specific items to, for example, fix something else at your location. So that means you have to go back and forth between the various HOS to collect them all.  The HOS will NOT close out automatically to let you know when you're done. If you think you're done, go to another HOS because you can always return.  They never become inactive.

This is not a scary game.  I enjoyed it a lot.  I relied on the hint button at first until I got the hang of how the game play worked.  The ending and "out takes" are hilarious.

author: {'steamid': '76561198132995625', 'num_games_owned': 1414, 'num_reviews': 754, 'playtime_forever': 234, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 234, 'last_played': 1653823878}
review:
[h1] Sinister City [/h1]
Hidden object game of 2014

Who would name their city Sinister City? Vampires of course! When John's bride-to-be is kidnapped by Sinister City's chief bloodsucker, there's only one thing to do - seek hidden objects and slay vampires! Or at least insult them until they give the girl back.

You can tell it's an old game. The graphics are mediocre and the gameplay is just so-so.
But technically everything works. The main focus here is on the texts and the story you collect, so to speak. The texts and the designations are full of puns and hidden allusions to well-known stories, films and companies. Quite difficult due to the nature of the game design and its implementation.
But everything is doable and you can skip the minigames if necessary. Still to be recommended.

My group and my archive with over 5,100 reviews here:
https://steamcommunity.com/groups/hoi4deu

[h1] Sinister City [/h1]
Wimmelbildspiel von 2014

Wer w√ºrde seine Stadt Sinister City nennen? Vampire nat√ºrlich! Als Johns k√ºnftige Braut vom obersten Blutsauger von Sinister City entf√ºhrt wird, gibt es nur eines zu tun - verborgene Objekte zu suchen und Vampire zu t√∂ten! Oder beleidige sie wenigstens so lange, bis sie das M√§dchen zur√ºckgeben.

Man merkt deutlich das es ein altes Spiel ist. Die Grafik ist bescheiden und das Gameplay ist auch nur so la-la.
Aber technisch gesehen funktioniert alles. Das Hauptaugenmerk liegt hier bei den Texten und der Geschichte die du sozusagen ersammelst. Die Texte und auch die Bezeichnungen sind voller Wortwitz und versteckten Anspielungen auf bekannte Geschichten, Filme und auch Firmen. Ziemlich schwer aufgrund der Art der Spielgestaltung und seiner Umsetzung.
Aber es ist alles zu schaffen und die Minigames kann man √úberspringen wenn n√∂tig. Durchaus noch zu Empfehlen.

author: {'steamid': '76561198371977380', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 6, 'playtime_forever': 428, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 428, 'last_played': 1650234088}

author: {'steamid': '76561198120530775', 'num_games_owned': 3399, 'num_reviews': 342, 'playtime_forever': 160, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 160, 'last_played': 1649926244}
review:
Hum... Kinda... Whatever. This is a HO game with a satiric plot. The graphics are adequate for the genre. The music is not a thing. The story is... funny?

Bugs, yup, and glitches. To solve the bad stuff you only need to exit to menu and return to the game. No crashes. Runs fine on Win 7.

Overall, very casual. All the puzzles are no-brainers and you can skip them. The story is somewhat entertaining but not that good. It makes fun of the classic movies and books starring vampires. It's very short, so you can finish it in one sitting. It includes cards and achievements and is very cheap. If you want an easy time-waster for a single gaming session, this could be the one. It's not good but is not bad enough to give it the thumb down. Nevertheless, you can do better.

author: {'steamid': '76561198095320410', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 54, 'playtime_forever': 134, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 134, 'last_played': 1648895179}
review: Mixed feelings on this one, but the very cheap price pushes it over into a "recommend" vote. Game took me a little under 2 and a half hours to play, and that's probably because I'm playing another game at the same time. The graphics are pretty poor, and at more than one point ends up with "floating" characters. The mechanics are klunky and low grade, and the majority of object finding you do is more "click on everything in site as it might have something hidden behind it" rather than any real skill in finding things. The game is also buggy with some items not loading for me properly and appearing as white rectangles, and I once had to restart the game as I could no longer interact with things. The story is also pretty cheesy (purposely so, from the looks of it). Taking into account all that, it was $1.50 AUD and it entertained me for a couple of hours. I'm not sure you can really ask for much more for that kind of price.

author: {'steamid': '76561198171859974', 'num_games_owned': 908, 'num_reviews': 8, 'playtime_forever': 231, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 231, 'last_played': 1624241573}
review:
it's an odd game with janky mechanics, but i gotta stick up for it. this game's got heart.

i've played a lot of hidden object games, and Sinister City deviates from many standards of the genre. the cursor never changes when it's over something you can interact with, which leads to a lot of aimless clicking just to figure out what you can actually do. it also has trouble starting in Windows 10 (there's a topic in discussions that tells you how to get around this) and is buggy in places, but restarting the game made it work again for me.

once i got used to it, though, i realized that its story is also unusual for a hidden object game - we know they tend to be cheesy, sometimes unwittingly so. but Sinister City revels in the cheese, yet doesn't try too hard, and has surprisingly good voice acting. it made up for my frustrations with the gameplay with an enjoyably camp experience. recommended if you like b-movie horror aesthetic that doesn't take itself too seriously.

author: {'steamid': '76561198194167174', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 223, 'playtime_forever': 300, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 300, 'last_played': 1623656623}
review:
So uh... I enjoyed this one more than I thought I would. I saw the reviews thinking "eh well ####" but after enjoying it I wanted to write a short review myself.
The dialog made me smile and groan out loud with how cheesy it can be but all in a good way. I enjoyed the independent vibe from it all and most of the character models actually looked alright, it feels like it had some effort put in and I appreciate it. The gameplay was fun for what it is, it doesn't punish you for clicking too much and the varied puzzles were a nice addition. 

One main thing though, yes bugs could be possible, I had 2. I couldn't start the game until I checked a discussion post explaining the short steps to make it run for Windows 10. Then I had an issue where I couldn't exit to another scene but by exiting to the menu then continuing it fixed it. I played on advanced difficulty and these are the only two problems I had. 

Overall I had a good time.

review: This is a short fun game. I started the game with tutorial on. It was overly helpful. When searching or figuring things out, it shows you the answer almost immediately, through the whole game, without giving you any time to figure it out for yourself. Midway, I remembered I could turn tutorial off, and did, but that did not help.  I will play this game in the future, when it is not so fresh in my mind, without the tutorial.

author: {'steamid': '76561198318172864', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 424, 'playtime_forever': 162, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 162, 'last_played': 1613246448}
review:
This game was a riot. I'm not sure what platform it came out on, but I'm guessing phone, as the instructions to tap anywhere are still there. Set on easy mode the game almost plays itself. There are sparkles that come in handy on fetch quests and the hint in the hidden object scenes actually shows you where an item is and gives you time to move your mouse there.

It was actually relaxing, and kind of fun to race the helpful sparkles, even if they came in handy. The game is obviously meant to be silly, so if you are looking for frightening horror, keep looking. But this was campy fun that felt like watching a play put on by a small but scrappy troupe.

author: {'steamid': '76561198086469959', 'num_games_owned': 893, 'num_reviews': 528, 'playtime_forever': 278, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 278, 'last_played': 1612895773}

author: {'steamid': '76561197993914121', 'num_games_owned': 1120, 'num_reviews': 65, 'playtime_forever': 164, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 164, 'last_played': 1612135673}
review: For 79p this is a bargain.  It's a silly, funny story but the gameplay may not be what most people would expect from a HOPA.  It looks like a point and click game, but really each location has 3 hidden object scenes to interact with.  They are decent enough, but the game was obviously designed for an aspect ratio other than 16:9, so there is a bit of stretching.  That being said, the cheesy humour definitely made me laugh and that made the game worth it overall.

author: {'steamid': '76561198024285164', 'num_games_owned': 965, 'num_reviews': 17, 'playtime_forever': 214, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 214, 'last_played': 1600451144}
review:
Sinister City ist ein kleiner Adventure Happen f√ºr zwischendurch ohne Anspruch auf eine super tolle Story, richtig knackige R√§tsel oder gar viel Freiheit f√ºr den Spieler.
Warum trotzdem den Daumen hoch?
Ganz einfach - wenn man das Spiel im Sale f√ºr knapp 2,- bekommt und daf√ºr 1,5 bis 2 Stunden auf der fortgeschrittenen Stufe Spa√ü hat dann ist das in meinen Augen vollkommen ok. Die Suchbilder sind fair gestaltet, ab und zu hat man auch mal ein Grinsen im Gesicht und die R√§tsel sind recht einfach. Nur das Endr√§tsel hat mich ein wenig aufgehalten, aber das mag an der Art des R√§tsels liegen.
Ansonsten kann man auch die 17 Errungenschaften erlangen ohne unbedingt zweimal durchspielen zu m√ºssen - wenn man direkt den Fortgeschrittenen Modus nutzt.
Zusammengefasst: Wenn ihr es im Sale bekommt, sowieso nur wenig Zeit habt und trotzdem mal ein Spiel durchspielen wollt und auf Suchbilder und kleine R√§tsel steht - dann ist das kein Fehlkauf.

author: {'steamid': '76561198033388937', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 294, 'playtime_forever': 249, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 249, 'last_played': 1600150130}
review:
An older, and somewhat unusual HOPA game.  I played through the casual mode with only one very minor bug that required me to go out to the main menu and then back in again.  I lost no data and all my achievements triggered correctly both in-game and in Steam.  The puzzles/games are definitely on the easy side.

The most unusual feature of the game is that HO "scenes" work differently than in most HOPA games.  In Sinister City, there are a few random objects that can be picked up as you go, but generally you are asked to perform a task (for example, fix an air conditioner), and then you have to search the area for the pieces listed.  The area can be as large as 2 screens with each screen having 2-3 places (boxes, junk piles, wardrobes etc.) to search.  The cursor does NOT change shape, which makes the situation more challenging.

I strongly recommend playing on Casual mode first, just to get a feel for the game, and because the sparkles for key features is important until you're used to the mechanics.  I disliked the way it worked at first, but later found it a nice change from the norm.  Each major area has at least one HO scene that has both a word list and objects from the "task". In each case, the word list must be completed to uncover the last of the missing task objects (which may be screws, ladder rungs, etc.).  HO scenes are suited to the location.

The game is actually quite funny.  As the story progresses, you realize that the whole thing is a satire.  While the humour doesn't always hit its mark, overall, it's not bad.  There are small homages to the genre (vampire fiction and movies) scattered throughout the game.

Overall:  Better than I expected, though clearly an older game.  I ended up being quite happy with my fifty cent purchase (it was 50% off in the bundle).  Go in with moderate expectations and take it for the deliberately cheesy set-up that it is.

author: {'steamid': '76561197998985381', 'num_games_owned': 1678, 'num_reviews': 173, 'playtime_forever': 93, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 9, 'last_played': 1598629888}
review:
Several technical issues:

- The game assumes a 4:3 and will be stretched (distorted) to whatever display size you have.
- The game can be toggled to windowed mode, but the window can't be resized. (But you can force-resize it using some external tool, such as "Sizer" from "Brian Apps".)
- The game will auto-select a font size based on your display height or something. If it gets the font size wrong, you're stuck with very tiny unreadable text or with very large text that goes outside the game area.
- Similar to the font issue, the clickable areas might also be at the wrong location or non-working.
- The game will crash before the main menu if your steam display name has non-latin characters.
- The developers will not go back to this old game to fix or change anything. If the authors don't care, why should you?

Will this game work on your computer? That's a gamble.

If you manage to actually play the game, what do you get? Well, a mediocre hidden object game. Some objects are hidden behind others. How do you know you can move some of those objects? You don't! They look exactly like everything else! But after a while a "hint spark" will show up.

Oh, and after a while you might hit some game-breaking bug that prevents you from continuing.

And I've read reports that if you start a new game, your previously earned achievements become un-earned.

Seriously, avoid this game.

author: {'steamid': '76561198004190775', 'num_games_owned': 545, 'num_reviews': 22, 'playtime_forever': 228, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 228, 'last_played': 1598286301}
review:
It's a neutral yes....it is pure B-movie corny cheeeseeeyyyy plot. 
Do not buy this expecting a serious and story rich game...it just isn't that. But given its price, it made a welcome change to other HOG games. 
A bit of light-hearted fun.

The bird drawing/animation is hysterically bad...it made me laugh at just how bad it was.

Puzzles are way to easy, more suited to a child maybe?
It was easy enough to complete in about an hour (i did complete it several times to finish achievements)

ONLY problem is the game glitched 3 out of 4 times at same spot...when you've put the clock back together and the mirrow breaks, it wont let you select any of the 'search areas' or move to next scene. All 3 times i had to reload the game and it was then fine.

A game for when you're not taking life too seriously !

author: {'steamid': '76561198088535177', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 90, 'playtime_forever': 177, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 177, 'last_played': 1597306417}
review:
Okay, this is a HOG, but it feels more like a short old school Point&Click, and I mean really short, 3 hours and I procrastinated. This game is good and bad all at once and it is hilarious. It is different than others in both story line and game play. Some graphics are a bit off and at one point I had to restart the game to fix an issue. 

This game is quirky, refreshing, and really funny. It sure earned a spot among my favorites.

author: {'steamid': '76561198412682545', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 29, 'playtime_forever': 123, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 123, 'last_played': 1597168602}
review: I don't get the bad reviews for this game, unless it's from the kind of people who want a vampire killing game or something.  As a Hidden Object Game, it was fun, interesting and enjoyable.  I liked how it was set up, combining a decent story with just the right amount of puzzles to keep it challenging and I loved the cheesiness factor of it.  I think it's an enjoyable HOG and if that's the sort of thing you're into, you won't be disappointed.  If you're looking to hunt vampires, keep going.

author: {'steamid': '76561198053229942', 'num_games_owned': 1399, 'num_reviews': 1091, 'playtime_forever': 237, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 237, 'last_played': 1465499612}

author: {'steamid': '76561197987600149', 'num_games_owned': 2205, 'num_reviews': 256, 'playtime_forever': 376, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 305, 'last_played': 1591752336}
review:
'Sinister City' is one of the earliest entries in Jetdogs Studios point&click games and it shows. The game is extremely rough around the edges, but for .99$ even without a sale it's an enjoyable way to waste an hour or two. I played the series somewhat in reverse order, and it's interesting seeing how streamlined and improved the formula's gotten from Sinister City.

The plot is ridiculous, which feels a little bit like King's Quest taken another step or two into out and out parody. It's fun, though a bit frustrating due to its rough edges.

review:
Dieses Wimmelbildspiel ist ein Handyport, welches man aber abgesehen von einem gro√üz√ºgigen "Klickbereich" und einem Minigame welches definitiv auf Touch und nicht auf klick ausgelegt war, nicht gemerkt wird.
Auch die kleineren Bugs, welche meist durch ins "Hauptmen√º zur√ºck gehen und weiter spielen" behoben waren, sind verschmerzbar. 
Die Spielzeit ist bei zirka 2 stunden sehr kurz (musste schnell vom PC weg und dadurch stimmt meine zeit leider nicht ganz)
Es hat einen "unschuldigen" Humor.
Die 99 Cent war es wert.

author: {'steamid': '76561198030784015', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 11207, 'playtime_forever': 38, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 38, 'last_played': 1587225792}
review:
This is a point and click adventure with a horror theme as you explore a mystery in a vampire town.  The game features 3D rendered characters on 2D backgrounds.  Click on things, use items in your inventory, and solve puzzles.

While the game may have had potential, the decision to release a 4:3 game in 2014, with fixed resolution, is completely inexplicable and unacceptable.  If you're still gaming on a 4:3 CRT monitor, by all means go ahead and buy this, it's a bargain at $1.50.   For people not trapped in the past, buy any other game that works in widescreen.

author: {'steamid': '76561197990539606', 'num_games_owned': 494, 'num_reviews': 13, 'playtime_forever': 234, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 234, 'last_played': 1585921802}
review:
Allora questo gioco a me ha fatto morire dal ridere, non so se era fatto di proposito ma la lore del gioco sembra fatta in tono decisamente accattivante in senso ignorante con stereotipi mal interpretati e testi di gioco semplicemente poveri sia a livello di intrattenimento sarcastico che di carisma dei personaggi che non avranno nemmeno il tempo di rimanervi impressi, il che √® un bene, data la durata "fortunatamente" breve del gioco.
Parlando dell'aspetto del gameplay ho visto non di buon occhio l'utilizzo di una grafica 3D a discapito di una grafica non disegnata in questo contesto, pero la nota positiva che devo dare al gioco √® la qualita degli enigmi che seppur non difficili e per nulla impegnativi risultano essere ben pensati e per nulla simili nell'arco del gioco, col senno di poi si intuisce ovviamente che il gioco √® stato volutamente pensato per essere simpatico e non contestualmente serio come vedete nelle immagini quindi nel suo complesso do un voto positivo, ma chiaramente ci sono molti giochi migliori di questo!

author: {'steamid': '76561197970480620', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 262, 'playtime_forever': 199, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 199, 'last_played': 1585752635}
review: After following the instructions in the Discussions to get this game to run, it turns out to be a decent Hidden Object game.  It uses a 3D engine, so the characters are definitely more animated and real than a normal hidden object game.  The scenes are 3D as well.  The hidden object scenes are pretty static.

author: {'steamid': '76561198153492827', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 95, 'playtime_forever': 181, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 181, 'last_played': 1585760525}
review: I purchased this game for under $1 on sale.  I enjoyed playing it.  The story line is comical, but enjoyable.  A few glitches, as the graphics aren't great.  I just quit the game and started it again and the glitch disappeared.  I did not lose any of my game as it auto saves when you quit.  The puzzles are easy, but fun.

author: {'steamid': '76561197971838196', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 356, 'playtime_forever': 118, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 118, 'last_played': 1583862728}
review:
Spielwertung: 6/10

Eines der seltsamsten Spiele im Wimmelbild-Sektor, die man wohl spielen kann.

- F√ºr ein Spiel von 2014 sieht es ziemlich furchtbar aus, vor allem in den ersten 10 Min, danach gew√∂hnt man sich schnell daran.
- Anfangs glaubt man auch, dass durch die klobigen Zeichnungen √ºberall "Bugs" w√§ren, z.B. beim Verlassen von John im Hotel. Ist aber alles nur optisch und da die Optik sowieso gruslig ist, passend zum Setting, who cares.
- Das Spiel ist mit 2 Stunden auf leicht (hatte erst schwer gestartet, aber nach 5 Min meine Meinung bei dem Farbmatsch ge√§ndert...) sehr, sehr, sehr kurz. Die markierten Stellen haben tats√§chlich hin und wieder geholfen, sonst w√§re wohl noch mehr Klicken und Zeit draufgegangen. 
- Die Story ist wirklich... individuell... im Kino w√ºrde man sagen, sie ist so trashig, dass es beinahe schon wieder gute Kunst ist. √úberzeugt euch selbst davon. 
- Wimmelbilder und R√§tsel sind mittel bis leicht. 
- Vertonung auf Englisch passt, √úbersetzungen sind solide.

Fazit: Mit Sicherheit nicht das Beste Jetdogs Spiel, aber aufgrund des offensichtlichen Alters durchaus akzeptabel. Wer das Game irgendwo gratis dazu bekommt, kann ruhig die 2 Stunden Spielzeit in Kauf nehmen. Ob man sich das Spiel kaufen muss, bleibt wohl dahingestellt...

review: Fun, campy, hidden object game!  This is for those who can enjoy humor on the ridiculous side, and don't mind the occasionally hilariously bad graphics.  The mechanics are a bit odd, but once I figured out if I stopped clicking the next thing I needed to do would sparkle they did not disrupt game play for me.

author: {'steamid': '76561197960931103', 'num_games_owned': 483, 'num_reviews': 213, 'playtime_forever': 151, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 150, 'last_played': 1578682423}
review:
[b]Pros[/b]
+60FPS
+Purposefully cheesy
+Easy story to follow

[b]Cons[/b]
+Buggy
+Short! (under 3 hours)
+Needed a better PC port

Sinister City is a purposely cheesy, bizarre and short hidden object game. The story revolves around your fianc√© getting kidnapped by a vampire and you must save her. In your playthrough, you help a character with a task (fix an air conditioner, find tea bags, find floppy disks, etc) and then you can progress the story. Rinse and repeat. 

First off, you can clearly see this is a mobile port. Not a negative, but there wasn‚Äôt enough work put into the PC port. During the HO scenes, the clickable area for an object is big. There is also no click penalty for spamming the screen. Most likely leftover remnants from just ‚Äútapping‚Äù on your tablet or phone. 

The game knows it‚Äôs cheesy. It has bad jokes and terrible voice acting. However, it has a charm to it that I liked.

Echoing the other reviewers, this game has some bugs. Luckily, I only encountered one. After putting the clock together, I couldn‚Äôt click anywhere to go. The fix is to simply exit to the Main Menu and Continue your game again. I also had 1 screen where a while box appeared instead of an item. 

The HO scenes themselves are ok. I would say they are of average detail but most scenes are washed out and dark. The items are generally easy to find. One big issue in the scenes is that there‚Äôs no cursor difference when hovering over an object that moves. For example, a typical HOG will switch from a pointer to a hand to signal something you can interact with. In Sinister City, this doesn‚Äôt happen. So, you end up clicking around on all the major objects on the screen until one of them slides out of the way to reveal what you were really looking for. 

The puzzles are not very challenging and are all self-explanatory. 

The graphics and sound are below average and look pretty dated for 2014. I did enjoy the actual 3D modeling though. Typically, hidden object games are just 2D. 


[b]Conclusion[/b]
I can‚Äôt help but recommend this game, even at a 5/10. It won‚Äôt take up much of your time and you‚Äôll get a laugh or two.

[b]5/10[/b] Average

author: {'steamid': '76561198135380739', 'num_games_owned': 575, 'num_reviews': 77, 'playtime_forever': 39359, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 39359, 'last_played': 1460888811}

author: {'steamid': '76561198068169042', 'num_games_owned': 1435, 'num_reviews': 135, 'playtime_forever': 131, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 131, 'last_played': 1575033578}
review:
The game is generally good. There are some funny moments. What is what a vampire wants the most? To Suck blood? Or to be a movie star? Despite the idea of the story is quite good, the specific steps are a little repetitive. It is usually necessary to find three spots in the places, and to find objects and some HO. And then next step or some minigame. It is not boring but a little repetitive. Graphics is not so bad. HOS are darker and a little gray. My game experience is quite good but I could not finished the game because I could not click the last bulb in a HOS. I saw the bulb (it was behind a moved stone), it shined, but I could not clicked it.
My general recomendation is NO. The funny story and graphics is quite good. I could not finish the game because of the defect and from discussions I understand that devs are not so suportive. The game is old so I partly understand.
YES only for HOG enthusiasts and collectors. Maybe the game will work for you.

author: {'steamid': '76561198223274944', 'num_games_owned': 403, 'num_reviews': 53, 'playtime_forever': 130, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 130, 'last_played': 1569649700}
review:
Sinister City es uno de esos juegos que es tan malo que es bueno, sobre todo por los di√°logos y el gui√≥n general que son bien estilo pel√≠cula cutre. Los puzzles y escenas de objetos escondidos son MUY sencillos, al punto de que yo, que suelo saltearme varios puzzles en los juegos cl√°sicos de objetos escondidos por vagancia, en este juego me saltee solo uno.
Se le puede sacar como mucho dos horas de juego y tiene la misma rejugabilidad que cualquiera de su g√©nero. Los gr√°ficos est√°n sorprendentemente bien comparados con el resto, la banda sonora es muy repetitiva y tambi√©n bastante mala, pero no suficientemente mala para que sea desagradable, porque, como digo, este es uno de esos juegos que ganan cierta comicidad en lo malos que son, algo as√≠ como la pel√≠cula The Room de Wiseau, que es tan mala que la gente la adora.
Para el precio que tiene es recomendable para pasar unas dos horas bastante entretenidas. Incluso lo rejugar√≠a por las risas.

author: {'steamid': '76561198202529859', 'num_games_owned': 1686, 'num_reviews': 2354, 'playtime_forever': 108, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 108, 'last_played': 1569470035}
review:
I am glad I ignored the negative reviews for this game, This is a misunderstood game. It was never intended to be a serious blood and gore vampire game, It was a satire on the whole vampire thing, and I found that refreshing. It was also corny like a 1950 B movie, which I believe was done intentionally. There is a lot of comedy in the game. I also liked the fact that the achievements were easy to obtain for a change. The game was also short in length which I consider a plus. I get tired of these epic 100 hour plus games that developers seem fond of creating lately.
If you want a relaxing game that offers amusement and won't take weeks to complete then you will like this game.

author: {'steamid': '76561198011391152', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 15, 'playtime_forever': 253, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 253, 'last_played': 1568749578}
review:
If you like satire, this is the game for you.  This game is a satire on the Hidden Object Game genre.  But it is so cringe worthy, I had to take breaks before I could continue to play.  I swear I spent half of my playtime leaving the game up and running while I took a break.

Or, this could just be a really horrible game.  Really up to you.

author: {'steamid': '76561198014926595', 'num_games_owned': 775, 'num_reviews': 967, 'playtime_forever': 362, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 362, 'last_played': 1595789227}
review:
(This game was provided to me by the user Dom.  Thanks, bro!)

[h1]The name is sinister, but is this game?[/h1]

[i]Sinister City[/i] is a pretty basic hidden object / point-and-click game that one could assume is horror from the get-go, but in reality, it's more fluff than snuff and is well-suited for all ages (that's how light it is).  The whole goal is to find a way to free your fiancee from a vampire...but with an interesting twist that will throw you for a loop and (at that same moment) throw all elements of horror out the window.

The hidden object portions are decent, but the point-and-click areas don't feel too refined.  The areas look good, but the character models often behave like things you'd expect from a Unity made title.  The models themselves look fine, but just behave primitively.  Though, my biggest complaint is the achievement system which has one element to listen to every piece of dialogue (you cannot skip even when they're one syllable away from finishing...or even before they finish their breath) and all achievements are tied to your playthrough.  Meaning that if you load up a new file, all your achievements will be wiped.  But if you load up your old completed file, you'll be instantly granted all your achievements again.  Keep that in mind when hunting for achievements (that said, if you're hunting for achievements, you should boot it up on the hardest difficulty to avoid this frustration of replaying the game multiple times).

In terms of difficulty, this game is actually quite simple.  Though there are a few slightly frustrating areas in terms of puzzles while some objects feel well hidden.  If you end up getting stuck, there's always your local YouTube, but the solutions are simple when you figure them out.

Basically, I enjoyed a fair chunk of [i]Sinister City[/i] and only hesitate to replay it due to that achievement bug that ties all of your Steam achievements to a single playthrough.  If that sort of thing bugs you, you might want to avoid this game.  But if you do end up playing [i]Sinister City[/i], you'll be enjoying about 3-4 hours of a hidden object / point-and-click game.  Speedrunning takes about 60-90 minutes (if listening to all the dialogue), so....really you're looking at about 1-4 hours of gameplay with this title for only $1.  A fair price for what you're getting.  I recommend trying this one out.

6/10  A well-made game, but in need of quite a bit of refinement and a few personal edits.

author: {'steamid': '76561198015593653', 'num_games_owned': 2645, 'num_reviews': 50, 'playtime_forever': 167, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 167, 'last_played': 1566544915}
review: I played a lot of HOGs already and not only games from Artifex Mundy but other studios as well. This one is by far the worst I played so far. The graphics is crappy but mainly dialogues have to be listened / skipped one by one as there's no continuality in discussion. The plot isn't bad but so lame "visit psychiatrist - you need books to impress her (HOG) - enter her office - you need to look for cards (HOG) - she says 2 sentences - I need tea (HOG) - she say one sentence - I need pills (minigame) - she say two sentences - I need positive energy (HOG)" and so on.. While on the map, there's no change of cursor or indication what is interactive feature and what's not so you just click madly around the screen when you miss certain object and in the end game even glitched in the beginning not letting me leave / interact with anything prompting me to game reset. I finished it for achievements but I did NOT have fun. Strongly recommend looking for a different HOG game.

author: {'steamid': '76561198845717264', 'num_games_owned': 366, 'num_reviews': 196, 'playtime_forever': 358, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 358, 'last_played': 1563401567}
review:
The gameplay could have been better, but I‚Äôll give it a thumbs up because I was amused by the story. I thought that the story alone was definitely worth at least the 49 cents I paid. Your mileage might vary as to whether you find the story funny or just stupid, but either way, the game isn‚Äôt scary and it isn‚Äôt meant to be taken that seriously. Some people had trouble with glitches, but I have Windows 10 and I didn‚Äôt have any problems running this game and getting all the achievements. 

The gameplay is mainly two different types of hidden object puzzles. The first type is the hidden object list where you get a list of objects to find on one screen. This seems to be the most popular type of hidden object puzzle. The second type is fragmented objects where you have to find fragments of the same object scattered in different rooms. For example, finding all the pieces of a broken mirror. This part is like a point and click adventure. I think a good hidden object puzzle should have objects that you can actually spot if you look hard enough. Unfortunately, some objects were covered by other objects. I recall that one object was hidden under a hat. Technically, it was ‚Äúhidden‚Äù, but I think it would be more accurately described as ‚Äúcovered.‚Äù If I have no reason to suppose that there is anything under a hat, then it‚Äôs not a fair puzzle and just becomes a game of ‚Äúfind the hotspots.‚Äù Fortunately, the easy level has sparkles to show you where an object might be found if it is covered. The sparkles even indicate if you should go to another room. This might make it too easy for some, but I actually wanted to find out how the plot was resolved. I finished the game twice. First on easy, then on advanced in order to get the last achievement. I‚Äôd recommend that order if you‚Äôre trying to get all the achievements.

author: {'steamid': '76561198165806851', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 27, 'playtime_forever': 152, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 152, 'last_played': 1562433461}
review: Why have point and click adventure games devolved into this? The plot is really simple. The main character's fiance is captured by a vampire, who turns out to be her father. So the man has to win her freedom or win her father's acceptance. The game starts as an adventure game but it quickly becomes "find a thing in a closet" type of game. It tries to be funny, making parody out of human/vampire love genre, but it really is not. Some of the backgrounds paintings are nice, especially the psychic landscape inspired by Dali's works. Some puzzles are fun. But the overall game is not worth playing. There are also bugs. Sometimes locations in the  game become blank, and you need to restart the gamplay. Not a good choice.

author: {'steamid': '76561198132471057', 'num_games_owned': 1274, 'num_reviews': 84, 'playtime_forever': 379, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 379, 'last_played': 1560694748}
review:
This was honestly a surprise, but in a good way! The story is really funny and is meant to be campy, there were really hilarious moments and lines. It's shorter than your average HOG, about an hour of gameplay if you're really good at finding things.

I don't recommend playing on advanced unless you want the achievement. The lack of sparkles really slowed down my progress since I didn't know which spots had HOs and extra close-up scenes. I was basically clicking all over the place.

The HO scenes had pretty decent graphics but again, the items were kinda messy. Feels like a garbage dump in some of them with random fruits and stuff inside places where they shouldn't be there.

It's super cheap, but for how short it is, for once it's priced just right. JetDogs' other HOGs are a lot longer for the same price so I recommend playing those more if you're just after gameplay, they were a lot more polished and navigating was a lot easier. If you just want a hearty laugh, I'd say you should give this game a go!

That being said, it is kind of glitchy so be warned. If you think you're trapped or your mouse clicks are doing things it's not supposed to, I recommend closing the game and opening it back up again, it hasn't failed me yet.

author: {'steamid': '76561198042620952', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 1382, 'playtime_forever': 183, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 183, 'last_played': 1558448150}
review:
[h1] Genre [/h1] Ein Point & Click Hidden Object Adventure

[h1] Story [/h1] Unsere Zuk√ºnftige Braut wurde von einem Vampir entf√ºhrt und zu einer Stadt namens "Sinister City" gebracht. Wir m√ºssen nun alles in unserer Macht stehende tun um unsere Herzensdame zur√ºckzuholen.

[h1] Gameplay [/h1] Es ist ein sehr simples Hidden Object Spiel wo wir Gegenst√§nde finden und zwischendurch mal ein Minispiel l√∂sen m√ºssen, die ebenfalls sehr simpel sind. Die Draufsicht wie man sie in Point & Click Adventuren kennt ist hier total unn√∂tig und man h√§tte es genauso gut in der First Person Ansicht machen k√∂nnen weil wir sowieso nur Wimmelbildszenen und Minispiele l√∂sen und keine Objekte kombinieren oder sonst irgendwie typische Point & Click Sachen.

[h1] Achievements [/h1] Es gibt insgesamt 17 Erfolge. Man bekommt alle sehr einfach in einem Durchgang, wenn man das Spiel im Fortgeschrittenen Modus spielt, keine Hinweise benutzt & keine Dialoge √ºberspringt

[h1] Pro/Contra [/h1]
+ Musik OK
+ Voice Acting OK
+ Sound OK
+ G√ºnstig
+ Sammelkarten
+ Achievements

[h1] Fazit [/h1] Ein Kurzes Mittelm√§√üiges Hidden Object Adventure, aber f√ºr den Preis von 0,99 Cent kann man sich nicht beschweren

review:
This game is a bundle of stupidity and absurdity and is all the better for it.  The story is dumb.  The scenarios are dumb.  The voice acting is junk.

But both in spite and because of this, it all comes together for an absolutely enjoyable time.  It's a buck and worth it at twice the price (but only pay a buck for it.)

author: {'steamid': '76561198197234309', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 197, 'playtime_forever': 957, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 957, 'last_played': 1558381424}
review: It's cheap, but annoyingly broken. Sixteen hours into it because one achievement is broken and the devs will not fix it. Told me I got it every playthrough and showed up in my activity feed but not in the list. Tried every way I could think of to get it and it wasn't till someone said exit the game as soon as it pops and sure enough that got it. The broken achievement is called, somewhat ironically, attention to detail. lol. Other than that the game isn't bad. Pretty short but what do you expect for a buck. Buy it if you want. I enjoyed it except for the glitch. but you can know there is a workaround to it so you won't get quite as frustrated as me. Overall 5/10... not bad, but not good either.

author: {'steamid': '76561198164016063', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 333, 'playtime_forever': 156, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 86, 'last_played': 1556398893}
review:
pros

+ nice looking graphics and character models
+ music was very relaxing.
+ there is no penalty for blind clicking. 
+ game's story not bad one
+ there are some cheesy jokes and humorous moments
+ puzzles are mostly enjoyable and easy. 
+ voice acting is good
+ game drops tradings cards
+ there are steam achievements
+ there is auto save
+ two difficulty options
+ hint system helpful
+ game is cheap

cons

- game is little bit buggy. Sometimes you have to exit to the main menu and re enter the game to be able to proceed. 
- often times it is not really easy to spot which areas on the screen are accessible and hidden object scenes.
- when you complete finding items in a scene (when you found all objects) there will be no indication that there is nothing left to find.
- Some glitches (floating characters on pre rendered graphics)
- game is short
- The game seemed to have very little polish 

overall, this game is a mixed bag.  it's not easy to decide whether to recommend this game or not.  I don‚Äôt think it‚Äôs a bad game but not good game, either but I would recommend Sinister City. It's short, it's cheap, and give some enjoyment.

author: {'steamid': '76561198013130865', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 88, 'playtime_forever': 117, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 117, 'last_played': 1542507659}
review:
In short, yeah - it's worth a try at 0.99 cents.

"Sinister City" is a really weird experience. It took me about 15 minutes of "What the ____?" situations before I realized, "Oh, they are trying to be funny!" Once I shifted my frame of reference from "A crazy person made this game." to "Whoever made this game tried to make it humorous."  I was able to just accept the weirdness. It did not make me laugh, but at least I understood the attempt.

This is not a good entry into the hidden object genre because there is no penalty for blind clicking. In fact, you will need to do that on many scenes to shift things out of the way so that you can access concealed objects. The puzzles are slightly better than the hidden object scenes, but are still among the simplest in this genre (and that is saying something). It almost feels like this was supposed to be a kind of "Monkey Island"-esque comedy adventure game but the budget got cut, so the scraps from the pre-alpha were turned into a hidden object game at the last minute.

I will recommend this for hidden object game players who like weird, goofy humor. It is a complete and functional game that should give casual players a few hours of simple diversion. I found no bugs and encountered no crashes. The achievements are easy to obtain, but I am not sitting through this again to get the one I missed - not skipping through the dialogue. It's not my fault it can be read so much faster than it can be (hammily) spewed.

author: {'steamid': '76561198034530531', 'num_games_owned': 4365, 'num_reviews': 236, 'playtime_forever': 312, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 312, 'last_played': 1542059095}

[h1]A fuir de toute urgence.[/h1]

Dans ce jeu, rien ne va. S'il y a une volont√© de changer des HOG "classiques" (Artifex et compagnie), le truc est d'une lenteur insuportable.  Son graphisme a facile 15 ans de retard, les √©nigmes sont d'une facilit√© d√©concertantes, et les SOC brouillonnes au possible, avec, en prime, des bonnes erreurs de traduction ("Palmier" pour une emprunte de main, "Ombre" pour fard √† paupi√®re...) C'est rempli de bugs graphiques (affichages de gros carr√©s dans les SOC, "blancs" √† des endroits improbables...) et il faut parfois recharger plusieurs fois le jeu pour que √ßa fonctionne.  Bref, aucun int√©r√™t, m√™me si vous aimez les vampires. Il y a un certain humour (le mec qui s'arr√™te sur la route/la carte pour commander un burger par exemple), mais √ßa marche pas.

author: {'steamid': '76561198027267313', 'num_games_owned': 1838, 'num_reviews': 4460, 'playtime_forever': 170, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 170, 'last_played': 1528931750}
review:
Tags: Adventure - WC - Hidden Object
Additional Tags: Delete Local Content & Remove from Library

TLDR: Broken hotspots and stuck progression. Cannot leave scene early game. Ruins a cheesy but polished haloween game with easy puzzles and hints.

I was kind of mentally riffing on this game on easy mode, trying to zoom through it as fast as possible to see the content. Was kind of surprised by how closely it ressembles a point and click adventure game. With a character model walking around, some voiced dialogue and surprisingly polished visuals. The hidden object scenes did not ask for too many items at once, the hint system recharged fast and had a funny Looney Tunes type sound effect when activated and you could literally machine gun the screen with clicks with no penalty.

Was a nice change of pace, the really cheesy writing had zero credibility but also helped give the game some charm. Unfortunately very early on while I was still being ushered in the Hotel by the clerk, I got teased by a vampire that I would be trapped in the dreamworld and even though the engine would flash at which hotspot I had to activate next, and the hint system was still functionning and showing me items within that hotspot I had to go fetch, the game would not register the activation of said hotspot.

I could not click any other hotspot either, or click to navigate to a different screen even though there were other ones that I had previously been to and had been going to and from back and forth. The game was not frozen either. This was at the - Repair the Mirror- objective.

As such the game is more or less unplayable, and even if it did work, the novelty of the cheesy writing would had eventually run off and the puzzles were not engaging enough despite some occasional trippy looking scenes to really warrant soldiering on. With the bugs on top this makes it a no brainer.

Delete local content permanently and hiding from library for declutter.

author: {'steamid': '76561198045005161', 'num_games_owned': 1913, 'num_reviews': 90, 'playtime_forever': 370, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 370, 'last_played': 1526125546}
review:
This is a pretty good Hidden Object Game. I've played better ones but on the other hand it's only 99 cents, making it one of the cheaper HOG games out there. 

The longer I played this game the more I liked it. Sinister City has a quirky sense of humor mixed in with a Vampire B-movie satire type story which kept it fun.

 The narration is done alright along with the sounds and music. The graphics are fine, not great, but good for the price. A minor point is that I could not change the screen solution to 1920x1080 which didn't help the graphics of the game. So I suggest playing it in windowed mode on wider screens.

The hidden object items are pretty difficult to find, sometimes the items you are looking for is really hidden too well (black item in a black background) or sometimes badly described giving it an extra level of difficulty. 

Also when you complete finding items in a scene (when you found all objects) there will be no indication that there is nothing left to find, while later in the game you even have to   backtrack to the same scenes to find more items. So that adds another little level of difficulty. Good thing there is a hint button. The other puzzles are pretty straight forward and fun. 

If you are new at Hidden Object games I suggest you try another easier HOG game first. If you play HOG's 24/7 this one will give you a good challenge.  

All in all, it's a good game for 99 cents with about 2 to 3 hours of fun, depending on how often you click that hint button. 

Good
+ Cheap (especially on sale)
+ Finding some items are challenging
+ Good narration
+ Fun B-movie story
+ Achievements
+ Steam trading cards 
+ 2 difficulty modes

Bad:
+ Cannot change resolution
+ Some glitches (floating characters)
+ Some puzzles could be more difficult


15 minute gameplay so you get a good impression of the game:
https://youtu.be/ziK5Q-4ixjA

author: {'steamid': '76561198067002281', 'num_games_owned': 1066, 'num_reviews': 51, 'playtime_forever': 293, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 293, 'last_played': 1525816015}
review:
In Iron Man 3 when it turned out that the Mandarin was actually[spoiler]a down & out actor named Trevor Slattery[/spoiler]I was pretty p***ed off to say the least. This is because they ruined this character's first silver screen appearance by making a mockery of him. Dracula though has long since been overused making appearances in books, movies, and HOGs probably somewhere around the thousands at this point, so it was nice to see him in a different role for a change. This combined with the game's cheesy jokes are what tipped this review to the more positive end for me, because lord knows after I encountered a game breaking bug about a third of the way through the game during a cutscene of all places I was ready to hit that dislike button so freaking quick. I didn't though, because this game's unique twist, dad jokes, and poorly dubbed dialogue made this game memorable for me.

Plus with coming in at ¬£0.79 it's the same price as all those sh**ty achievement spam games. Only here you're getting a point & click/hidden object game with a decent enough story played out to you with the help of voice actors. It's an all around good time no thinking required and sometimes that's exactly what you need.

review: A slightly bellow average HOG, but one of the most entertaining ones I have played. Think "The Room".

review: With the best in the price range. In general, the Jetdog hidden object games in the price range are almost undefeated. Otherwise there is mostly thrash in the 49 cents area. Really absurdly strange and somehow amusing story.

author: {'steamid': '76561198194518970', 'num_games_owned': 7176, 'num_reviews': 941, 'playtime_forever': 269, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 269, 'last_played': 1522521513}
review:
Cerca de 2h de juego, es una comedia basicamente, esta muy bien para el precio que tiene, con traducion includa y cromos genial para pasar un rato.

Para poder jugar sigue estos pasos:

Biblioteca, buscas el juego,boton secundario y propiedades, ver archivos locales, buscas la aplicacion ".exe.", le das boton secundario propiedades, pestalla compativilidad, windows xp service pack 3, y activamos la casilla "invalidad el comportamiento de ajuste PPP alto" aplicar e aceptar.

author: {'steamid': '76561197978350645', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 126, 'playtime_forever': 258, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 135, 'last_played': 1626855877}
review: I didn't like this game at first, but it definitely grew on me over the two hours it took to complete it. The writing and voice acting is quite good (relative to the typical standard for HOGs), and I liked how the game took the tired "evil spirits/vampires" trope and tried to do something different with it. Strangely enough I actually think this game would have worked better as a visual novel, since the hidden object scenes were the least enjoyable part of the game for me, whereas the story held my interest and had me smiling by the end.

author: {'steamid': '76561197993803638', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 50, 'playtime_forever': 213, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 213, 'last_played': 1514614899}
review:
Oh my god this game is terrible. I started this game on Easy and it was too difficult to play.

The basics of these type of games aren't here. The cursor doesn't change so you're can't be expected to know where things are. On Easy, a sparkle with show you interactive/HO areas but I have no idea when that happens. Things are shrouded in darkness (and/or blurry) that even moving my head around didn't help. Some objects were miscolored too. HO scenes don't close when finished. Some interactive objects only work when you've progressed the story but I'll let that slide.

I discovered there [b]are[/b] hints available but they're never shown that they are a feature. That glowing question mark in the bottom-left corner was just background noise to me.

It's both terrible visual and GUI design.

Incomplete clues are present. (Musical) note and (Paper) clip being in the same scene.

You can skip the credits but not the stinger.

I can only hope the bad acting and story were played for comedic effect.

Also, I get "Tap anywhere to continue" prompts which makes it seem like a mobile port.

BUGS! Five times this happened: HO scenes close everytime you click the mouse. Two of which didn't even load in properly! Restarting the game will turn everything back to "normal" 

PROS:
You don't get penalised for multiple clicks, which was the only way I could find most things.
The 3D models aren't terrible.
The comedic moments are nice, especially the credit crawl.

review:
One day, Tommy Wiseau found an old, lost story written by Aldous Huxley. From Huxley's completely off his head on mescalin' period. Tommy thought that this story would make an excellent basis for a lowest common denominator hidden object game. So he made it.

And he was right.

review: Mit das Beste in der Preisklasse. √úberhaupt sind die Jetdog Wimmelbild Spiele in der Preisklasse fast ungeschlagen, Sachen wie Morphopolis. Sonst gibt es im 49 Cent Bereich nur Mist. Die Dinger hier sind zwar auch nicht h√ºbsch, aber immer hin (unfreiwillig?) komisch und warten mit einer meist netten Story auf und die leichten Aufgaben machen ein durchspielen immerhin m√∂glich, was ich gut finde. Das hier ist das Top Jet Dog Wimmelbild Spiel, wenn man mich fragt. Wirklich absurd seltsame und gleichzeitig irgendwie erheiternde Geschichte. Sollte man sich mal tats√§chlich reingezogen haben.

author: {'steamid': '76561198056837040', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 61, 'playtime_forever': 109, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 109, 'last_played': 1510784099}
review:
Sinister City... it's not easy to decide whether to recommend this game or not. Is it cheesy? Yes it is. But it sort of has an explanation for that. Is voice acting sub-par? Yes it is, but again... it sort of makes sense. Is it a point-and-click adventure? Not really. It's a mix between a hidden object game and a point-and-click adventure. I suppose that if you are a fan of the latter, you won't be satisfied (even though there are also puzzles here and there, all extremely easy to solve), and if you are a fan of the former this could probably make you curious about (better) point-and-click adventures, which doesn't do any harm.

So... all in all, I would recommend Sinister City. It's short, it's cheap, and you get what you pay for, but there are some smart ideas behind it.

author: {'steamid': '76561198218094865', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 58, 'playtime_forever': 232, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 232, 'last_played': 1510701148}

author: {'steamid': '76561198037919726', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 59, 'playtime_forever': 135, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 135, 'last_played': 1505949604}
review:
A very good hidden objects and puzzles game with nice story.

+ very good puzzles, not to easy not to hard
+ good doze of humor
+ nicely done hidden objects scenes
+ non-stereotypical story
+ moody graphics

- a little bugy, sometimes locations don't response on clicking, sometimes click everytime get you out of hidden object scene. You must get out to main menu and click continue and everything is fine. 

Overall 7/10

author: {'steamid': '76561198001369245', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 11, 'playtime_forever': 260, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 133, 'last_played': 1573861041}
review:
This was one of those "so bad that it's good" game.

It's hidden object game with some simple puzzles but the plot and weird cheesy humor was so fasciating that I actully liked this game. Then again I love bad movies and jokes so just keep that in mind.
It's a short game so it's just right length before it start getting tideous and repetitive.

for a dollar / euro priced game it's a worth buying and play with group and have fun.

author: {'steamid': '76561198082147294', 'num_games_owned': 1262, 'num_reviews': 33, 'playtime_forever': 236, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 236, 'last_played': 1479607217}
review:
Is it worth playing?
Are you a fan of Hidden Object games? Then yes... but approach with low expectations.
If no, then don't.

This game's story is charming to an extent though a bit too silly to be taken serious at certain points.
The game itself is buggy, your character walks around on top of the background even when he shouldn't, one of the achievmentes involve not skipping a single line of dialogue which is impossible at certain points since you have dialogue that plays without warning during gameplay sequences.
The artwork is decent though items are sometimes hard to notice on the scenario. The low poly models are not distracting and add to the overall theme of the game.

Go with low expectations.

author: {'steamid': '76561198085441094', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 38, 'playtime_forever': 219, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 219, 'last_played': 1500234227}
review:
Cuck Simulator 2014

The story is so bad that the developers had to be more than a little self aware. Collecting some of the items was completely arbitrary. Stopping in the middle of a conversation to make me find coffee supplies? It felt like they were just padding the game with extra stuff to run up play time. There were also a few bugs that I ran into with a missing texture and then toward the end the hidden object scenes would close after one click. Returning to the menu solved the clicking problem.

If you buy this game at steep discount just because you want the achievements or have nothing better to play then it's not that bad. Just be aware of what you're getting yourself into. There was also a whole level that was a pretty tongue-in-cheek jab at psychiatry if you're into that.

author: {'steamid': '76561198016567265', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 5, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 5, 'last_played': 1498426238}
review: I would love to be able to tell you about this game, but I can't. It loads up, and it allows me to select a profile to play (I was able to input a name). Then, inexplicably, I can do no more. The name for the profile becomes the only item the cursor will highlight; nothing else is clickable. When you click this space, it immediately brings up Steam screenshots. Shift tab back to the game, try again- same result. Uninstall, reinstall, same result. Tried on different computers, same thing! What a waste.

author: {'steamid': '76561197972302725', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 10, 'playtime_forever': 355, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 355, 'last_played': 1484353622}
review: It's a generic Hidden Object game wrapped in a poorly animated storyboard. The 3D models are fine, the quirky storyline is fine, what isn't fine is the below average voice acting. It's not bad enough to be good (a la Resident Evil from 1996), it's just bad. I managed to slink my way through this game in almost 6 hours, because I had to replay the game twice to get that last achievement to pop. As far as shovelware Hidden Object games go, though, this one tries an animated story but doesn't quite make it.

author: {'steamid': '76561198071375554', 'num_games_owned': 2813, 'num_reviews': 401, 'playtime_forever': 195, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 195, 'last_played': 1496022995}
review:
I don't know where to start with this game. I don't care much about the graphics if the game has a good story, but this game doesn't have both! The story is awful and I mean it is awful! The whole thing is really bad man! The dialogue, the voice acting, the characters design, the reason behind the kidnapping.. so childish. I'm just so glad it didn't take long to finish since I wanted to be fair and finish the game because 'perhaps' it'll get better at the end, but nope.
http://steamcommunity.com/sharedfiles/filedetails/?id=935160878

And one of the worst things in this game that you start without knowing where to go, what to do, and when the hidden objects scene starts and when it should end! You have to click 'back' in each scene once you are done from it, and perhaps you are not even done so you'll have to go back there and search for more. I've encountered different glitches during my gameplay too.
http://steamcommunity.com/sharedfiles/filedetails/?id=935120908

Pros:
+Fast travel map.
+Steam achievements.

Cons:
-Bad story
-Bad graphics.
-Bad music (it gave me a headache, especially the main menu music made me really dizzy!)
-Very bad and cheesy dialogue, none of them made me laugh.
-Bad ending.
-No replay value.

I would never recommend this game even to my worst enemy.

author: {'steamid': '76561198043642717', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 79, 'playtime_forever': 188, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 188, 'last_played': 1440626440}
review:
Achievements: All possible and easy-- though missable.  Multiple playthroughs may be necessary, but it's a very short game.

+Silly, B-Movie plot
+Cheap(especially on sale)
+Has cards
+Does not take itself seriously

-Short(completable in ~1.5 hrs)

Sinister City, as of writing this, has mixed reviews.  That, I think, is atrocious.  The whole premise of the game is so delightfully absurd that it becomes hilarious.  It does not take itself seriously in a world where hidden object games seem to take themselves way too seriously.  The voice acting is bad, and the settings are weird.  Nothing quite makes sense.  That being said, this game is clearly meant as parody.  It's so bad it's funny-- does that make sense? Sinister City embraces the cliches of hidden object games and the vampire genre and mocks them.  I love it.

author: {'steamid': '76561198011595325', 'num_games_owned': 2477, 'num_reviews': 929, 'playtime_forever': 424, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 424, 'last_played': 1494115803}
review:
Sinister City √© um game de aventura e objetos ocultos bem regular, a est√≥ria √© focada no humor bobalh√£o (o personagem √© usado de empregado por todo mundo que tem algo que ele precisa) e pelo valor √© bem aceit√°vel (tem umas 3h de dura√ß√£o), mas n√£o se destaca no mar de objetos ocultos do steam. O maior defeito geral √© que √†s vezes ocorre um bug onde √© preciso voltar ao menu principal, porque o cursos para de responder como deveria. Para n√≥s brasileiros ainda tem mais uma: a legenda est√° totalmente porca, dificultando um pouco umas partes do jogo, por exemplo: eu tinha que pegar um dado (dice) e a legenda mandava pegar um morrer (die).
--------------------------------
Sinister City is a very regular hidden object and adventure game, the story is focused on silly humor (the character is used by everyone who has something that he needs) and the value is quite acceptable (it has a 3h duration) , But does not stand out in the sea of steam's hidden objects. The biggest general flaw is that sometimes a bug occurs where you have to go back to the main menu because the mouse stops responding as it should.
