author: {'steamid': '76561197970314107', 'num_games_owned': 2304, 'num_reviews': 917, 'playtime_forever': 91, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 91, 'last_played': 1492838259}
review:
Games can be bad in a lot of ways. They can be too hard, they can be too dumb (it's true), they can be too rough, and so on. I've played plenty of games that were perfectly good at what they wanted to be, and what they wanted to be was bad. Sinister City is the opposite, in a way. It wants to be dumb and goofy in a charming way, and it would be, if not for being genuinely bad on the technical side.

You play John, a regular joe who looks a little like Tom Cruise with a painted on short-sleeve button-up and tie. His girl Nina gets whisked away by a vampire to Sinister City, an actual fucking place full of vampires that everyone is totally okay with for some reason. After getting his bearings and some vampire hunting tips from the melon-headed veteran, John makes his way into the auspicious burg to wrest his fiancee from the clutches of the undead.

It's nowhere near this epic, mind you, and that's a good thing for once. Whatever you're expecting of Sinister City is going to get upended because the story is acutely aware of its absurdities and tries to top itself constantly. Within minutes of starting the game (spoiler alert I guess?) the kindly hotel manager assembles a mystical hypnosis machine that sends you to the astral plane. To defeat the villainous vampire you'll need the help of his real estate agent wife and his therapist. There's a vampire Teletubby. And all of this is spilled on you not with a wink and a nod, or awkward tryhard dialogue, but with some refreshingly earnest humor and a willingness to just roll with the weirdness.

The reason I'm telling you all this up front is because despite the solid kookiness, you really shouldn't play Sinister City. As wonderfully campy as the story ends up being the gameplay cannot sustain it, and the technical issues just demolish what's left. The hidden object scenes here are a combination of the genre's worst habits: You can only seek five items at a time, you have to move completely unmarked objects to get at things behind them, the scenes themselves are hard to spot and tend to be in strange places, and you have to do them multiple times until you find almost every single item. This means that scenes are incredibly easy as long as you're randomly clicking on everything, which is the only way to find the movable objects anyway.

On top of that, you need to find multiples of items across multiple scenes or areas to get inventory items to use on NPCs or puzzles. These can be hidden anywhere, including hidden object scenes for OTHER items, and you get no indication that you've found everything in a given scene. Plus, you can't even pick up obvious items until you trigger the dialogue telling you to get them! On top of all this, some scenes are misaligned graphically which make it super hard to click the right things, and some objects blend far too well into the muddy backgrounds.

The amateur-hour graphics don't do Sinister City any favors either, with inconsistent 3D models and some incredibly blurry backgrounds. I must admit, though, the sound design is decent and features some nice, campy voice acting and appropriate music. But it is clear this was a mobile title first, with a lack of options and plenty of "Tap here to X" prompts. It wouldn't take you more than 90 minutes to beat even on the harder mode, so as decent as the story is in its goofy way, you're better off staying far, far away from Sinister City.



Did you enjoy this review? I certainly hope so, and I certainly hope you'll check out more of them at https://goldplatedgames.com/ or on my [url=http://steamcommunity.com/groups/audish#curation]curation page[/url]!

author: {'steamid': '76561198036328736', 'num_games_owned': 3959, 'num_reviews': 727, 'playtime_forever': 148, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 148, 'last_played': 1491125795}
review:
Sinister City marque les d√©but des Finlandais de Jetdogs Studios dans les jeux PC et √ßa se voit.
C'est techniquement un d√©sastre avec notamment des affichages fantaisistes du personnage principal, un bug qui oblige √† relancer le jeu ou des erreurs de traduction √† la pelle.
On peut regretter √©galement une dur√©e de vie extr√™mement faible, un sc√©nario ridicule et des personnages auxquels on ne s'attache pas.
Dommage aussi que l'id√©e d'inclure un personnage √† d√©placer comme dans un point&click ne soit techniquement pas ma√Ætris√©e.

Au niveau jouabilit√©, pas de difficult√© particuli√®re. Il s'agit exclusivement de chercher des objets dans des sc√®nes classiques d'objets cach√©s, soit selon la liste de chaque sc√®ne, soit, selon la demande d'un PNJ, des objets dispers√©s dans plusieurs sc√®nes.


Bref, dans le genre, y a largement mieux m√™me si c'est plus cher. Alors pour le prix (et encore plus si c'est en soldes, √©ventuellement m√™me le pack avec Alchemy Mysteries), on peut envisager de l'essayer et de juste le prendre pour ce qu'il est : 2h max de recherche d'objets.

author: {'steamid': '76561198056359918', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 31, 'playtime_forever': 156, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 156, 'last_played': 1490618053}
review:
Sinceramente non saprei da dove cominciare: la grafica lascia a dasiderare, la trama √® ridotta all'osso e la traduzione pessima e piena di errori. Gli enigmi sono tali solo di nome, ripetitivi nella ricerca degli oggetti, le ambientazioni scarse. 
A dirla tutta neppure la colonna sonora √® un gran ch√®. Il peggior gioco di questo genere che io abbia mai giocato finora.
Preso in saldo, pagandolo la met√†, ma non vale comunque i 50 centesimi spesi.
Se volete cimentarvi, solo iper scontato, e se proprio non avete niente di meglio da fare. Per me 2/10.

author: {'steamid': '76561198149384609', 'num_games_owned': 714, 'num_reviews': 38, 'playtime_forever': 358, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 106, 'last_played': 1608493478}
review:
This isn't a horror or scarey game.  It's more like a spoof with funny vampires.   
Clunky interface.  I had some buggy issues in the start of the game.  Disappearing graphics (like whited out boxes in some parts of the 'hog' scene) and when I was in a 'hog' scene at this part not long from the start every time I clicked on an item it would go out of the 'hog' back to the scene and I had to keep clicking back and forth to finish.  
I fixed both things by just going to the main menu and back in the game but at first I had to do it a couple of times.

After that I didn't run into any more buggy stuff like that.

Graphics are a bit clunky.  ( older game though)

 I didn't take this game to seriously and just played it for something to do. 

 The game is  short.  I think it says I played for 2hrs but I'd say you can finish this in less then that.  Those times are reflecting me trying to figure out what was going on with the bug parts and leaving game up when I afk'd so this is a really short game if you play straight through.

Humor is rather silly though I laughed a couple of times because it was so campy.   Dialog a bit corny and over the top and not particular well acted.  One vampire had such a terrible voice but I think that's supposed to be funny because [spoiler]he is an actor in a children's show. [/spoiler].

There is one voice I know I have heard before, he's an actor and that voice is unmistakeable however I can't place the name.  I didn't wait to read the whole credits so I may just look that up.   It's kind of fun to hear a recognizable voice in games. 

The Hogs, nothing special, kind of silly and uneventful.   Puzzles? uhm not really.

 you find yourself clicking a lot because the mouse icon has no visual changes to them like object icon, area icon and so on.  I played in advance mode though didn't get that achieve because at one point I simply clicked off advance in the main menu options to see what the other mode was like and then switched it back when I realized advanced mode for this game is better.   

anyway I'd say don't bother to purchase this game unless it's in some bundle sale ( which is how I got it) and it comes down to under a dollar or less.

There is nothing Sinister about this game.

happy gaming~

author: {'steamid': '76561198049572840', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 33, 'playtime_forever': 235, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 163, 'last_played': 1498632869}

Os HO s√£o constantes, repetitivos e o som que a dica faz quando mostra o objeto √© muito irritante, fui nas op√ß√µes, coloquei tudo no volume minimo, mas o som da dica nao mutava. Puzzles muito simples, sem desafio.
E o que falar da historia? Estava at√© conseguindo engolir at√© eu ler que o Dracula queria ser um ator de Hollywood. Tipo, o que?!
Tentei, mas n√£o deu.

Houveram v√°rias tentativas de piadas, mas algumas acho que s√≥ crian√ßas da quinta s√©rie ou abaixo consegueria rir... Afinal, vampiros vestidos de telletubies n√£o √© l√° algo muito... Ris√≠vel? Pelo menos, n√£o num humor adulto. Poderia recomendar para uma crian√ßa, j√° que a tem√°tica e os acontecimentos da narrativa s√£o simples de entender e digerir para uma mentalidade mais simples, mas para quem gosta de jogos com hist√≥rias elaboradas (mesmo que clich√™), passe longe desse jogo...

author: {'steamid': '76561198046065881', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 21, 'playtime_forever': 5, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 5, 'last_played': 1487920261}
review:
This game's graphics, gameplay, mini games, puzzles, all of it, not so great. It's also somewhat short in duration. But I thought the story and characters were actually pretty good. Both have an understated absurdity and humor to them I wasn't expecting. It was sort of like a B movie that's entire purpose is to make fun of B movies. But they don't ever hit you over the head with it. About 10 minutes into it I was thinking I was going to give it a thumbs down, but ended up enjoying it enough to it a mild recommend. Played well for me on Linux Mint 18 (Wine/PlayOnLinux).

PS I almost exclusively play offline. I typically only play online long enough for Steam to allow me to write a review. So Steam only shows that I played 0.1 hrs as of the time of this review, although I've played at least 1.5 hrs and have completed the game.

author: {'steamid': '76561198158196956', 'num_games_owned': 3737, 'num_reviews': 189, 'playtime_forever': 255, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 255, 'last_played': 1487380992}
review:
[b]Sinister City[/b] applies a mixture of classic horror themes with a great dosage of humour while playing as John who tries to save his bride.
I honestly thought this was going to be a true horror game, but I quickly realize I was going to have more laughs than scares! 
As an HO game, the story has to be fulfilled, and although it's simple, It was nice enough to entertain me for a second playthrough!

The game has a minor glitch, where -by some reason, the screen becomes white, as some objects suddenly are missing. I had to restart my game twice. But since [b]Sinister City[/b] was the first game from [u]Jetdogs Studios[/u] (at least here on Steam), I have to give them a break. other than that the game works as it should!
The HO's scenes could use a much higher resolution to increase the objects quality, this is a common problem with tons of other games as well. There is no other spot I can press in terms of negativity, everything else works fine in a cool vampiric atmosphere!
The puzzles are interesting and not exhaustive, some are challenging, but far from nightmares that exist to annoy you. The characters are interesting and their role well played considering the storyline is short and doesn't make much sense other than to amuse you.
I also enjoyed the scenarios and the city map, although I wish I could visit randomly more places just for the fun of it!

I enjoyed the storyline, even though it's short and looks silly at times and extremely stupid in a funny way, I think most people would enjoy a good laugh or two from a trip to [b]Sinister City[/b]!
5/10

author: {'steamid': '76561198082502149', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 17, 'playtime_forever': 305, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 305, 'last_played': 1487707077}
review:
I know the story and references in this game are supposed to be tongue in cheek but I still didn't find it funny. I knew it was trying but I cringed because it didn't hit the mark. It might have pulled it off better if the game wasnt so poorly made.

The hidden object scenes were easy and overall the game was boring.

I got this game cheap in a bundle and still kinda which I didn't play it.

author: {'steamid': '76561197999786343', 'num_games_owned': 3499, 'num_reviews': 47, 'playtime_forever': 318, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 318, 'last_played': 1485100121}
review:
Okay, i will try to keep it short. But, to be clear, it's 1‚Ç¨ game, don't expect high quality and unforgettable experience. And, mixed review are right, i wouldn't recommend this game, but still, i am giving it thumb up. Why? Just because :) I will explain it:

Pros (+):
+ 1‚Ç¨ game
+ nice story (i expected worse), but still nothing extra
+ puzzles are fine, but mostly just find hidden objects
+ funny jokes, lines and references (i dont't want to spoil anything, but, you know, the line: "Thanks, Mom, I'm going to kidnap Nina back!" is not something you can use everyday :D
+ around 2 hours to finish the story
+ achievements (you can get almost all of them in one play)

Cons (-):
- bugs (i found some, but they can be solved by restarting the game)
- not really game in which you have to use your brain (especially in story, just let it go, enjoy that simple story)
- some of hidden objects puzzles are quite dark and hard to find some stuff (and also, you have to move some objects, because there is another object under them)
- that's all, you can't nitpicking every single thing in 1‚Ç¨ game (sorry, but it is true - indie game for that price can't have the best graphics and overwhelming soundtrack)


There's one more thing. Logic in some puzzles. Like, you have to install some computer software, but you have to find 10 floppy disks in the office. Well, one is in trash, because, why not. You will have to prepare a tea for psychologist. But you have to find teabags. And they are everywhere. Literally. Her office is messy, same as she is. So many issues, not even Windows Vista had those. But as i said, relax :) Enjoy that story as it is. Again, i will mention the price, which is pretty nice for this game. I've played much worse hidden objects game, which were more expensive and even sh*ttier in story and bugs.

So, that's it. Mixed reviews, so this is obviously not the best game, if you are looking for hidden objects game. But if you are in a good mood, and have 1‚Ç¨ to spend, you can spend it here :) Trailer is showing everything what you need to see to decide, if you will buy this game. But it is worth for that good time it can bring :)

review: Don't get me wrong, it is a bad game, a really bad game, but due to its badness, it's highly amusing. If you want a proper HOG, don't buy this one (even if the price is tempting), but if you want to have fun laughing at a (rather short) game full with bugs and total lack of logic (even less logical than "normal" HOG), take the chance. It's definitely not a good game, but I had quite some fun with it, so I'll have to recommend it, even if not for common reasons.

author: {'steamid': '76561198065842379', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 93, 'playtime_forever': 216, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 216, 'last_played': 1482242437}
review:
[h1]Review zu Sinister City[/h1]

Sinister City ist ein typisches Wimmelbild Spiel das erstmalig im Jahre 2011 ver√∂ffentlicht wurde.
F√ºr damalige Verh√§ltnisse w√§re es vielleicht ein ganz gutes Spiel gewesen aber mit heutigen Standarts kann es nicht mithalten. Da hilft es auch nicht, dass es im Vollpreis f√ºr 0,99‚Ç¨ zu haben ist. Der erste Durchgang spielt sich zwar ganz lustig, aber nicht weil es so unterhaltsam ist, sondern weil es durch seine eher lieblose Umsetzung √∂fter schmunzeln l√§sst. Obwohl das Spiel nun schon einige Jahre auf dem Buckel hat, ist es nachwievor voll von Bugs, √úbersetzungsfehlern und sogar komplett fehlenden Texturen! Auch die Bildsch√§rfe ist f√ºr heutige Monitore nicht mehr optimal, es wirkt zum Teil verzerrt und sehr unscharf. Die Story selbst hat auch sehr wenig Tiefgang.

[b]Bugs etc. die mir aufgefallen sind:[/b]
[list]
[*]Im leichten Modus hatte ich in der Spiegelwelt in einer Wimmelbildszene einen Gegenstand den ich suchen musste, der eine komplett fehlende Textur hatte (wei√üer Bereich im Bild)
[*]Im fortgeschrittenen Modus hatte ich in der Spiegelwelt wie oben eine komplett fehlende Textur der normalen Szene die etwa ein 1/6 des Bildschirms ausmachte
[*]Im fortgeschrittenen Modus ebenfalls in der Spiegelwelt wurde es richtig zur nervt√∂tenden Angelegenheit eine Wimmelbildszene abzuschlie√üen. Jedesmal wann man den Bildschirm angeklickt hat, egal ob auf ein gesuchtes Objekt oder Fehlklick, hat man automatisch die Wimmelbildszene wieder verlassen. Danach habe ich das Spiel im 2. Durchgang abgebrochen.
[*]Teilweise starke √úbersetzungsfehler bei gesuchten Objekten (zB.: Gesucht Palme - Gegangstand Hand). Das ist st√∂rend f√ºr 2 Erfolge: Bei einem muss man 5 Objekte innerhalb von 10 Sekunden finden und beim anderen muss man das Spiel abschlie√üen ohne √∂fters als 3 Mal einen Hinweis bekommen zu haben. Weiters erschwert wird das ganze durch die sehr schechte Grafik.
[/list]

[b]FAZIT:[/b]
Ich habe das Spiel auf leicht einmal durchgespielt, f√ºr den fortgeschrittenen Modus hatte ich keine Geduld mehr, da mir vorkommt, dass die Bugs da noch mehr sind. Leider fehlen mir jetzt 3 Achievements f√ºr den 100% Erfolg. Das Spiel ist sehr kurz (2-3 Stunden) und l√§sst keine Spannung aufkommen, wie bei manchen anderen Vertretern in dem Genre. Auch wenn das Spiel um 0,99‚Ç¨ und im Sale f√ºr ein paar Cents zu haben ist, ist es kein Spiel das man nun unbedingt besitzen muss. Auch f√ºr Erfolgsj√§ger ist es eher eine √§rgerliche Angelegenheit, da durch die ganzen Bugs das ganze noch erschwert wird. Ich rate zu anderen Titeln in dem Genre, die kosten zwar etwas mehr aber man bekommt auch ein besseres Produkt.

author: {'steamid': '76561198253723489', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 8, 'playtime_forever': 236, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 236, 'last_played': 1527223717}

author: {'steamid': '76561198324925228', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 52, 'playtime_forever': 172, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 172, 'last_played': 1482439653}
review:
This game is unplayable. I've restarted it twice to find that it will randomly disable the mouse or necessary items won't be aknowledged no matter how much you click on them. The hint button will circle the thing, but no matter how many times you click on it, around it or near it, it won't acknowledge it. It's not even always in the same place. I made it past the hotel the first time to get to the castle grounds and it wouldn't find the object. I had to restart and this time didn't get even half as far.
Also there is no cursor change when you're in the right place and you have no idea of what areas you need to click on (i.e no eyeball for things you can look at etc) It's literally a case of clicking randomly. Also it doesn't leave a HO scene when you've found everything which means that you could be searching an area to find the items are scattered across several.

It's just not user friendly.

author: {'steamid': '76561198052965201', 'num_games_owned': 1046, 'num_reviews': 78, 'playtime_forever': 236, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 106, 'last_played': 1484418123}
review:
Game Mechanics:
The game uses extremely simple puzzle mechanics, easy as pie hidden-object-scenes (with the exception of items hidden behind interactables, which are not indicated in any way) and the overarching collectibles you need to progress the story (which can be found spread across multiple hidden-object-scenes and, as well as hidden behind the non-indicated interactables). Seriously, the game's mechanics are more boring than challenging.

Plot:
What seemed, at the onset, to be a tale of a man rescuing his beloved fianc√©e from a wicked vampire, quickly plummeted into the lowest depths of Hollywoodesque sitcom. Seriously, the only real joke in this game is the fact that it got published.

Presentation:
The graphis are grainy and outdated, the entire thing gives instructions as if it were on a tablet and the character models feel wonky and out of place (possibly because they seem to be able to magically clip through buildings).

Completion:
In a single run you COULD get every achievement... but I recommend you don't get any of them instead.

author: {'steamid': '76561198227942340', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 44, 'playtime_forever': 129, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 129, 'last_played': 1481808541}
review:
One of the worst HO games I've ever played..
Story? "Hello, I don't know you at all and I see you only want to rent a room in my hotel, but let me hipnotize and send you to a different dimension in exchange for a room key. Glad you're ok with that." I don't think I need to add more...
Gameplay? Seems, well, random, but not "let them think a little" random. It is "I don't know what I'm doing, I always wanted to be a hair band designer" random. And annoying, very much.
Music? Let me use the word of the day to describe it - annoying. After 20 minutes into the game you suddenly realize the construction noise from the site outside your window is like a touch of an angel to your traumatized ears.
I regret every minute I've spend playing it. Counting blades of grass in the backyard is way more appealing.

author: {'steamid': '76561197973059038', 'num_games_owned': 2548, 'num_reviews': 18, 'playtime_forever': 477, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 477, 'last_played': 1480171075}
review:
I got this game through a giveaway group. Glad I didn't pay for it.

It feels a very rough, low budget title. The kind with basic voice acting, graphics that can make you cring,
and other things that cry cheap.

Some of these titles can have a decent plot, but the plot is borderline bizzare, not interesting and short.
The puzzles are mostly basic and sometimes not very clear. The HO scenes are basic and require some 
extra clicks. Somehow I didn't get an achievement i definitely think i deserve.
They help you get objects, but there's so much wandering about for additional objects, it makes you
feel as if they wanted some fillers to lengthen the game.

On the pro side - It is short. I thought whether I should stop playing as i did feel I'm wasting my time, but i was
hoping the end was near, and it was. luckily.

So - If you are really bored or must do every HOPA you see - go for it.
Otherwise - There are definitely much better ones.

author: {'steamid': '76561198037157856', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 31, 'playtime_forever': 278, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 278, 'last_played': 1474699023}
review:
This game is one of the most hilarious point-and-click games I've ever played. It conjures up Ed Wood at his worst (that is, best). As a send-up to to B-movies, I can't find a better game. 

And the graphics couldn't be better. By better, I don't mean you'll mistake this game for Crysis. I mean, it's got all the charm of a cheap budget title -- which it is, but with a wink and a nod. All-the-more self-aware.

Regarding the voice acting, it reminds me of Castlevania Symphony of the Night at is worst moments. And so if you're a fan of all the awkward conversations in that game, you'll think this one is a hoot.

The drawbacks are that this game is short and the puzzles easy. Even when you're stuck -- which you won't be often -- the game is more than happy to give you a hint that practically solves the puzzle.

But don't buy this game for the gameplay. But it for the over-the-top plot, and the hilarious satire.

review: If you want something that is laughably bad, then look no further. However I've already run in to one annoying bug where each time you click something in a hidden object scene you have to re-enter with each click. I don't anticipate ever playing this game to completion. It was obviously made for touch screens, like phones or tablets, and it seems there was little or no attempt to smoothly port this over to point and click pc game. Probably not even worth the 99cents it currently is priced at.

author: {'steamid': '76561198062283645', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 13, 'playtime_forever': 290, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 290, 'last_played': 1471317272}
review: I play lots of terrible hidden object games, especially spooky ones with tonnes of old-looking junk in them. This one is so terrible I wish I hadn't spend 25 cents on it. It was trying to be funny, I think, but it didn't work. Also, you can just click randomly about to find all the items. SPOILERS AHEAD. Story and dialoge are this terrible :  you check into a hotel and the clerk says "what are you doing here, don't you know we are right next to Sinister City full of vampires and all sorts of evil?" (he doesn't think anyone should pay him to use his hotel?) then casually offers to let you talk to your girlfirend telepathically. He's got a hypnosis machine in the store room.

review:
I recommend this game *if* you get it cheap, i.e for like 50 cents etc. 

[u]The good[/u]
Some of the puzzles are challenging
Oddball sense of humour
Can be completed quickly
Decent trading cards/badges

[u]The bad[/u]
Brings nothing new to the HO table
Graphics are sub-par
Some of the hidden objects don't match up to their descriptions

review:
No soy de calificar mal un juego, pero tiene muchas cosas malas.

Tuve que terminarlo 3 veces porque al salir de los creditos me quitaba los logros. 

Muchos bugs, que hacen que tenga que salir completamente del juego y volver a entrar.

author: {'steamid': '76561197984793828', 'num_games_owned': 2063, 'num_reviews': 97, 'playtime_forever': 587, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 587, 'last_played': 1468322113}
review:
Meh. The whole thing is really silly. So not quite 'stupid' but it didn't make the mark for 'funny' for me. If you're gonna port fro mobile at least remove all the mention of 'tapping'..

So on the whole, it has its moments, but there's a lot of better HOGs.

author: {'steamid': '76561198157038404', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 33, 'playtime_forever': 308, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 308, 'last_played': 1482737510}
review:
This is a qualified "yes" - if you love HOGs and you're willing to put up with some bugs  and poor game design choices (fewer of those), this is worth playing to watch the story unfold.  Overall, though--most people won't want to waste the time, even though the price is low sometimes on sale.

CONS
Visuals sometimes broken - large white blocks where the background should be. (OTOH, when this happens in a hidden object zone, all you see are the hidden objects so you can select them and get on with the story.) This only happened sometimes - loading error, or something like that. Restarting fixed it.

Occasionally throws you out of an object zone after every click - this is a MAJOR bug; fortunately, restarting the game fixes it.

Annoying red X and zap sound when you click a "wrong" thing. (You get used to it.)

Objects often hidden behind other things; lots of random pointless clicking.

PROS
Story is hilarious... once you stop trying to believe it's serious.
Art is good. Music is nicely matched to the mood, including the over-the-top drama.
Ipkis is the most unique vampire character I've ever seen in a game.

For all I know, this is trying to be the "Plan 9 From Outer Space" of hidden object games, and the bugs were left in as part of the "charm." (Note to devs: They are not charming.) This game deserves an MST3K treatment. 

I recommend using hints liberally to avoid frustration; focus on enjoying the story, and if you want all the achievements, go back through and play it without the hints.

author: {'steamid': '76561198067585596', 'num_games_owned': 5828, 'num_reviews': 243, 'playtime_forever': 266, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 266, 'last_played': 1467704704}
review:
I would only purchase this game if it was 75-100% off.
The game is riddled with bugs and most of them are game-breaking.
Randomly clicking to skip dialogue breaks the game sometimes.  Be careful.

Cons:
[list]
[*]Sometimes there are graphical tears in random places around the scene
[*]Stuck in conversation with people with no way out (Happened 5 times ; 2 of the times were game-breaking.  I had to Alt+F4 just to get out of the game)
[*]Very short, took about 30 minutes to beat (Aside from bugs)
[*]It's a mobile port
[*]It's not Bad Rats
[/list]

Pros:
[list]
[*]Enjoyable story with laughable dialogue
[*]Vampire Teletubbies
[*]Fast hint recharge for the impatient and confused
[*]Easy Puzzles
[*]No misclick penalties

review: I got booted out of the hidden object screen every time I clicked on a hidden object and decided this game probably isn't worth my hidden object time.

author: {'steamid': '76561198022440133', 'num_games_owned': 388, 'num_reviews': 48, 'playtime_forever': 123, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 98, 'last_played': 1467511250}
review: Hilariously campy, pretty straight forward, cheap, and easy.  If you ignore the bugs, it's actually pretty enjoyable. If you love B-movies, grab this one.  End scene was the best part.

author: {'steamid': '76561198021759485', 'num_games_owned': 448, 'num_reviews': 40, 'playtime_forever': 313, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 313, 'last_played': 1467002810}
review: If you don't mind a campy storyline and a mix of super easy and average HO scenes, it's not a bad game. Definitely on the corny side, but that just makes it entertaining. The only real problem is the disparity between easy and advanced mode. In easy, it doesn't even give you a few seconds to search before the next thing starts sparkling. On the other hand, the advanced mode gives no help whatsoever, including the fact that it doesn't list your current task. So if you log out and come back later having forgotten where you left off, you might have to use hints.

review:
Ho hum. This one loses doubly in translation - once from Polish (?) and once from tablet. 

One of the puzzles asked me to "move your finger from side to side". I tried that, but nothing happened. Felt a bit silly. Sitting there. Waggling my finger in the air. Thank Vlad for the skip button!

Still, there were vampires, a psychologist, a castle, a movie studio, and many graphical anomalies. These may have been part of an inscrutibal it's-so-bad-it's-good type thing. From the original Polish (?)

It was 79p. That was about right, but I'd skip this even if it was free.

author: {'steamid': '76561197994595024', 'num_games_owned': 338, 'num_reviews': 4, 'playtime_forever': 103, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'last_played': 1590151086}
review:
Given that I spent less than ¬£1, I figured I'd get a hour or two out of this solving classic point-and-click puzzles tied in with a classic horror story. 
What I did not expect was a budget comedy-drama about some guy trying to win over Dracula who turns out to be his future father-in-law, which you do by somehow winning over the rest of the family and fulfilling the dream he abandoned to raise his family.

I also did not expect the game to black-screen my computer every time I alt-tabbed or closed the game.

5/10 - Plz no crash

author: {'steamid': '76561198120506398', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 16, 'playtime_forever': 181, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 181, 'last_played': 1471208487}
review:
Wow, da hat sich jemand wirklich mal keine M√ºhe gegeben. Die Story beginnt schon schlecht, aber die R√§tsel beschr√§nken sich quasi auf suche 5 mal diesen Gegenstand und 6 mal jenen Gegenstand. Dazu sind die Gegenst√§nde teilweise derma√üen doof hinter anderen Gegenst√§nden versteckt, das hirnlos wirld drauf losklicken notwendig wird. Nur 10 Minuten Spiel und ich bin schon tierisch generft davon.

Beurteilung nach Ende des Spieles. (ca 2 Stunden)

+ deutsche Untertitel

- schlechte Story, bald sehr vorhersehbar
- unglaubw√ºrdige Charaktere
- schlechte R√§tsel
- manchmal wildes Rumgeklicke notwendig, da Sachen v√∂llig sinnfrei hinter anderen Gegenst√§nden versteckt sind.
- schlechte Musik
- schlechte Syncro
- am Ende ein Cipping fehler, weswegen ich neustarten musste, weil ich sonst das R√§tsel h√§tte √ºberspringen m√ºssen.

author: {'steamid': '76561198083681067', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 6, 'playtime_forever': 233, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 156, 'last_played': 1466511741}
review:
Overall I like the game, I'm fond of hidden object games and I find them fun to play, however I have to thumbs down this simply because of the bugs in it. Once you play for a little bit it bugs out to where you can't click to get into the hidden object areas. And the only way I've found to fix it is to completely close out of the game and reopen it. That really ruins any fun the game could have had and makes things difficult for people like myself who records games online.

Maybe if that bug gets fixed, I'll come back and revise my review.

author: {'steamid': '76561198010549488', 'num_games_owned': 1835, 'num_reviews': 9, 'playtime_forever': 112, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 112, 'last_played': 1464578583}
review:
If you enjoy hidden object games and vampire folklore then this game is for you. Sure, it's not the best game ever made, but it is one of the best hidden object games that I've ever played. This game has a pretty good, but simple story, unlike most hidden object games that don't even have a story.

The only con I had with the game is that there were probably a dozen or so places where the audio said something different from the subtitles. It kind of took me out of the story for a second, but it wasn't a deal breaker.

The game clocked in at right under two hours, and I was able to finish it in one sitting, but it sure was fun filled. I'm sure I'll go back through the advanced mode one day, so I can get 100% completetion, and to also enjoy the game again.

I'd be willing to play some more games from this developer in the future.

Thanks for the cool game Jetdogs Studios

review: Honestly, if you like cheesey movies, this is a game for you. The voice acting is deliberately hammy, the plot is downright silly, and the puzzles are decent - not too hard, not too easy.

author: {'steamid': '76561198027789951', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 57, 'playtime_forever': 116, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 116, 'last_played': 1455394326}
review: After looking at some screenshots of Sinister City, I thought it looked really good. And for the most part, I got just that. Horror-trope homages, nice graphics, and a good variety of puzzles. The part of this game I did not like that caused me not to recommend this game? The hidden objects aspect of it. More than half of the time I spent in this game is looking for hidden objects to advance to the next segment of the game. I wouldn‚Äôt mind it so much if the hidden objects puzzle appeared once or twice, but it appears in every area I go to and it gets to be really tedious after the third area in the game.

author: {'steamid': '76561197971042250', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 29, 'playtime_forever': 177, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 177, 'last_played': 1463503232}
review: Sinister City is a wonderfully bad hidden object game.  The plot is bad, the graphics are quite old school, the puzzles are easy, the hidden object scenes are pretty easy.  Characters sometimes float above the ground.  The game was stable for me and I don't recall any game breaking bugs.  Took me about 3 hrs.  Recommended if the price is right and if you enjoy bad horror movies.

author: {'steamid': '76561198041949592', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 605, 'playtime_forever': 278, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 278, 'last_played': 1462812621}
review:
Hey everyone and this is my review about the game!

This is a Point and click hidden object game.


[h1]Interface/Menu/Settings[/h1]

There is a Music Volume Slidebar.
There is a Sound Volume Slidebar.
You can play fullscreen or windowed mode.
You can not change the resolution size.
You can have different "player slots" for multiple users.
There is easy and hard mode. (if you are Familiar with these kind of games then you know what they will do),

[h1]About the game.[/h1]

This is a point and click hidden object game. You have to search around for clues and equipment in order to complete a certain area. I don't get this part. You are not able to do a "hidden object minigame" unless you HAVE to do it. Why make it active or show? =/.

Character walks very slow and he will not teleport around to speed those things up. (like in some does).
Double clicking speeds up an action. Which i recommend.
You are able to skip through these "Dialogues"
Game has Text and that is totally voiced over.
Click boxes to interact with an object are really bad.
Graphics are meh.
Animation is really reallly bad.
There is a help system.

[h1]Other things.[/h1]

They try to scare you with some random events. (not jumpscares)
Objects are sooo freaking small. Way too small. I randomed clicked alot of times just to be lucky to find it.
I have played a couple of these hidden and click games. But this one is really bad.

-------------------

I Give this game a 2/10

Die Hintergrundstory ist eine moderne Vampirgeschichte, die mich entfernt an "Vampire: The Masquerade ‚Äì Bloodlines" erinnert hat. Die Story ist eher witzig als d√ºster gehalten.

Das Spiel war in 2,5 h durch, war ein netter Zeitvertreib an einem faden Sonntag Nachmittag, ist √∂fter im Sale f√ºr 10 oder 20 cent zu haben - wer Wimmelbildchen mag kann sp√§testens hier getrost zugreifen.

author: {'steamid': '76561197997506993', 'num_games_owned': 1127, 'num_reviews': 156, 'playtime_forever': 762, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 747, 'last_played': 1465085379}
review:
Terribly buggy. Hideous graphics and abysmal voice acting. 

This HOG quasimodo even fails at the parts where you're supposed to be looking for the objects. You have to click aimlessly because just about any static object might move and reveal something of value underneath. So you basically have to click everywhere, which kind of defeats the purpose of a game of this sort.

author: {'steamid': '76561198068225603', 'num_games_owned': 240, 'num_reviews': 30, 'playtime_forever': 274, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 274, 'last_played': 1517260599}
review:
OK, after playing through the game a second time, I'm willing to say I was a little bit hard on it.  Yes, it's bad.  It's got puzzles that are barely functional due to bugs.  And the story progression and acting is just godawful.

But this game does have its charms.

It's got glitches that do ridiculous but harmless things - like one screen where there simply isn't a floor.  The characters are badly written, but occasionally the cheesy acting or cornball jokes redeem them into being entertaining.  There's a guy who sounds like Erick Avari for no discernable reason, and that's just nice.  There's a thing that happens at the end that's completely gratuitous but also completely in character.  I love it.

It's stupid, but that's OK.

I'm not gonna say this was a good game.  It wasn't.  I'm not gonna say you should play it if you're looking for a decent quality adventure.  You shouldn't.  But for what it was, it was enjoyable.

And shit, it was 99 cents.

author: {'steamid': '76561197971047607', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 124, 'playtime_forever': 131, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 131, 'last_played': 1461304924}
review:
The fact that the first time I smiled in this game was during the closing credits is pretty much testament that I just didn't like it.

JetDogs have made some excellent HOGs. Alchemy Mysteries - Prague Legends, being one that I played prior to this. That game showed the talent and the creativity of the developer in this genre, and Sinister City is not even on the same scale.

I enjoy HOGs, but the story, voice acting, puzzles, map, and even the hidden object scenes were annoying. I just couldn't get into the game. Add an occasional bug that refused to allow you to click on objects without either exiting to menu or even the game, before continuing, just added to the frustration.

The game tries to create comedic atmosphere, and a unique world and just fails in both.

author: {'steamid': '76561198197896761', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 78, 'playtime_forever': 348, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 348, 'last_played': 1461199650}
review:
My time says almost 6 hours but I finished the game in almost 5 hours. I left the game on for an hour to do something.

This HOG wasn't really fun at all. The grahpics are ok. The voice acting was also ok. 

But man the story bored me a lot. I get that the story was making fun of Vampire, but again the story just wasn't fun.

I'm happy that the game wasn't very long because I don't think the game would of been any better LOL.

Only get this HOG if u are really freaking bored and want to kill some time playing a HOG.

author: {'steamid': '76561198054279933', 'num_games_owned': 1480, 'num_reviews': 37, 'playtime_forever': 250, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 250, 'last_played': 1460548061}
review:
Ffs, I paid 9 cents for this game and I feel totally ripped off. The voice acting would be funny if there wasn't already so many similar failures available in Steam, at some point you just stop laughing. I don't know who these guys are and I don't want to know. Actors they are definitely not.
The game itself is so full of bugs you will not be able to solve it without repeatedly restarting the whole thing, and even then your success is not guaranteed. If you're just after trading cards (may that invention burn in hell), then ok, buy it and let it run on background while doing something worth your time. But if it's a game you want, just forget it, this is not a game.

author: {'steamid': '76561198080724645', 'num_games_owned': 3618, 'num_reviews': 82, 'playtime_forever': 138, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 138, 'last_played': 1459758019}
review:
- This review isn't written by a native speaker, thank you for your understanding -

[h1][b]Rating[/b][/h1] between Mixed and Good

[h1]- Key features below ---- Review after -----------------------------------------------[/h1]

[h1][b]Play time needed (perfect)[/b][/h1] about 2 to 3 hours
[h1][b]Gaming level[/b][/h1] Casual
[h1][b]Achievement level[/b][/h1] Casual
[h1][b]Game style[/b][/h1] Hidden-object; Puzzle; Point n' click (third person)
[h1][b]Game modes[/b][/h1] Story mode
[h1][b]Story[/b][/h1] A (fun) foolish one.
[h1][b]Playthrough[/b][/h1] 1
[h1][b]Voice[/b][/h1] "Childish"
[h1][b]Music[/b][/h1] A few.
[h1][b]Controls[/b][/h1] Mouse only.
[h1][b]Tutorial[/b][/h1] Yes.
[h1][b]Unmissable / backtracking content[/b][/h1] Except some. Refer to (*) below.
[h1][b]Glitches / bugs[/b][/h1] One graphic issue (a small blanck square in game during one scene)
[h1][b]Worth price[/b][/h1] Worth it if you assume that is a very small game.

[h1]- Review below ----------------------------------------------------------------------[/h1]

I would say that this game is one of the first Hidden-Objects game of Jetdogs Studios with the smallest budget, the other hidden objects games are good to really good.

This game feature a third person point and click game. The story is so so but can be fun (foolish and some humour). Clicking can't be too precise sometimes so some objects or places can be unnoticed. But the good thing is that you can click as long as you want without a rectriction.

The game features a good mix between a puzzle / exploring and hidden objects. Hidden objects scenes are challenging, indeed some objects can only be found after interacting with the scene by combining one or several items or solving a medium puzzle. The only bad point is that you need to click everywhere to find an Hidden Object Scene. Also you'll have to find several items through your quest in these Hidden Object Scenes.

(*):
Some achievements required you to not skip any mini-game, hidden objects scene or cutscene. And some need you to find several objects in a required time but it's easily doable on your playthrough or by doing the first hidden objects scene of the beginning until you're fast enough.

author: {'steamid': '76561198224797124', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 11, 'playtime_forever': 42, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 42, 'last_played': 1456247965}
review: Love hiddent object games and point and clicky and those with storylines, so it was a bonus i found this game and thought yay vampire storylines, was getting on really well in the game and POW crashes, figured it might just be a one off, reload game, works a short while then glitched then threw me out again, started to think maybe it was the pc so uploaded the game onto my laptop, and same problem of crashing and then exiting game, it's a shame it was so glitchy cause i usually love games like this.  Try it anyways btu from what i've read others have had same glitch problem.

author: {'steamid': '76561197971532357', 'num_games_owned': 2752, 'num_reviews': 413, 'playtime_forever': 128, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 128, 'last_played': 1420495776}
review:
Your girlfriend disappeared and you end up to chase her in her hometown, full of vampires and discovering that her dad, the chief, isn't ready to let her go to a human. In other words, she'll be wed to a vampire the next morning. Your only way is  to convince him that you're the one for her...

Sinister City has probably one of the worst plots in HO games if you take that seriously. In reality, the plot is a great parody of horror stories as the father wants to be an actor, the mother is a powerful businesswoman and that every vampire met is friendly.

The gameplay is the same as other games of the genre: list of items, objects to find and to use, puzzles to solve. Everything is quite easy. However, there is a game-breaking bug at the beginning and the only way to get past it is to exit the game and relaunch it. If you don't know that, you may be frustrated to be stopped so early in the story and that you can't do anything about it. Once past that, you can enjoy the game that isn't so bad as you could fear.

The graphics are correct, even if the vampires aren't really terrifying as they should but as it's a parody, it's normal to have them behaving comically. The soundtrack is correct too.

I played the game more than a year ago and I suppose that you can feel that with my review. But I remember clearly that I said to people: Once you get past the famous bug and if you can handle a silly plot, you'll enjoy the game.  So, while Sinister City isn't the greatest game out there, it's still a good moment to pass. Other titles from JetDog are better (Frankenstein: Master of Death is the best example) but well, Sinister City will not make a hole in your wallet and will not hurt you.

author: {'steamid': '76561198128658183', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 169, 'playtime_forever': 156, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 156, 'last_played': 1455682408}
review:
Rescue your vampire girlfriend from being forced to marry a Hollywood actor!

+ Vampires! :D
+ Easy 100% achievement
+ Puzzles can be challenging, however easy enough to solve by yourself
+ You can get a coupon for this game by completing badges or visit trading forums/groups
+ Mixed gameplay of point and click with RPG (loved being able to move my character around and actually explore in a similar way I would in a MMO)
+ Also, that stop to the burger restaurant.... priceless! It made me lol, therefore; 10/10!

author: {'steamid': '76561197989784506', 'num_games_owned': 2189, 'num_reviews': 353, 'playtime_forever': 103, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 103, 'last_played': 1455800888}
review:
John the Protagonist in a great "Self made husband" film.
(Go play a game, you'll get it)

+ : classic hidden object gameplay, no really challanging puzzles with an option to skip, you get hints, there's advanced mode with no hints or skipping, sometimes you laugh ("One royal burger, please"), fast gameplay, trading cards

- : rather short (but it's 0.99 so...), graphics are below ok (but still, for this price, approvable), the story.. the story is.. well funny and not only that (meaning like Twilight funny and maybe worse)

if it's on sale, you have like +-2h time and you want to play HO then it's worth it! 
7/10 just because I lol'd, would search again

author: {'steamid': '76561198005057377', 'num_games_owned': 969, 'num_reviews': 57, 'playtime_forever': 293, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 293, 'last_played': 1455493020}
review:
The game is filled with bugs. Annoying. But you solve that by going back to main menu and then continue.

I recommend finding a guide for the game, since you just get thrown into it, so you could get a hang of it.

It's repetitive as f***, but as soon as you understand the way of playing the game, you'll finish it within an hour (I had the game running as I was eating and after that I watched several TV shows).

It's far from one of the better point-and-click and hidden object games I've played, but it's okay since you can 100% it quickly and just leave it on until you have your 3 trading cards.

Get it on sale though, it's not worth even 0,99‚Ç¨ since the developers couldn't be arsed fixing bugs and glitches before releasing it (and still haven't fixed the problems).

author: {'steamid': '76561197997621117', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 9, 'playtime_forever': 237, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 237, 'last_played': 1455200423}
review:
Very basic and easy to play hidden object game with a few puzzles.  The graphics are a bit silly and the animations are off but it gives it a sort of charm.  The tasks are quite repetitious and predictible but enjoyable none the less.  The characters are goofy and some were unexpected and that threw in some laughs for sure.  

Overall I'd give it about a 7/10.  Very short gameplay, quite basic, but enjoyable.

author: {'steamid': '76561198114663877', 'num_games_owned': 4606, 'num_reviews': 248, 'playtime_forever': 212, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 212, 'last_played': 1453683795}
review:
Sinister City lo jugu√© un d√≠a en que me apetec√≠a ver una peli de miedo y no ten√≠a ninguna a mano. Me pareci√≥ el equivalente a una peli de vampiros de serie B tomada en broma.

No est√° mal; los gr√°ficos son correctos, la banda sonora no molesta, y es lo suficientemente corto como para no hacerse pesado. Porque admit√°moslo, un juego en que cada conversi√≥n entra√±a un posible puzzle, hace que te entre complejo de chico de los recados, y acaba por cansar ser tan servicial.

La dificultad es... bueno; no es dificil. No es para los que buscan juegos que les complique la vida. Y si quieres ver la historia sin hacer los puzzles, hay una opci√≥n para pasarlos.

Por si fuera el poco, respecto al  precio, aunque no haya ninguna oferta disponible (yo pill√© un descuento bestial), est√° muy bien para lo que ofrece. En las 3 horas y media jugadas, me lo he pasado en normal, y luego en dif√≠cil (una vez pasado previamente el juego, la segunda vuelta es un paseo).

author: {'steamid': '76561198046259139', 'num_games_owned': 431, 'num_reviews': 39, 'playtime_forever': 120, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 119, 'last_played': 1586121446}
review:
Before I begin my review, I'd like to request that Steam makes their recommendation system a bit less binary, because I wouldn't recommend this to everyone, but there are some people who I feel would enjoy this game.  Even adding a maybe button would be enough.  Now that that's been said, this game.

Sinister City is a point-and-click hidden-object game, in the vein of the Mystery Case Files series.  For only being 99 cents, it isn't the worst game in the genre.  It doesn't stack up to the aforementioned MCF series, but for what it's worth, you could do much worse.

You play as a human guy whose bride-to-be is a vampire.  Her father doesn't want her marrying a non-vampire (for hopefully obvious reasons), so he LOCKS HER IN A CAGE.  To free her, you need to complete a series of puzzles that aren't hard at all.  I played through the game in full, and only clocked in about 2 hours.

I have to give credit to Jetdogs Studios for getting some decent voice talent in this game.  Whether or not I recommend this game to you is dependent on whether or not it looks interesting to you.  If so, then yes, and vice versa.  This game gets my Seal of Approval.  Just, don't play for the plot.  And if you do, keep a state-of-mind altering substance of your choice at the ready.

author: {'steamid': '76561197969257496', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 11, 'playtime_forever': 358, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 358, 'last_played': 1453572056}
review:
Franchement, j'ai commenc√© a jouer avec de gros a priori et les premi√®res minutes n'√©taient pas rassurantes :
- Les traductions sembles assez approximatives
- Le personnage "marche" 15 cm au dessus du sol
- Le scenario est vraiment bidonesque
 En temps normal j'aurai abandonn√© a bout de 15 minutes. Et puis finalement je me suis pris au truc juste pour voir comment l'histoire allait √©volu√©e.

Au final le jeu m'a fais sourir a plusieurs reprises de part les rebondissements franchement cr√© tins du scenario et les quelques clins d'oeil sympa (le costume de teletubies notament, ou l'oiseau du chateau qui semble dessin√© par un stagiaire de 5 ans, ...).

Bon concretement ce n'est qu'un jeu d'objet cach√© agr√©ment√© de quelques casse t√™te tr√®s simple.

Mais durant mes quelques heures de jeu (sans compter le temps AFK j'ai du mettre 2/3h √† le finir) je me suis quand m√™me amus√© !

Vous aim√© les objets cach√©s ? VOus ne craignez pas les sc√©narios loufoques ? VOus voulez 100% de succes et 4 cartes steam easy ? Foncez !

Ps : contrairement √† certains avis  je n'ai remarqu√© aucun bug EMPECHANT l'avancement de l'histoire ou rendant celle ci d√©sagr√©able !

author: {'steamid': '76561198067063974', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 14, 'playtime_forever': 189, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 189, 'last_played': 1452369756}
review:
It's so bad that it's decent, if you're into that kind of stuff.

What this game is:
- Cheesy story = save your beloved!!!!
- Some really dumb satire
- Okay hidden object puzzles or whatever
- Buggy & glitchy

What this game isn't:
- Good game about spooky vampires
- Great story
- 15/10
- Challenging (unless you experience a ton of glitches and bugs, then it's a challenge for it to actually work)

Is it worth the 99 cents? Uhhhh, probably not. Especially if you're really serious about spending your time on something worthy. Maybe wait until it's like... 45 cents. 15 cents. 9 cents. Free?

I'm going to recommend it anyway. Good luck.

author: {'steamid': '76561198073275018', 'num_games_owned': 189, 'num_reviews': 51, 'playtime_forever': 67, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 67, 'last_played': 1452977737}
review: damn, this game is REALLY good. im not even joking, seriously, its really good. buy it and support the devs, clearly they put a lot of time and effort into making sure this game was SUPERB in every single way. It has an AMAZING attention to detail, amazing background that dont look like they were made in MS paint, crisp dialouge, a truly astounding soundtrack that NEVER ceases to amaze me. It has a beautiful combination of strings, strings, and sharp high pitched noises that just soothe my ears in ways no women (or man lol) could. so if i havent already convinced you to buy this gem, buy it. thanks.

author: {'steamid': '76561198018530477', 'num_games_owned': 285, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 212, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 212, 'last_played': 1452353275}
review:
Lieber Leser:

Dieses f√§lschlicherweise als "Spiel" angegebene Ding ist auch in einem Sale nicht zu kaufen!!
Ich habe seinerzeit 19 cent investiert,dachte, bei dem Preis kann man nicht viel falsch machen, zumal es Sammelkarten hat!
Doch ich irrte mich gewaltig...
Nach einmaligen durchspielen stehe ich kurz vor einer Schmerzensgeldklage!!
Das Wort, welches auch nur ansatzweise dieses Spiel beschreibt, muss noch erfunden werden!!

Zu empfehlen ist dieses Spiel f√ºr Leute, die:
- Achievements bekommen wollen, die dann aber auch gleich wieder aberkannt werden!!
- auf exotische Mundbewegungen stehen
- anstatt nerviger Texturen ( die auch so schon nicht sonderlich gut sind) gerne auf einen wei√üen Bildschirm starren und dabei ein brennen in den Augen bekommen wollen, denn gerade das letzte Drittel des Spiels besteht praktisch nur noch aus solchen "Leerfl√§chen"
- etwas lernen wollen: Eine Stecknadel und eine Rei√üzwecke sind zum Beispiel exakt das Selbe, ebenso eine Taube und ein Hase
- gerne anstatt R√§tsel zu l√∂sen auf besagte "Leerfl√§chen" starren
- und Leute, die auf richtig schlecht abgekupferte Geschichten rund um Vampire stehen!!

Aber wenn man sich einmal in dieses "Abenteuer" hineingest√ºrzt hat, m√∂chte man nicht mehr aufh√∂ren!! Man m√∂chte alle Fehler des Spiels entdecken - ein schier endloses Unterfangen - was mir leider auch in gro√üen Teilen gelungen ist!

Man kann mit dem Spiel Spa√ü haben, ich frage mich nur wie.... Vielleicht wenn man sich gerne an Bugs und fehlenden Texturen erg√∂tzt!

F√ºr mich ist/war es jedoch eher nichts!

author: {'steamid': '76561198064235298', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 203, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 203, 'last_played': 1451709418}
review:
Pretty entertaining for a little hidden object game. The story is corny and the reasons for you to clear nearby closets and trunks of lists worth of various objects grow increasingly absurd as it unfolds. Some actual puzzles are thrown in here and there which adds a bit of variation to simply looking for various items in the scenery. If you get stuck you can have the hint-system flat out show you what to do next, and any actual puzzle can be skipped for those who are just in it for mindless clicking.The game is a short affair, and I can't imagine it having much replay value, but it should be good for wasting a short hour for anyone who are into the hidden object style of games.

On a side note, the game did glitch out pretty severely on the second "act" when I played it, with both broken textures and issues with the game mechanics, but this was solved by simply restarting the game and continuing from the autosave.

author: {'steamid': '76561198042110946', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 121, 'playtime_forever': 162, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 31, 'last_played': 1459060314}
review:
There is no fathomable way for me to articulate the magnitude of Sinister City's greatness.  The game starts off with some superb voice acting with extremely well-written dialogue.  You are John.  Just John.  Your first objective is to find receipts that an inn-keeper lost because the wind blew them away.  He will give you a room if you find them.  You find majority of them in a cabinet.  You also take a butterfly, a fork, the letter 'A', a globe, a hammer, a statue of a dog, a statue of a cat, a pipe, a vase, a gun, a mask, a glove, a hat, and a cup from the cabinet (John's planning quite a party tonight).  You then find the rest of the receipts and then return to the innkeep.  He then tells you that he lost the keys to the rooms because the wind blew them away or something, and that if you want a room, you have to find all of them.  

As you can tell, this game is the master of pacing.

author: {'steamid': '76561198064267320', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 32, 'playtime_forever': 316, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 135, 'last_played': 1451543894}

author: {'steamid': '76561197996552495', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 17, 'playtime_forever': 200, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 200, 'last_played': 1451436531}
review:
Sinister City is a casual hidden object game in which we play as a character that goes by the name of John (quite rare among these parts) and he, for the reason unknown to man, decided to take a trip with his bride-to-be Nina, to a lovely place called Sinister City.
Now you might find yourselves thinking who decided to give this city such an...inviting name, but from what we see of the town throughout the game describes it really well, so kudos to you, unkown peasant, you did well.

So our hero in the making has to find out whatever happened to his fiancee, by doing all kinds of silly stuff for the eccentric townfolk. The game itself is very straightforward and you can't get stuck on a puzzle if you wanted to, thanks to the unlimited hints system.
The puzzles are not at all difficult and won't be a problem to anyone, while the hidden object screens will occasionally annoy you with the low res graphics, but still won't be much of a problem.

The story is not trying to be serious at all, it almost felt like a parody in a way. The bad guy is a vampire that is apparently the one responsible for your finacee's disappearance, and you will have a chance to talk with him as the time goes on. The game is quite short, took  me less than 2 hours to finish.

I did encounter some bugs while playing, like sometimes the graphics of a certain objects will disappear, or while in the hidden object scene, every click of the mouse will exit the screen until you go back to the main menu and reenter the game from there.

Voice acting was ok, I've heard better, but it's tolerable. All in all, if you like hidden object games you are probably gonna like this one too. If you have never played a HO game, you probably want to try a better game to see if you'll like the genre.

+ decent voice acting
+ mostly bug-free
+ cheap

- quite short
- not  very innovative
- some low res graphics
- a few bugs

If you like the genre, go ahead and buy it (it's really cheap), and if not you might wanna skip this one, although with this price tag, you can't go too wrong.     6/10

author: {'steamid': '76561198102160722', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 269, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 255, 'last_played': 1448939039}
review: Honestly, for the price, this game was worth it. Its nothing special, but its funny, like actually chuckling out loud funny. The characters are campy and it was obviously meant to be a less serious take on the vampire genre. The puzzles are not overly complicated, but its a silly way to kill a few hours, and I've spent $0.50 on worse.

author: {'steamid': '76561198017843065', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 142, 'playtime_forever': 283, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 283, 'last_played': 1451250011}
review:
Buggy, Dracula themed, point and click with a little Hidden Object and some puzzles.

I had to check the release date, this game is ageing very badly. The graphics are okay at first glance, within five seconds of playing my character was hovering halfway up the front door.
The sound is okay, though the script and story are cheesy and stuttering and not amusing enough to make up for it.
Whilst I only encountered one bug, in full screen I suddenly lost my exits and had to restart the game, the forums list more.
The puzzles and hidden object scenes are super easy and no challenge at all.

There are many many more much better examples of the genre out there. I got this in one of the seven bundles this has previously appeared in.

author: {'steamid': '76561197996446037', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 149, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 149, 'last_played': 1451247262}
review:
I couldn't tell for a while whether this game was meant to be hilariously bad, or whether it was just bad.  I finally figured it out about halfway through that it is meant to be hilariously bad -- but it shouldn't have taken me that long to get it.

So, ignore the voice acting and story, both of which are either bad or hilariously bad.  As a hidden object game, it's okay.  It has two modes: easy mode and advanced mode.  I wish there were a middle one.  In easy mode, if you don't find an object or a location within a few seconds, it will sparkle for you.  So you might as well just mindlessly click wherever is sparkling and you could finish the game with absolutely no brain power on your part at all.  But in advanced mode, sometimes locations were finicky to find, so I spent several minutes just clicking randomly around the screen before giving up and switching to "easy" mode just long enough to get the hint, and then switching back.

I enjoy hidden object games as a mental break.  This one took me about 2 hours to finish.  For the price I paid (a few cents, on sale), it was a fine way to spend an evening.  Recommended if you enjoy the genre and don't have high expectations

voice acting

review:
Devo dire di essere rimasto un p√≤ deluso da questo prodotto; Sinister City potrebbe solleticare l'interesse degli appassionati delle avventure grafiche vecchio stile e i puzzle proposti sono anche carini.. tuttavia mi chiedo chi sia il responsabile della localizzazione in italiano: un lavoro assolutamente approssimativo, soprattutto a livello lessicale, fondamentale per la risoluzione del gioco (un esempio per tutti: se mi si chiede di cercare l'oggetto "paper" nello studio di una psicologa, cerco uno stampato, non una paperella i gomma!).
Se proprio volete giocarlo, fatelo in inglese...

author: {'steamid': '76561198084965708', 'num_games_owned': 460, 'num_reviews': 14, 'playtime_forever': 81, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'last_played': 1450538618}
review:
Franchement, je ne sais pas ce que les cr√©ateurs de ce jeu ont pris comme drogue mais ca devait √™tre d'une qualit√© bizarre.
Bon, c'est un jeu d'hidden objects, je ne m'attendais pas non plus au jeu de l'ann√©e surtout √† ce prix l√† (et je l'avais eu en promo a encore moins) mais meme les 0.99‚Ç¨ ce jeu ne les vaut pas, c'est vous dire le niveau.
D'abord, il y a des problemes de traductions pour la version fran√ßaise sur certains objets qui ne correspondent pas aux mots, il manque parfois des lettres √©galement.
Ensuite, l'histoire est profondement ridicule (spoiler ahead), deja vous commencez le jeu dans un hotel et on voit envoie dans une autre dimension pour remonter le temps sauver votre fianc√©e, une tete de vampire g√©ante apparait et vous menace et vous enferme dans ce monde. Apres s'etre liber√©, on vous envoie au chateau du vampire o√π votre copine est enferm√©e. La bas, vous preparez devant le vampire meme une potion de verit√©, genre dans le jeu a 1m et il boit le tout sans se poser de question (dans un casque de viking oui, oui.) Je vous √©pargne les d√©tails mais plus tard on vous demande d'aller voir une psy mais elle a un trouble mental et ne veut pas vous recevoir car vous ne le connaissez pas donc vous cherchez.... "la psychologie pour les nuls" pour la convaincre. Vous en profitez aussi pour aller vous chercher un burger pendant que votre fianc√©e pourrie dans une cellule. Et vous savez comment ca se finit? Le m√©chant vampire devient la star d'un show TV et donc tout s'arrange. (ah et il vous mord en oubliant de jouer la comedie et vous transforme...).
Enfin bref, j'ai fini ce jeu d'une absurdit√© sans nom car c'etait tres court et que je l'avais pay√© mais √©conomisez votre argent. Car en plus des problemes de langue, d'histoire ect, les graphismes sont laids, il y a des bugs o√π vous flottez sur des portes ect. Les enigmes sont pratiquement toutes extremement faciles et meme si ce n'√©taient pas le cas, le temps de rechargement des indices est de quoi... 2secondes? (et pour les indices on vous fait un effet ignoble autour de ca...)

author: {'steamid': '76561198027075182', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 5, 'playtime_forever': 17, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 17, 'last_played': 1449997784}
review: I'd really like to play this game. There are a few mechanics that differ from many other HOGs. However, it's riddled with mechanic flaws that either back you out of puzzles with every click on the screen or others that cause graphical issues. I'll read reviews before I buy another game from this developer.

author: {'steamid': '76561198135664650', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 8, 'playtime_forever': 221, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 221, 'last_played': 1449986438}
review: Part Puzzle Solver / Part Object Finder at a elementary level . Sinister City's storyline is clearly targeted for a younger audience . The story length will vary , depending on one's puzzle skills , but I feel safe saying the average person will complete it in 1 1/2 - 2 1/2 hours . There are some bugs / glitches , but in almost 4 hours I experienced 2 , which were easily fixed by selecting the main menu and selecting continue .  A couple hours entertainment for $ .99 US  ,  not a bad deal for a younger gamer . Probably not for serious gamers , but it does offer entertainment . All my opinion from my own experience .

author: {'steamid': '76561198016437391', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 30, 'playtime_forever': 202, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 202, 'last_played': 1449897429}
review:
I'm not the biggest fan of hidden object games in general, but I think even die-hard fans wouldn't enjoy this one.

The hidden object sections were not great. The game progression was terrible. You basically work within a section of three areas, then advance to a new section. There are no long-term puzzles. The story is goofy, but poorly written.

The one bright spot were the non-HO puzzles. They were varied and interesting.

Even on sale, I can't recommend this game.

author: {'steamid': '76561198028570547', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 2563, 'playtime_forever': 169, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 169, 'last_played': 1458519046}
review:
"Sinister City" ist ein kurzes Wimmelbildspiel. Und ein sehr schwaches obendrein.

Die Story ist flunderflach: Freundin wird von Vampir entf√ºhrt. Wir m√ºssen sie retten, auch wenn unser Drang dazu eher gering sein mag. Versuche des Games, sich selbst zu ironisieren, scheitern kl√§glich.

Die Grafik ist schwach, teils peinlich. Insbesondere die Gesichtsz√ºge und Animationen der Protagonisten laden zum Lachen ein.

Der Vertonung ist schlichtweg unterirdisch. W√ºrde man die Sprecher als Laien bezeichnen, es w√§re eine Beleidigung f√ºr jeden Laien. 

Die R√§tsel sind zwar an sich sehr einfach, meist aber kryptisch und unlogisch. So manchesmal wei√ü man nicht so recht, wo es eigentlich weitergeht.
 
Aber das Schlimmste: an allen Ecken und Enden merkt man dem Game seine Touch-Screen-Herkunft an. Es wirkt alles wie eine unausgegorene, schnell hingeschluderte Portierung.

Nach zwei Stunden ist das Ganze - erfreulicherweise - vorbei.

[h1]Wertung:[/h1]
3/10 Atmosph√§re
2/10 Grafik
1/10 Sound
3/10 Spielmechanik
3/10 Balancing
2/10 Story 
3/10 Spielspass

[h1]Fazit:[/h1]
Nur f√ºr Hardcore-Wimmelbildspiel-Fans mit Leidensf√§higkeit oder Trash-Liebhaber geeignet. 

[h1][b]3/10 Gesamtwertung

author: {'steamid': '76561198200119165', 'num_games_owned': 187, 'num_reviews': 19, 'playtime_forever': 187, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 156, 'last_played': 1450613550}
review:
Yes, this game may be riddled with bugs left and right, and everyone's complaining about how the crazy amount of bugs have ruined or stunted their gameplay (at some point, it did for me too), but once we learn how to get over the bugs, it turned out to be actually a pretty decent game. The puzzles are very simple and the hidden objects aren't that hard at all, good for a casual play, and I suppose the humor of the story isn't for everyone, but it really hit the spot for me! Great twist in story and merging of stereotypical realms to make it not so stereotypical xD

If you're the type who prefers quality graphics and smooth gameplay with challenging puzzles, then this game may disappoint you.

author: {'steamid': '76561198208369303', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 15, 'playtime_forever': 246, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 246, 'last_played': 1449509823}
review:
Recccomended!

After reading all the negative revieuws I decided to give it a try for 99 cents and I am glad I did it.


Fun game, a bit different then other HOG games, but that's why I like  it, it's a nice alternation.

You are a character that walks throufg the game and this  makes you feel more involved .


If you're stuck ( the game has some bugs ) just exit the game and restart it, that will fix the problem.

review:
This game is cheesy which is fine but toward the end of the game the screens stopped rendering all together.  I was unable to finish the game because the screen went white and I couldn't select the items I needed to finish.
I'm not sure this game was actually QA'd at all.
It's unfortunate as I have liked other JetDogs games.

author: {'steamid': '76561198122066368', 'num_games_owned': 1425, 'num_reviews': 74, 'playtime_forever': 254, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 254, 'last_played': 1440821547}
review: Be a boyfriend of a vampire daughter and solve puzzle to rescue her from a vampire castle. Quite amusing game and challenging for ordinary style point and click games.

author: {'steamid': '76561198046407276', 'num_games_owned': 6090, 'num_reviews': 233, 'playtime_forever': 205, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 205, 'last_played': 1437825382}
review:
[h1]Vampires, unintended funnyness, and some hidden objects[/h1]

The game is actually not a good HOG, if you run over it, please don't even mind to turn around and pick it up. It will bite you in your face and make you cry a lot...

The story is painful, to say the least, all superficially set up, a story about vampires, yes... but a real stupid one. It's funny in a very naive way, and the [i]weird[/i] funnyness does set the game into the right clownery. If you want a square and fair, Hidden Object Game, please look elsewhere... this is... ugh!

[b]Pros:[/b][list][*]Graphics are on the ok side, but that's about all.[/list]

[b]Cons:[/b][list][*]Tries too much to be funny, or is too funny unintended... I don't know and I won't bother.[*]The game is so stereotypical, that it does cause physical pain... I am still fighting back the headaches.[*]Puns, puns, puns... the devs should have learned, that sometimes less is more.[/list]

[h1]Not Recommended[/h1]

This hidden object is neither a hidden gem, nor is it a pearl that is cast to me... It's plain painful to play the game, and you can take it only in small doses, or it will make you go mad. 

The game has a babyish attitude around the topic and it's story. The characters are very, very shallow to say the least.

If you want to play a HOG, don't put this on your choice list, there are a lot of games better suited!

author: {'steamid': '76561198074204472', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 29, 'playtime_forever': 183, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 183, 'last_played': 1448790293}
review:
Just by looking at the reviews for this game, I knew I was in for a cringeworthy title. Everything in this game was cringy, but I still enjoyed it. It's like a Bollywood movie, complete with bad acting and scenery, but it's part of the joke. Plus, puzzles and mini games. 

You play as John, who is searching for his bride Nina, who is being held captive by her father Count Orlock. You must solve puzzles and unlock the path to free her and complet Orlock's wish: to become a famous Hollywood actor. Not much more can be said about that, pretty much tells it's own story right there.

Aside from the acting, I enjoyed the puzzles because some actually were challenging. 

P.S. How is Ipkis married?

review: Sinister City is some incoherent mumbo-jumbo concerning show business vampires.  Short and easy but the story is poorly translated garbage and the gameplay is a little clunky for a hidden object game.  One of the lesser hidden object adventures.

author: {'steamid': '76561198168114460', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 21, 'playtime_forever': 337, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 337, 'last_played': 1448671369}
review:
What can I say, played one HOG played them all. It's a fun waste of time if your brain is looking for something to do but hardly anything groundbreaking or exciteing. The puzzles are fairly easy once you figure out what they want you to do and the only hard part seemed to be finding them, even in easy mode where things are suposed to tell you where to look I sometimes found myself randomly clicking around the room till I found something. Once you know where to click and what to look for odds are you'll beat it in an hour.

The plot is goofy and the overdramatic dialogue is worthy of a saturday morning cartoon but I think that was the actual intent this time, like the developers knew no one actualy takes the story part of a HOG seriously and decided to just have fun with it. While good for a laugh or two it's hardly engaging or suspenseful but considering it's dirt cheep you can't really expect Shakespeare.

Taken for what it is, a cheep brain teaser with a B-movie plot then it's worth playing if only to score some easy acheaves or take a break from shooting zombies, but if your looking for something more serious I'd give this a pass.

author: {'steamid': '76561198193227553', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 21, 'playtime_forever': 228, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 228, 'last_played': 1448475214}
review:
Such a fun and cooky point and click game!  I read some of the comments and was worried with gamers saying it wasn't starting and achievements were not unlocking... however, it went smoothly for me.  You have wonderfully cheezy voice acting and puzzles that are not terribly difficult.  This is a fun four hour romp and well worth the price of admission.

Note: I would start the game on the Advance difficulty, the game does not penalize you (in other words... achievements are not missed) for clicking away if you are somewhat lost.
