author: {'steamid': '76561198017309563', 'num_games_owned': 206, 'num_reviews': 20, 'playtime_forever': 130, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 130, 'last_played': 1447102092}
review:
A search & find objects game. Can pretty much find these for free on the nets.. bought it for less then 20 cents.. if it was worth the money? sure, it kept me entertained for longer than anything else of 20 cents would :P This game contains a storyline.. which is just.. weird and stupid.. Kind vampires? Reminded me of twilight, that bad. xD

Overall; if you enjoy the search and find objects in a "picture", you'll enjoy this game. If you dont.. then you wont. xD As you surely dont want to play it for the storyline.

author: {'steamid': '76561198013485259', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 519, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 519, 'last_played': 1448142322}
review:
I give this game points for charm because I liked its outrageous story line and campy quality, though a lot of the humor was labored. My favorite line was Ms. Seward's: "Now, goodbye forever, you handsome manifestation of my childhood complexes!" I agree with her. The voice acting was fine, except for Ipkis, who was overdone. It was hard to believe he was star material.

This game should be called "Fetch Quest City"; and many of those quests were silly or illogical. A bunch of lazy characters waiting around for a needy fool to show up and do their work for them. The innkeeper was particularly inept at keeping track of stuff in his own establishment. Also, some of the HOG scenes closed after every click, requiring a lot of unnecessary work because I had to reopen those scenes and click, and reopen those scenes and click again, ad nauseum. Upon replay, I discovered that by exiting to the Main Menu and clicking on Continue, that problem was resolved.

The game has no help system to explain how the game saves. Since exiting to the Main Menu and clicking on Continue resulted in a "loading" message, I figured that it was a way to force the game to save, which was handy for working around the bugs. I saved a lot to avoid problems.

I have two issues with the game's graphics. The first problem was the screen aspect ratio. It was stretched side-to-side; so everything was wide, which was especially noticeable with circular objects like wheels and gears and the two globes on the HUD at the bottom of the screen. It looked like the game was designed for a standard monitor (4:3 ratio). I tried the only option available‚ÄîWindow mode‚Äîbut the window was the same wide-screen ratio and everything was still distorted. And the window could not be resized to reduce the distortion. My nVidia graphics card is incredibly capable of handling aspect rations, but this game did not cooperate.

The second graphic problem involved HOG scenes and puzzles. Parts of the screen were blank. Meaning: solid white. In the case of the HOGs, I was able to able to access the Main Menu via the HUD and resolve the problem as described above. When I clicked on Continue and returned to the game, the visual problem was solved. However, there is no HUD available in the puzzle screens; so, there is no way to work around the problem, except to cancel the game via ALT+CTRL+DELETE. I was unable to solve one of the puzzles because of this problem and had to skip the puzzle; so, I didn't earn the Enigmatist achievement. Upon replay, I exited to the Main Menu prior to the puzzle and clicked Continue to fix the graphic issue and earned the achievement.

"Sinister City" was cute and fun, but clunky. I'm surprised that such a recent release has these problems.

author: {'steamid': '76561198005701579', 'num_games_owned': 2413, 'num_reviews': 83, 'playtime_forever': 188, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 188, 'last_played': 1448027056}
review:
Mediocre hidden-object game. 
+ Some nice puzzles.
+ The sound is ok and the graphics are good, too, but nothing special.

+/- The story is so rediculous that can get funny at times. 

- The voice-overs are horrible, though I kind of liked the director's voice.
- Small - it took me about 2.30 hours to complete - but this could be a thing for some.
- Quite a lot of bugs and they can actually make the game easier since, for example, some h/o scenes were totally white exept for the places that the items I needed to find were. 

For the 1‚Ç¨ it asks, it can be an idea for h/o fans that don't have anything else to play...

author: {'steamid': '76561198170032734', 'num_games_owned': 79, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 534, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 138, 'last_played': 1498128949}

author: {'steamid': '76561198161773201', 'num_games_owned': 1509, 'num_reviews': 20, 'playtime_forever': 268, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 268, 'last_played': 1448024061}
review:
I think that the people who didn't recommend this game clearly missed the game entirely.

It's a quick game, done in 3 hours (plus a few more: now that I have to go find a few achievements that i missed).

Story is hilarious, the graphics and voice acting fit perfectly together, and the art is good. Great game that had me laughing and ended up turning the night into a family night as we all played the game together.

The object finding side isn't repetitive, and the mini-puzzles are fun and challenging, but not too challenging. 
The steam achievements and cards round out the rest perfectly. 

Don't take the game too seriously, it wasn't meant to be.

author: {'steamid': '76561198092696413', 'num_games_owned': 159, 'num_reviews': 9, 'playtime_forever': 241, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 241, 'last_played': 1447786281}
review: As a season veteran at Sinister City (having all acheivements), i can whole-heartly say that is was the best game i have ever played. I sit here, in my computer chair; the credits begin to roll across the screen - i stand, pants around my ankles, eyes filled with tears. My mind racing, a smile fixed upon my face still trying to process the peice of art i have just witnessed.. This game is revolutionary and life-changing. I recommend experiencing this rollercoaster of emotions as i have, you will return a forever changed Vamp Kid.

author: {'steamid': '76561198042767543', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 37, 'playtime_forever': 419, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 212, 'last_played': 1468497423}
review:
The first thing you need to know about this game is that it is a parody. It makes fun of old B-movies and doesn't take itself too serious.

If you like "hidden object" games this is a neat little game to keep you busy for an hour or two, and at this price I have to recommend it.

As a "hidden object" game it is not overly hard so you can actually get through it without using hints.

There is one small, somewhat annoying bug where the game sometimes doesn't let you click on a destination. When this happens, simply exit to menu, wait a few seconds and then continue and it should be resolved.

To sum up, a "hidden object" game of medium difficulty level, that parodies old B-horror movies.

author: {'steamid': '76561198077652387', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 3, 'playtime_forever': 214, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 214, 'last_played': 1447599052}
review:
This game is the epitome of a "not too serious" game. With an intentionally janky plot, this is a game you can finish in less than two hours, have a laugh about, and then get on with your day.

I encountered bugs at one or two points, but there's nothing a game restart can't fix.

author: {'steamid': '76561198083652056', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 17, 'playtime_forever': 121, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 121, 'last_played': 1447594966}
review: It is a really good game for ONLY 7p! If you don't get this game your not very smaaaart. I completed the story mode in 2 hours and I personaly feel they were the best 2 hours of my life. Also if the puzzles bore you, you can just skip them by waiting 10-20 seconds....I skipped all the puzzles. I would  say the story line was great but I don't really know what the story was even after completing it.... Also the graphics need MASSIVE improvements as some things just look disabled. No other way of putting it tbh. Also when you have to find things it's really easy as you get unlimited hints and you can just spam your mouse and you basically find all of them in seconds!

author: {'steamid': '76561197963164050', 'num_games_owned': 999, 'num_reviews': 221, 'playtime_forever': 168, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 168, 'last_played': 1447594181}
review:
Hard decision. It has a few bugs and the gameplay isn't flawless. You never know if you found everything in a HO scene, because there isn't even an indicator wether you can find anything there or not, which means that wild clicking is the easiest and fastest way to finish it. There is no penalty for it even on advanced, The puzzles are so easy, that they are just there for making the game a little bit longer. If they are not too easy, then they are annoying. Sometimes you have no idea where to go or what to do.

BUT! The story and how everything is told is so hillarious, that it compensates everything! It makes jokes about vampires, adventure games, hollywood and all the classic cliches about lovestories and movies in general. Sure, it has a hard start and you will probably need a little bit time to get in, but after that, it is really nice to watch the characters. Wish, that i could say the same for the actual gameplay, which is only "acceptable".

So if you are a hard boiled fan of HO games and horror-commedy, then you can have fun with it.

author: {'steamid': '76561198143665450', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 224, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 224, 'last_played': 1447516520}
review: it is a nice game to spend your time... its not something huge.... but for 0.09...you get your money back from the cards

author: {'steamid': '76561198013571930', 'num_games_owned': 1012, 'num_reviews': 8, 'playtime_forever': 171, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 111, 'last_played': 1598673206}
review:
Hidden object games can be pretty hit and miss but this one's really good fun. It realises that the story is just a flimsy premise to find objects so has fun with it and takes the piss. The setups to find x number of y object are predictably ludicrous and presented with a knowing wink of the fact.

Overall a fun above average hidden object game that'll kill a few hours.

The best part was the price. I got this game at 91% off during one of the sales so it cost me 11 cents (NZD) and as the game also has trading cards which can be sold for more than that I'll actually make money from playing this game.

author: {'steamid': '76561198079789371', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 134, 'playtime_forever': 14, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 14, 'last_played': 1447541662}

author: {'steamid': '76561198030258012', 'num_games_owned': 384, 'num_reviews': 40, 'playtime_forever': 207, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 179, 'last_played': 1506007357}
review:
Sinister City is certainly the most breathtaking game of 2014, and as for me buying it for only 0,09‚Ç¨ is a massive steal. 

Anybody looking for a deep, thought provoking mystery drama should definetly check this wonderous game out. The amazing world building and dynamic characters are only the beginning, as they only scratch the surface of the actual genius and innovative gameplay.

 Now as opposed to todays RPG, shooting and action based this game takes a creative path in making you think deeply about your choices, as you uncover the mystery of what happened to your missing wife. You're always forced to stay focused and look for subtle clues in your enviroment, and the aesthetics just makes the experience a whole lot better.

 When I first saw this game on steam I was unsure about it's directional capabilities, however I found myself surprised by the sheer level of thought and care taken into crafting such a epic and emotionally investing story that will keep you thinking about it for days on end. I would have to give this game a solid 20/10 and I hope that more people will be able to experience this hidden gem amongst the rocks. -Aru

review: Best 9 cents I've spent on Steam. I sold trading cards for 20 cents and spent a few hours enjoying the game.  I had to remove special characters from my Steam name to run the game, which was very annoying, however after I launched the game all was forgiven. This game is funny parody of its genre and is so glitchy that I cry and laugh all the time - check out my screenshots. The vampire teletubby is awesome as well as the psychologist character (outdated stereotype). I can't believe I'm saying this, but I would buy this game for it's full price.

author: {'steamid': '76561198195042190', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 26, 'playtime_forever': 104, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 104, 'last_played': 1447449690}
review:
j'ai acheter ce jeu 10 centime en sachant que ce jeu est pourri
point positif:
Aucun! (A moins que vous vendez les cartes mais encore...)
Point n√©gatif:
-Graphisme a chier
-Histoire digne d'un navet qui ne ferais m√™me pas sourire quelqu'un sous LSD
-Bug d'affichage qui vous oublie de relancer le jeu (plusieur fois pour certains bugs)
-Bo √©nervante pour un jeux d'enigme
-Jeu d'une facilit√©e √™treme et ce m√™me en mode difficile
En conclusion:
Sinister city est un jeux qui ne m√©rite absolument pas votre achat ni votre temps!Le pire Hidden object que j'ai jou√©e de ma vie (et j'en n'ai jou√©e une centaine)
0.5/10 (uniquement car il a des cartes pour me rembourser le jeu)

author: {'steamid': '76561198076462559', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 4, 'playtime_forever': 85, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 85, 'last_played': 1447438650}
review:
My friend gifted me this game for 9 cents. Here we go.

I knew from the Jet Dog Studios intro that this was, in fact, something I would enjoy.

The voices do not match up to mouth animations. I was not deterred.

First time leading man talks, his spoken lines do not match up to what is written in the text box.

Classic wheelin' and dealin' from receptionist. Thumbs up.

First creepy scene. You know what I mean(no spoilers). Was actually pretty good. Thumbs up. Short and sweet. 

In my youth, I loved Where's Waldo and the knock-offs, but I-Spy wasn't my thing, so the gameplay is knocked down a little due to a bias against. Although, the way the puzzles are introduced is well done.


-Glitch Report #1: After being locked in Astral Plane and told to search for mirror pieces, the game would not let me click on anything except to walk around. Had to return to main menu and continue. This fixed the issue.

-Glitch Report #2: When I reloaded to fix glitch #1, while I can click to search areas, when i click to check or pick up an item, it brings back to the walking section. Everytime. This makes searching very tedious. 

-Glitch Report #3: I reloaded, but #2 prevailed. So I continue, despite frustration. This lead to accessing a puzzle and half the items are whited out. Impossible to search for everything. Correction: I found everything very easily as they were about half of what was actually visible. Nice.... for a while. Until the items are in the white areas. Eventually have to keep using hints to show me where they are, so I can click them. Now I have to repair the mirror and half the screen is white.

-Glitch Report #4: I have one piece left. everytime i try to put it in place, it askes me "Are you sure you want to skip puzzle?" I keep saying no.

Glitches subside. Will let me take garlic and knives to a fight, but not the guns. I even had to find a bullet in a puzzle. I have at least one. Let me take the gun. Thumbs down.

Orlock didn't notice I was preparing a truth potion right in his fire? Got to Tv Station. I'm kinda bored, and was gifted two wishlist games. I'll go there for now.

Recommend: For ISpy fans, yes. Umm....4/5 for what it is. A find-the-item-puzzle game with a few walking sequences between puzzles and a very cheesy "hollywood" vampire love story. Might finish someday.

author: {'steamid': '76561197996273719', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 798, 'playtime_forever': 208, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 149, 'last_played': 1443715228}
review:
Vorwort:

In Sinister City geh√∂ren Vampire zum ganz allt√§glichen Alltag und mischen √ºberall mit.

Du spielst einen jungen Mann, der allerdings ein Mensch ist und gerne seiner Freundin einen Heiratsantrag machen w√ºrde. Doch diese verschwindet eines Tages spurlos. Somit beginnt deine Geschichte.


Zum Spiel selbst:

Bei diesem Spiel √ºberwiegt vor allen Dingen das mehrfache Suchen von Gegenst√§nden am gleichen Ort, z.B. 12 Lampen usw. Das wird auf die Dauer langweilig und monoton. Die gesuchten Gegenst√§nde erschlagen fast einen und fallen einem meist direkt ins Auge, so gro√ü wie diese gezeichnet sind. Allerdings bei wenig anderen musste man schon ganz genau hinsehen,da diese winzig in irgend eine Ecke geschoben wurden. Das wiederum frustet deutlich.

Aber das Gr√∂√üte Problem sind die vielen Bugs wo vorhanden sind wie z.B. Grafikfehler wo das Spielgeschehen dr√ºben oder wo man sich auf der Karte nicht mehr bewegen kann und auf der Stelle eingefroren ist und so ein voranschreiten der Story nicht gew√§hrleist. Die Bugs lassen sich aber alle beheben durch Neustart des Spiels, zumindest war es so bei mir. Die Story hat man in max. 3 Stunden durchgespielt, dies kommt aber auf euren Typ an.

Im Gro√ü und Ganzen ist es ein unterhaltsames Spiel f√ºr einen Abend, dass auch witzige Szenen enth√§lt und man manchmal schmunzeln muss, aber kein Spiel, das man mehrmals spielt. Ich von meiner Seite aus w√ºrde es trotzdem nocheinmal kaufen, aber nur wenn es im Sale ist und wer mit gelegentliche Bugs leben kann.

author: {'steamid': '76561198092232110', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 91, 'playtime_forever': 125, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 107, 'last_played': 1447621635}
review:
Kann die negativen Reviews nicht wirklich verstehe - und ich bin jemand, der Spiele relativ kritisch sieht.
Wollte es mir erst aufgrund der negativen Reviews nicht kaufen, jedoch war es auf 0,09 Euro runtergesetzt und ich hab's versucht. Ich war √§u√üerst positiv √ºberrascht! Die in anderen Reviews beschriebenen "mangelnden Texturen", welche einen angeblich "Tr√§nen lachen lassen solchen", konnte ich nicht mal ansatzweise finden. Die Story gef√§llt mir ganz gut, wobei die immer noch sehr simpel und vorhersehbar ist. Die R√§tsel sind aber hingegen abwechslungsreich und interessant.
Was mir auch gut gef√§llt ist, dass man viele Achievements bekommt. Sammelkarten gibt es auch noch, welche man gut verkaufen kann.
Sprich: Selbst, wenn man das Spiel hasst, macht man Gewinn (sollte man es f√ºr die besagten 0,09 Euro gekauft haben).

author: {'steamid': '76561198032518991', 'num_games_owned': 591, 'num_reviews': 41, 'playtime_forever': 147, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 147, 'last_played': 1447317713}
review:
The positive reviews that convinced me to give it a try claim that this game is misunderstood satire. What they don't say is that it's bad, poorly made, and glitchy as hell "satire" (let's be honest though, this is not satire, this is a parody). Even its puzzles are a laugh (to a point where one could theorize that maybe it wasn't intended as a parody of the vampire genre but of HOGs -hidden object games- in general).

Yes, it has a couple of funny moments here and there and yes, it's real cheap, but that doesn't make it a good game that's worth your time.

If you get it at it's current sale price (0,09 cents) you won't lose any money, since it has trading cards, but again, this doesn't make it a good game, just an affordable one.

If you like over-the-top, absurd comedies that feature vampires and don't mind glitches that could prevent you from finishing the game, then yes, it's worth it. You'll get a couple of chuckles and I have to admit, a funny HOG is a rare and refreshing thing. But that's about it.

I am tempted to give it a thumbs-up for it's campy glory, but it has some of the worst glitches I've ever seen in HOGs and that's one of the biggest faux-pas a game of this genre can have. I can stand bad art, bad or non existent voice acting, a flimsy plot and random fetch quests. But I have to be able to play the game, to say that it's at least mediocre, don't you think?

author: {'steamid': '76561197992856964', 'num_games_owned': 1022, 'num_reviews': 232, 'playtime_forever': 274, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 274, 'last_played': 1447315146}
review:
Tepid casual gameplay, absolutely ridiculous writing that doesn't take itself seriously but plays it straight, and a lot more fun than it actually deserves to be.

If you know what you're doing, you can power through this with no walkthrough in around an hour; so assume you're getting around an hour of stifled chuckles out of this one.  If it's on sale for a dime, absolutely get it.  If it's the full price of around a dollar?  Maybe still worth it.

author: {'steamid': '76561198066577948', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 12, 'playtime_forever': 157, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 157, 'last_played': 1447192950}
review:
For 0.09$ , there's not much you can expect, so the game managed to exceed my expectations. 

Pros:
- Good enough story - don't expect nothing deep, but it's great for what it is. An simple, but effective story with many refferences and ironies
- Puzzles are easy and well done
- It's engaging enough to make you want to finish it
- The price - It costs as much as an bubble gum when on sale and offers 2-3 hours of non-repetitive gameplay. 

Cons:
- Some bugs on some parts of the game. Nothing game breaking, but they made things harder than they should have
- Pretty short
- Graphics are kinda outdated for 2014 (would have prefered isometric view than 3D)
- Some objects are hard to spot

Definetly recommended due to it's sale price.

author: {'steamid': '76561198020748121', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 18, 'playtime_forever': 173, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 173, 'last_played': 1446916190}
review: Tengo que admitir que los juegos que consisten en buscar objetos por los escenarios me gustan y por 9 c√©ntimos que costaba no iba a dejar pasar la oportunidad. Me ha salido a 3 c√©ntimos la hora as√≠ que en ese sentido ha cumplido, malo si hubiera que pagar 5 euros.  Solo me han salido dos bugs y ambos relacionados con el fondo, el personaje no era colocado de manera que encajara y se fusionara con el escenario. Y por lo dem√°s poco m√°s que comentar, ameno y con una historia entretenida a pesar de que no se toma en serio ni a si mismo y varios puzzles en los que ser√° d√≠ficil quedarse atascado. Trae cromos as√≠ que si lo veis barato como yo merece la pena darle una oportunidad, y teniendo eso en cuenta mi voto es positivo.

author: {'steamid': '76561198093220384', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 148, 'playtime_forever': 140, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 140, 'last_played': 1446341543}
review:
I've played many hidden object games but have never bothered reviewing any of them, partly because I think everybody generally gets the idea by now and more or less knows what to expect, but also because, with a few exceptions, there's usually so little difference between the content and quality that were I to write reviews for each and every one I'd essentially end up trying to find dozens of different ways to say the exact same thing. (By the by, just about anything published by Artifex Mundi should see you right if you're looking to get into the genre) But I'm writing one for Sinister City as I feel I need to come to its defence a little and share my own take on it.

It seems like such a cop-out when people say the only reason somebody doesn't like something is because they don't understand it. It's sort of a thinly-veiled way of calling someone stupid rather than accept they might understand it perfectly but just not like it, that they simply have a different preference than you. But after reading a lot of the negative reviews, this is one occasion where I actually feel like some people kinda didn't get it. As pretentious and w*nky as it is to say, there is a difference between something being parody, pastiche and just plain bad, and this game dips its toes into all three, which is where I think a lot of confusion comes from.

Let's get it out of the way and say what needs to be said, many parts of this game are bad, unintentionally so. Graphically it's kind of somewhere between looking like a PS2 and PS3 era game and there were quite a few times in the hidden object sections when I wished everything was clearer or more distinct. In other games in the genre these sections can have a more artistic slant with their high quality renders of interesting scenes and items. Here, everything is far more workmanlike and pretty forgettable; a straight on view of some open cupboards or top down into a box with a small handful of items in it. They don't feel hugely inspired. But worst of all are the bugs and glitches that plague the game. It happened to me a few times where some strange artifacting would appear in the form of white blocks across the screen and completely obscure my view, or every time I'd click anywhere in a hidden object scene it would kick me out of it forcing me to manually enter the scene repeatedly after every object I found. In fairness, this only happened to me in the second stage of the game then never bothered me again after (exiting to the main menu then hitting Continue eventually seemed to fix this for me. In some cases I think Steam pop-ups may have triggered this to happen, but I'm not completely sure). They were the only issues I had personally, but others have complained of far worse, like losing save data every time they closed the game or buggy achievements not registering properly, or in some cases, not even being able to start the game at all. And if anyone had these issues then they'd be absolutely right to give it a bad review as their experience with the title. But, thankfully, I had a far better time with it. Well... eventually.

[View Comments for the missing 4th paragraph]

You play as a sort of Tom Cruise lookalike trying to find his kidnapped fianc√© and being lead to Sinister City in the search. A kindly old hotel receptionist tells him to stay away from there, that it's a vampire city, and the guy doesn't even bat an eyelid at the mention of vampires. Nor does he when he's invited to a session of telepathic communication to try tracking her down, he just accepts the offer and follows an old man into a darkened back room. I think pretty much everyone who plays it either laughs their *ss off at these points or else says it's stupid and loses all hope for the game, I know they were certainly my reactions. But then I got to a point where it just sort of clicked with me. I realised they understood these games are dumb and their stories make no sense, so they start having a little fun and going all out ridiculous with it. The head vampire kidnaps his own daughter to arrange for her to marry a kid's TV presenter to vicariously live out his own failed ambitions of movie stardom that he's secretly harboured for centuries. Oscar Wilde, this is not. But I love that they have fun with it rather than being so serious like most of the other games and I was surprised at how much I laughed at some genuinely funny moments in it. If you have to make a crazy, nonsense story, I think it's way better to go funny with it instead of trying to be respectable with how legit you are with your craft, and I applaud them for making that move here.

Like I said, if anyone had a bad experience with this on a technical level then I can't argue with that, and to begin with I was right there with them. But by the end this game thoroughly won me over and I had a great couple of hours with it. With some funny moments, some interesting hidden object play that I eventually came around to, and at least an attempt at a new variety of mini games for the genre, I can easily say this was the best 9 cents I've ever spent.

author: {'steamid': '76561198079634434', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 20, 'playtime_forever': 396, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 266, 'last_played': 1448528758}
review: This hidden object/puzzle game is a great way to pass a few hours.  Great characters, a storyline, and objects are not so rediculously hard to find that they take away the fun aspect.

author: {'steamid': '76561198009026799', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 7, 'playtime_forever': 127, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 127, 'last_played': 1446861603}
review:
This game is a perfect example of why I wish Steam had a "Meh." option, instead of just yes or no to a recommendation.

I have played several point-and-click, hidden object games at this point, and there are definitely some things that Sinister City does that I appreciate, albeit not well enough to not be a bit, frankly, dumb. 

Here's the break-down for me, + signs being positives and - being negatives.
+Incorporation of 3-dimensional character models. While most games of this type simply present you with a two-dimensional scene, in this you do actually have to move the protagonist, John, around in a space.
- However, on that same note, the areas where you can move are more or less two-dimensional and not all of them seem to have been designed with a character walking around them in mind. This results in some frankly hilarious looking scenes, like John and the TV Station security guard just hovering above the ground in front of the TV station, as if they were part of the door and not actual characters. 
+ Voice Acting - for a casual game of this type, it's actually really good.
- Except for John's voice. And he's the main character. So he talks all the time. (Ipkis is pretty bad too but you only have to talk to him a couple times)
- The background music isn't bad, but it is extremely repetitive.
- Game is short, even for a HOP game. 
+ Price. Guys for real, it's a dollar. Even if you end up despising it, are you really gonna cry over that dollar?
+ Story...it's satirical of your typical spooky vampire motif, which is actually genuinely amusing at times. Not funny, but amusing. Worthy of a slight smirk. Also, John and Nina's lovey-dovey-ness is so over the top that it becomes a humorous exaggeration of dime-a-dozen love stories. Whether or not this was intentional is debatable, but seeing it as satire makes it more bearable.
- Story ... buuuuutttt a lot of it feels rushed and nonsensical, even for a game about a town full of vampires (who completely openly exist and no one really questions it....?). Spoiler free example: When your character finds out his fiancee is being held in a town full of vampires, he at no point stops and says, "Woah, man. Slow your roll. VAMPIRES? Vampires are real?" He's basically Anakin Skywalker in Episode 3 of Star Wars, but without the death, ("Oh my god, what have I done? Waaaahhhhhhh"  ... "So you wanna join the Dark Side?" ... "Yeah, okay.") He just immediately accepts something that you would think would be a hell of a revelation for your average human dude who just wants to get married.
- Saw the last bit of the ending coming a mile away.
+ All the characters actually have a unique design and personalities, however minimal those personalities may be.
+ Several objects in the HOPs were genuinely difficult to find, which I like.
- But all the other minigames were horrendously easy.

All in all, it really is a "meh" kind of thing for me. I didn't like it, but I didn't dislike it. Had it been fleshed out more into a bigger and longer story, and more time taken on animation, it could have been really good. The developers definitely have some skill; it's just in need of serious refinement. 
I labeled it as recommended in the end because of the price. It's only a buck, and there are definitely worse things to do when you're bored, and worse games that I've played for more money--on sale.

author: {'steamid': '76561198092735548', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 7, 'playtime_forever': 167, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 164, 'last_played': 1479165627}
review:
This game is so laughably good, everything made me chuckle, the corny dalogue, the WTF did I just solve that puzzle for moments... Everything. 

Its not a difficult game by any means, there are loads of hidden object puzzles about the place but theres a hint button should you get stuck. (I did when an item I needed to find did not show up so I just clicked about where the hint mentioned) 

I got this game in a steam sale for 9p and to be honest grab it on a sale like that, its a few hours of corny entertainment as long as you dont take it seriously.

author: {'steamid': '76561197994830200', 'num_games_owned': 744, 'num_reviews': 106, 'playtime_forever': 153, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 153, 'last_played': 1446710227}
review:
Worth it for the 10 cents I paid, wouldn't be dismayed if I paid full price. Actually found it pretty funny and some of the puzzles were overall fun. It really owns its kitsch and plays in it. In a way it felt more like a point and click adventure game of old that happened to have some hidden object areas.

I did hit the mirror glitch some people talk about but I just escaped to main menu and hit continue and I was able to play on without issue.

author: {'steamid': '76561197987210144', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 13, 'playtime_forever': 99, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 99, 'last_played': 1446673952}
review: So, this game takes a bit over an hour. It's a pretty simple hidden object and puzzle game. If you like those, you'll like this. The story is seriously stupid and goofy, which it is supposed to be, but still, I had a good time playing it. Recommended for people who like hidden object and non-challenging puzzles. Not recommended for people who like well scripted storylines.

The 3d models are fairly nice, textures are okay in the beginning but the 3d model sometimes just walks up into thin air and about halfway through there's just MISSING TEXTURES that never load and so you can't beat that chapter. Lame.

review:

review:
Como fan de los point&click, este juego me parece bastante malo. Es un juego de encontrar los objetos ocultos, mezclado con algunos puzzles m√°s (MUY f√°ciles). 

Los puzzles son muy sencillos, el argumento es un poco bobo, y tiene algunos bugs en los que hay que reiniciar el juego para solventarlos (imperdonable).
Gr√°ficamente es muy poco uniforme: modelado de personajes correcto, pero no cuadran con los decorados. La interfaz no encaja por ning√∫n lado. 
Por otro lado, el hecho de que los di√°logos est√©n doblados al ingl√©s es un punto a su favor.

Posiblemente ser√≠a un buen juego si estuvieramos en el a√±o 2000, pero... no lo estamos.

Puedes plantearte comprarlo si est√° de oferta al 90%; ya sea por probar, o para que jueguen ni√±os (que no le suelen dar importancia a este tipo de "detalles"). En cualquier otro caso, por tu bien, mantente alejado de √©l.

review: The story is the worst and corniest of all JetDogs games I've played so far. The advanced mode removes all navigational aids so you have no idea what is actually clickable or not. I can only recommend this game for people seeking easy achievements. When it's on sale, and you have a few hours to waste cringing, and you want to collect a few easy achievements, then buy this game. If you don't want any of that, don't buy this game.

author: {'steamid': '76561198091959655', 'num_games_owned': 1347, 'num_reviews': 89, 'playtime_forever': 232, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 232, 'last_played': 1445674884}
review:
As fan of point and click games i have to say that this game doesn't was that i expected.

Sinister city is an Point & Click / Hidden Object game, that it's messed up. After 4 hours (4 boring hours), i have finished the game and i would like to give you my view points from this game.

- First of all the story doesn't have sense, as example you have to help a receptionist to find some documents, but 60% of them are behind him, is him so fucking lazy ?

- The graphic quality looks horrible (i don't care graphics like the rest of the people), have to say that to be a game made on 2014 looks horrible (like a PSX game) compared with other games from same dev.

- It has some bugs that makes you restart the game and start from the save point.

- It has teletubbies, seriously.

Something that i enjoyed was the voice actuation and some music background from stages.

I do not recommend you this game, unless it's on sale (just for a few cents), you have been warned.

4 / 10

author: {'steamid': '76561198029726549', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 3, 'playtime_forever': 421, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 421, 'last_played': 1446051163}
review: If you don't care about achievements, the game was ok. Not too hard. Silly dialog to enjoy. Vampire satire. Not recommending because achievements were bugged. Some popped up as 'earned' in game but they did not register on Steam. Finally got Steam credit for 17/17 achievements after 3 run-throughs... yes, I'm a bit obsessive..  BUT did not get Steam credit for a 'perfect game'. Finally found a solution in the Guides on Community Hub. Suggest you check out the discussions before purchasing the game. Paid 0.99. Have really enjoyed other unbugged JetDogs games. Don't judge all by this one.

author: {'steamid': '76561198022104383', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 69, 'playtime_forever': 71, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 27, 'last_played': 1464894721}
review:
This is a nice little "Hidden Objects" game with a neat story. Not a great story, but a neat story.

PROS
====
1.) Pretty good puzzles and interesting locations
2.) Nice graphics
3.) Plenty of side puzzles to keep you amused
4.) $0.99, although I paid $0.49 with coupon

CONS
====
1.) Grphic glitches once in a while
2.) Game itself glitches (Sometimes won't let you click on stuff)
3.) Story is not the best, in fact it's not great at all
4.) Once in a while, some text doesn't match the voice
5.) Better to get it 50% off or better
6.) Sadly, there are better "Hidden Objects" games out there

Overall it's not THAT bad, but you may hate the graphic glitches it has. Just a side note, if you get to a point where it says you can do something, but you can't click on anything, just restart the game, it should fix the problem. Ideally, this was really designed for "Touch Screens", such as Android or touch pads.

author: {'steamid': '76561198003545953', 'num_games_owned': 3094, 'num_reviews': 106, 'playtime_forever': 164, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 164, 'last_played': 1444710938}
review:
It's hard to review hidden object games because I don't really believe anyone expects them to be "good" games.  This game is fine.  It has other puzzles besides hidden object, but none of them take any more brain power then hidden objects do.  Just color matching and what not.  Great game for kids I guess.  

The trailer for this game presents itself as something dark and dramatic, like you'd expect from other popular hidden object games, but really it isn't.  The game is meant to be campy and tongue-in-cheek.  All the jokes are pretty flat, but of course that fits the rest of the bill of a simple, casual, hidden object game.  I had a couple of glitches, but they went away with a simple reloading of the game, so I can't really complain about anything here.  Definitely worth the dollar if it's what you're into.

If you've played hidden object before, you know what your getting into.  Nothing is advancing the genre here.  If you haven't played hidden object before, if you're above the age of 14, you might want to start with a more interesting title.

author: {'steamid': '76561198101342452', 'num_games_owned': 246, 'num_reviews': 28, 'playtime_forever': 167, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 167, 'last_played': 1443984623}
review:
[b]Spielwertung:[/b] 3 / 10

Dieses Spiel bekommt von mir ein dickes und fettes Jein. Lachen oder weinen? Empfehlen oder Nichtempfehlen? Bug oder Feature? Man wei√ü es einfach nicht. 

[b]Spieldauer:[/b] 2 ‚Äì 3 Stunden

+ Errungenschaften sind THEORETISCH beim 1. durchspielen erreichbar (Bugs)
+ Sammelkarten
+ geringer Preis (besonders im Angebot)

+/- veraltete Grafik und (steife unfreiwillig komische) Animationen

- Bugs, Glitches und Bugs
- seltsame Hitboxen 
- wildes Klicken und noch mehr wildes Klicken (Fehlen der Hinweise auf ‚Äûinteressante‚Äú Stellen, sodass man in den Szenen und Wimmelbildspielen einfach alles anklicken muss, wenn man alles finden m√∂chte.)

[b]Story [Achtung enth√§lt kleinere Spoiler]:[/b]

Der Stiefvater in spe entf√ºhrt die Verlobte von unserem ‚Äûcharismatischen‚Äú Protagonisten (ich habe es irgendwie geschafft mir nicht mal seinen Namen merken zu k√∂nnen), weil dieser nicht gut genug f√ºr seine Tochter ist. Stattdessen soll diese zwangsverheiratet werden - mit einem Vampir seiner Wahl. Da der Protagonist John (ja, ich habe gerade nachgesehen) seine Verlobte dummerweise liebt, ist es nun an uns dies zu verhindern ‚Äì mit allen Mitteln. 

[b]Zusammenfassung/Kommentar:[/b]

Dieses Spiel ist nicht total schlecht. Ich habe wirklich lange √ºberlegt, ob ich das D√§umchen nach oben oder unten gebe. Letztendlich stand der g√ºnstige Preis, f√ºr den man nicht so viel erwarten kann, gegen die negativen Aspekte, die dann doch √ºberwiegen. 

Grunds√§tzlich finde ich den Preis f√ºr das Spiel mit 0,99 ‚Ç¨ in Ordnung, wenn da nicht die Bugs w√§ren und die Tatsache, dass das Spiel irgendwie lieblos und unfertig wirkt oder wie ein Scherz der Spieleentwickler. 

Die Grafik empfinde ich als okay - nat√ºrlich ist sie nicht das Gelbe vom Ei. Und einige Animationen wirken unfreiwillig komisch aber damit kann ich gut Leben. Vielleicht liegt das einfach daran, dass ich bei einem Hiddenobjectgame, besonders f√ºr diesen Preis, nicht soviel erwarte. (Daf√ºr hat man bei manchen Animationen ein bisschen was zum Schmunzeln. Ist doch auch etwas, oder?) 
Was bei mir jedoch den, bereits oben erw√§hnten, lieblosen und unfertigen Eindruck bewirkt hat, war der deutlich in der Luft stehende Charakter. Passiert in mindestens 2 Spielszenen und ist so deutlich, dass man es als Spieleentwickler eigentlich h√§tte sehen m√ºssen. Liegt vielleicht daran, dass ich den Gedanken habe, dass man sein Werk als Spieleentwickler noch mal auf Bugs & Glitches pr√ºft. Behindert nicht beim Spiel, wirkt aber nicht sehr professionell. 

In vielen Hiddenobjectgames gibt es einen Hinweis, wenn man √ºber eine ‚Äûinteressante‚Äú Stelle f√§hrt. Meistens ist das wohl die Ver√§nderung des Mauszeigers. Darauf wurde hier verzichtet oder es wurde vergessen. Die Folgen dessen sind absehbar: Man klickt ziemlich orientierungslos in den Szenen alles an, was verd√§chtig sein k√∂nnte. 
Und als w√§re das nicht genug wiederholt sich das Ganze in den Wimmelbildszenen. Es gibt in diesen Szenen sehr h√§ufig versteckte Gegenst√§nde, die man erst findet, wenn man einen anderen Gegenstand verschoben hat. Somit klickt man wieder alles an, was man finden kann, weil es ein potenzielles Versteck sein k√∂nnte. Mich pers√∂nlich hat dieses stupide geklicke sehr schnell erm√ºdet und genervt.

Die Wimmelbildszenen sind von den versteckten Gegenst√§nden mal abgesehen sehr einfach gehalten. Die meisten Sachen kann man sehr gut finden.

Die Hitboxen der Gegenst√§nde sind teilweise etwas gr√∂√üer. Dies hat bei mir dazu gef√ºhrt, dass ich manchmal Sachen gewertet bekam und eigentlich gar nicht wusste, was ich angeklickt haben soll. Das ist meist dann passiert, wenn die Gegenst√§nde sehr eng beieinander waren. 
Kleinere √úbersetzungsfehler haben sich ebenfalls eingeschlichen, h√§lt sich aber gut in Grenzen. Ein Beispiel w√§re: Palme = Handabdruck. 

Die eingebauten Minispiele empfand ich als sehr leicht, die meisten sollten daher kaum Probleme bereiten oder wirklich herausfordernd sein. 

Wer dennoch √ºber die Anschaffung dieses Spiels nachdenkt, sollte sich mental auf m√∂gliche Bugs vorbereiten. Ich hatte welche aber wenn ich mir die Reviews anschaue, muss das nicht immer zutreffen. Bei Interesse einfach mal Forum oder Reviews lesen dort stehen einige m√∂gliche Bugs. 

Das gr√∂√üte Problem aber was ich mit dem Spiel habe: Es geht nicht in den Kopf. Zumindest nicht die positiven Dinge. Es sticht nichts wirklich heraus an was man sp√§ter noch gerne zur√ºckdenken w√ºrde. Es bleiben keine Minispiele oder Wimmelbilder wirklich h√§ngen. Namen des Protagonisten und anderer Figuren? Bereits kurz nach dem durchspielen vergessen ...
 Was aber bei mir h√§ngen geblieben ist, sind die Bugs und die Szenen in den unser menschlicher Charakter scheinbar in der Szenerie zu schweben scheint. 

[b][i]Fazit:[/i][/b] 
Ich habe mir die Frage gestellt: W√ºrdest du dieses Spiel noch mal spielen wollen? Und die Antwort war: nein. Obwohl das Spiel nicht nur schlechte Seiten hat und mich auch mal herzhaft zum Lachen brachte, gibt es von mir leider keine Empfehlung ‚Äì egal wie g√ºnstig es sein mag. Wer das Abenteuer dennoch wagen m√∂chte, dem empfehle ich das Spiel im Angebot zu kaufen und dann Humor und ein paar Nerven mitzubringen.

author: {'steamid': '76561198091698112', 'num_games_owned': 161, 'num_reviews': 13, 'playtime_forever': 100, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 100, 'last_played': 1444380290}
review:
Bought this game for 9 cents on sale, using spare change from my steam wallet. This is a fantastic game for 9 cents. It's still a cute game for 99 cents. But, don't expect it to be some amazing, groundbreaking point-and-click puzzler or anything.

It's a dollar game, guys. You get what you pay for. Keep that in mind.

author: {'steamid': '76561197972281569', 'num_games_owned': 2950, 'num_reviews': 89, 'playtime_forever': 173, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 42, 'last_played': 1445554701}
review:
Sinister City is a hidden objects game where you are going to look for your girlfriend dissapered in a city ruled by vampires.

The different locations are drawn in 2D and characters are well modeled in 3D.

Music and enviroment sound are normal, all characters talk to you but their performance do not allow them to win an Oscar :)

There are different kind of puzzles, mini games and tasks to find many objects from a list in the screen. 
 
The game is in third person and you move your character around different places clicking on the screen. There are some glitches but they aren't a big problem.

There is a hint button in a corner to help you. Depending on the level of difficulty, it refills quickest and tells you which are your next step.

There is no map available.

You can choose the difficulty between: easy and difficult but there is no difficult instead. 

The game has achivements and trading cards and you could finishit  easily obtaning all of them.

I think, this is one of the first games of this developer, because Alchemy Mysteries is much better because they learnt from the mistakes of this game.

A game to play if you are bored at home and  don't want to think a lot.

PD: Thanks to Shade00

author: {'steamid': '76561198153024816', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 21, 'playtime_forever': 263, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 61, 'last_played': 1626905074}
review: The game itself isn't really that bad. The story and the graphics aren't perfect, but the game did entertain me most of the time. BUT it is also bugged as hell, so I can't recommend it. I had white boxes covering up the hidden object scenes, some of the objects seemed to be invisible and at some point I could't go to the next screen and had to restart the game. Right now I have to find an object but I'm unable to pick it up which means I can't proceed in the story. It's just really frustrating and takes away the fun.

review: I don't really know why people complain about this game. For what it is, the game is hillarious. The only thing I'd like is a cursor change or something when you're hovering over a clickable spot to save some spam-clicking. The hints recharge fast enough, none of the puzzles are overly difficult, and overall I enjoyed it. I mean, don't expect it to perform miracles, but it's a perfectly cromulent game.

author: {'steamid': '76561197999548234', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 12, 'playtime_forever': 184, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 184, 'last_played': 1444133157}
review:

-A intera√ß√£o dos Personagens 3d com o cen√°rio 2D n√£o √© boa, muitas vezes o personagem aparece voando no cen√°rio ou andando na parede. Al√©m da movimenta√ß√£o do personagem ser desnecess√°ria.

- Toda a tela √© clicavel, ent√£o para encontrar o local correto para iniciar o jogo do Hidden Object torna o jogo chato, acaba n√£o sendo um Click-to-Point  e sim um "clique como louco em toda tela at√© encontrar o que procura".

- Em 1hora de jogo ele "bugou" 2x onde... mesmo clicando no objeto correto, ou no local onde o se inicia o  Hidden Object nada acontece, quando isso ocorre tem se que voltar ao menu do jogo, clicar em continuar a√≠ o jogo "desbuga". Isso √© ruim demais! Pois quando aconteceu a primeira vez fiquei clicando em todo o cen√°rio e nada... recorri ao bot√£o de ajuda e este indicou um local o qual j√° havia clicado e continuei clicando. Fiquei com raiva e fui procurar informa√ß√µes na comunidade do jogo e descobri que quando isso ocorre, tem que sair do jogo e entrar novamente.

                                         -------------------------------------------------------

***  O √∫nico ponto positivo (ainda sim com ressalva) √© que o jogo √© legendado em PT-BR, Excelente que as Produtoras tenham essa preocupa√ß√£o em traduzir, por√©m se Voc√™ for jogar... Aten√ß√£o. Alguns objetos tem seu nome alterado. 
Exemplo: "Leque" foi traduzido como "ventilador de m√£o".

caso tenha interesse em comprar este jogo, pese os pr√≥s e contras... Se Voc√™ n√£o se importar com os Bugs ou simplismente aprender a ignorar; consegue-se jogar.

author: {'steamid': '76561198139030244', 'num_games_owned': 834, 'num_reviews': 3, 'playtime_forever': 162, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 162, 'last_played': 1443749627}
review:
This game was a bit disappointing.  It's an older style of graphics, which look rather weak in comparison to what people are used to these days, and the movements were clunky.  I also found that the game would bug randomly and not allow me to do the hidden object puzzles, so I would have to go out to the menu and begin the game agian to make it work.  This was frustrating, but it at least did not hinder my ability to finish the game.   Besides that, the game is short and not terribly well written plot-wise.

This being said, the mini-games were actually quite entertaining, I liked how the game map was used as opposed to being an add-on, and I liked that the locations were self-contained and you didn't have to run all over the map to find that little key or that random oil can which has no uses until almost the end.  I wouldn't recommend spending a lot of money on this game, but if you're getting it on a discount for under a dollar and you want something to blow an evening on, it isn't the worst game I've played in the genre before.

author: {'steamid': '76561198057330300', 'num_games_owned': 353, 'num_reviews': 50, 'playtime_forever': 379, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 117, 'last_played': 1457283968}
review:
Costa meno di un caff√® in Emilia Romagna, spesso addirittura in sconto anche nel bundle con Prague Legends. 

Per√≤ onestamente √® un porting da tablet fatto con i piedi.
Non √® stata neppure cambiata la didascalia "Tocca per continuare".
La traduzione in italiano dei sottotitoli √® fatta con un traduttore automatico e ci sono pure errori ortografici, per non dire di senso ("spring" tradotto "primavera" invece di "molla").
Molti oggetti si trovano cliccando semplicemente a caso. Ci sono di oggetti da spostare per trovarne altri, ma lo si capisce solo cliccando tutto il cliccabile a caso. I fondali rendono gli oggetti stessi un po' confusi.
Alcuni puzzle invece non sono niente male, e la storia - (volutamente??) assurda prende in giro i luoghi comuni delle avventure grafiche.

Per√≤ alla fine non √® realmente divertente, ed √® questo che conta in un gioco per quanto sia a buon mercato.

review: While the game itself as a hidden object game is not bad, it's the bugs and glitches that makes this game difficult to recommend.  The game is simple, the graphics are basic and the sound/voice acting are mediocre compared to others of the same genre that I've played.  I hit a couple graphical bugs where the screen had white boxes covering up part of the hidden object scene.  I also had a bug where after finding an object in the hidden object scene it kicked me out of the scene and back to the main game.  This made it very tedious and frustrating, when casual gaming should not bring up these types of situations and emotions.  The goal is save your girlfriend from a vampire in Sinister City.  The game would be easily recommended even with its below par graphics and sound if the bugs were fixed.  I played the game twice to get all achievements, and both times I experienced these bugs.

author: {'steamid': '76561198027424772', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 213, 'playtime_forever': 507, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 507, 'last_played': 1454473358}
review:
[b][u]Game Information[/u][/b]

"Sinister City" is a Hidden Object Puzzle Adventure game. The game was developed and published by JetDogs Studios.

[b][u]The Game Review[/u][/b]

Game Visuals

I want to mention that the visuals in the game are well done. The visuals can be adjusted in the game's option menu.

Game Audio

I want to mention that audio for the game is well done. Even though the audio is somewhat simplistic and repetitive. The audio can be adjusted in the game's option menu as well.

Gameplay

There are two different difficulty game modes to choose from: Easy and Advanced.

There is no padlock feature that is available to lock the inventory panel in place to make it stationary. The inventory panel automatically comes stationary.

The hidden object scenes consist of the following: Traditional word lists and Find 'x' amount. Some of these hidden object scenes may require little or no interactions. (Please be aware that in one of the hidden object scenes, there is a bug/glitch, it causes you to exit the scene every time; when you collect the item. Reinstalling the game would fix the problem.)

The puzzles are fairly easy to solve without having the need to skip any of them.

There are seventeen different achievements to unlock from playing the game. Each of these achievements does come with some requirements that need to be completed before they can be unlocked.

Miscellaneous

There are five different trading cards to collect. Only three of those trading cards are given out by the game. There are several ways to get the rest of the trading card: Purchased from Steam's Community Market; Trade with friends; Booster Packs and its' Booster Pack Creator.

Final thoughts: I have found the game enjoyable to a certain extent. Even though there was a glitch/bug in the game. The replay value for the game is low. I would not recommend this game.

author: {'steamid': '76561198026806776', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 302, 'playtime_forever': 773, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 105, 'last_played': 1444174682}
review:
If you're [b]serious[/b] about your hidden-object gaming... [i]why???[/i]  Seriously, this isn't chess!  But nonetheless, if for some reason you're  [b]serious[/b] about hidden object gaming, you'd do better to avoid Sinister City.  It doesn't take itself remotely seriously, and there are some serious weaknesses in the game design.

If you're just looking for some brief, cheap, casual fun, though, Sinister City can be just the quick, entertaining, romp you need.  The puzzles are few, the HO scenes pretty easy, so there's little to distract you from running through the goofy, parodic story that plays around with the classics of vampire film.  While there's nods to [i]Nosferatu[/i] and Lugosi's classic portrayal of Dracula, Sinister City clearly draws its influence from schlockier fare like [i]Plan 9 from Outer Space[/i] and the low-budget Hammer Horror films.  If not laugh-out-loud funny, the story is at least far more entertaining than a typical HOG plot.

Gameplay is the weakness here.  Your next action is frequently unintuitive; you often cannot pick up an item you'll obviously need until explicitly told to collect it.  At one point, an object's graphic failed to load, leaving me to collect a white rectangle.  At another time, the game glitched so that I could not progress -- exiting and reopening the game solved the problem, though.  Finally, Sinister City relies on a mechanism where objects that are not your current targets must be clicked to move them, to discover target objects behind them.  This means you must click pretty much everything, rather than just hunting targets.  What's more, an object that was immobile in a previous visit to an HO screen might spontaneously become movable at a later time, requiring you to click everything on every visit to a screen, in order to not miss a potentially hidden target object.

At the price, especially if on special, I can't not recommend this game.  Tolerate the gameplay; enjoy the story.

author: {'steamid': '76561198003693447', 'num_games_owned': 1616, 'num_reviews': 92, 'playtime_forever': 159, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 159, 'last_played': 1441419683}
review:
This game is the first game I played from Jetdogs Studios and the least polished, Not a bad game but their other two Frankenstein: Master of Death and Alchemy Mysteries: Prague Legends are much better than this, if you've already completed those first don't expect the same from this one. 

Pros:
- Very few objects repeated
- More objects to find in the puzzles than their other games
- Easy to follow story
- Steam Acheivments and Trading Cards
- Price
- Nice cutscenes
- Soundtrack Free as DLC (though I don't particularly rememeber the music for this game it's always nice when a game has a free soundtrack.)

Cons:
- Length, This game is easily completable in an hour and a half on advanced mode which means even longer of just leaving it open to idle while waiting for cards to drop if you want those.
- Whlle the voice acting was more varied in this than their other two games i didn't find it very enjoyable.
- No Replayability
- Bugs, This game isn't as polished, twice I encountered bugs where every time I clicked one of the objects in the puzzle it would back me out and I would have to go back into the puzzle. Only fixable by restarting the game.
- No fast travel, This shouldn't really be a complaint but when both of their other games have it and this one doesn't with even more back tracking it really needed it.
- Normal hints on the puzzle are fine but this game really doesn't tell you where you need to go most of the time where the other two did via their fast travel system.

Overall Score: 6/10 I was pretty harsh on this game, it was the first hidden object game I played by Jetdogs Studios and the least enjoyable. It's still a playable game and has a good amount of hidden object gameplay to it but it's just not quite the same quality as their other products. I would be giving it a 5 instead of a 6 due to the bug i encountered twice but I didn't see anyone else complaining about the same bug, Additionally the free soundtrack is a nice touch.

In the end if you need a hidden object game there are better to play and worse to play, If you enjoy games by Jetdogs by all means get this you can tell it's one of their games. But if you haven't played one by them play their other ones first, Save this one for later so you don't put yourself off of the experiances their games can provide.

author: {'steamid': '76561198072110088', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 125, 'playtime_forever': 156, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 156, 'last_played': 1443107914}
review:
Sinister City ist ein Wimmelbildspiel / Hidden Object Game indem wir unsere Verlobte aus den Klauen ihres vaters befreien m√ºssen. Denn dieser ist ein m√§chtiger Vampir und m√∂chte sie mit einem Filmstar verheiraten.
Das Spiel hat einen seltsamen Humor,  es gibt sich M√ºhe lustig zu sein. Ich f√ºr meinen Teil fand' das Outro / Extro / Videosequenz w√§hrend der Credits lustiger als das gesamte Spiel.
Es erwarten uns zahlreiche Minispiele und Wimmelbilder, viele Dialoge und eine eigenartige Story / Handlungsablauf.

Sinister City kann man ziemlich schnell (unter 2,5 Stunden) auf 100% Errungenschaftsrate bringen, f√ºr den Preis von 0,99Cent kann man nicht meckern, ich selbst bezahlte in einem Bundle nur 0,29Cent f√ºr 2 Spiele.
Eine Fortsetzung scheint ebenfalls zu kommen, bzw. sieht es w√§hrend der letzten Videosequenz stark danach aus.

author: {'steamid': '76561197985000150', 'num_games_owned': 578, 'num_reviews': 101, 'playtime_forever': 231, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 221, 'last_played': 1443200016}
review:
I can't be sure that the humour is either offbeat and clever or so wide of the mark that it's cringeworthy, a bit of both really. 
The story is insane and the voice-acting is terrible but these seem to be the norm for the more basic games of the genre. 

It's okay, but far from the first Hidden Object game you should try. I paid 15p for it in a sale and i'd be annoyed if i'd paid any more than that for what the game offers, especially as in total it offers around 4 hours gametime for 2 play-through's on both modes.
"Normal" mode though is a joke as if you just stop to look for 5 seconds then the screen lights-up telling you where everything is, it doesn't give you nearly enough time to search for yourself.

Objects to be moved bear no distinction to background objects. So often you will find you cannot see what you need on the screen and you have no way of knowing which objects can be pushed aside to reveal more.
The only way to get around this is to play it on "Normal" difficulty and have the game tell you where you're supposed to be going next then remember for the next time. I can't imagine playing "Advanced" mode without this knowledge; it would be uber-frustrating. 

The game is locked to a 4:3 image stretched to widescreen: there is no option to reset the ratio. This is the first and only game that has ever done this to me so i just ignored it and played regardless; not going to upset my gfx settings for 1 game.

Overall it's a thumbs-down from me, there are much better HOG's out there and you only really need play this one if you've literally exhausted the other offerings out there.

Die Story sollte wahrscheinlich lustig r√ºberkommen, ist aber absolut l√§cherlich und... einfach nur schlecht.
Das einzig gute an dem Spiel sind die Achievements und ein paar seltene, lustige Stellen (und Sammelkarten, wenn man denn das Spiel offen halten m√∂chte, um diese zu bekommen, denn 2h reichen, um Sinister City durchzuspielen).

author: {'steamid': '76561198117382911', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 6, 'playtime_forever': 312, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 312, 'last_played': 1442960597}
review: Es un juego con muchos bugs, malos gr√°ficos, una historia un tanto rara y cutre, pero si quieres reirte por como est√° montado el juego y su historia, es ideal, te partiras de risa con su historia. Adem√°s, tiene rompecabezas complicados porque a veces no se ve lo que est√°s buscando debido a los malos gr√°ficos, de hecho, por ejemplo, en uno de ellos lo que parece ser un guisante en realidad es una abeja. Bueno aun as√≠, le doy el visto bueno porque es entretenido a pesar de todos los defectos que tenga.

author: {'steamid': '76561198082882640', 'num_games_owned': 420, 'num_reviews': 21, 'playtime_forever': 120, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 120, 'last_played': 1443029935}
review:
Im Angebot f√ºr paar Cent. OK. F√ºr zwischendurch. OK. Ab und zu mal lachen. OK! 
Ja kann man sich geben sollte, aber echt nicht zu teuer sein. 0,99 ‚Ç¨ w√§hren zu teuer. 
Aber als Angebot oder in einem Bundle. OK! 
Da es bei mir so war gebe ich eine Kaufempfehlung. 
Leichte Kost ist es allemale, danach suche ich ja aber auch. xD 

Ein muss ich aber sagen, ich glaube ich bin nicht so ganz der Wimmelbild-Typ schnell fange ich an nur noch Wild durchs Bild zu klicken um alles zusammen zu haben. Man sollte in solchen Spielen, einen Spieler auf jedenfall bestrafen wenn er das tut. Sonst wird so ein Spiel recht schnell langweilig und sich selbst zur√ºckhalten ist ja immer so eine sache ne ;)

author: {'steamid': '76561198007688772', 'num_games_owned': 1263, 'num_reviews': 649, 'playtime_forever': 166, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 166, 'last_played': 1442663001}
review:
It's not that bad.
Yes, the story is silly but on the other hand it's original, charming and I appreciate they tried to do something different. I even had some good laughs. Hidden object scenes also use original approach, combining words with graphical clues and spreading the objects across multiple scenes.
There are some bugs but the game is playable. The only serious problem was that after certain action I was unable to do anything else; thankfully restarting the game helped.
For such a small price I can easily recommend this game.

author: {'steamid': '76561198017967750', 'num_games_owned': 1537, 'num_reviews': 1327, 'playtime_forever': 156, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 156, 'last_played': 1441893592}
review:
Although I liked the game - 3 hours of 'challenge' for only 0,09 eurocents - I don't recommend it to anyone demanding.
The game has not awesome graphics. The plot is barely funny or interesting, but game had some funny moments. It's more simplistic than any other HOG [hidden object game] and it takes very short time to beat it.

It's awfully funny.

I don't know what to say - the trailer basically shows everything in this game.
So yeah, if you like simple and ridiculous games, buy it.
If you like hidden object games - buy it.

review: Hvis du er til hardcore HOGs s√• er det her ikke for dig, hvis du derimod godt kan lide et billigt grin p√• bekostning af et par wannabe vampyrer og hele den genre, s√• er det her noget for dig.

author: {'steamid': '76561198069436762', 'num_games_owned': 460, 'num_reviews': 27, 'playtime_forever': 292, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 292, 'last_played': 1442368318}
review:
Sinister City is a small hidden-object point-and-click adventure game about vampires.

Let me get the first thing out of the way; the graphics are terrible, the voice acting doesn't match the movements of the characters. I often found the main character standing in places that made no sence (Ie, outside of the hotel, floating in the middle of the door, or standing on top of the garbage can) That is the only bad things I am saying about Sinister City in this review - so if you can't over look those, you can move along now.

Now to the good points: It's very, very original. I love the storyline, I adore the characters, and despite not lining up correctly, I love the voice acters. You do enough moving around the game that it doesn't get boring easily, although at the same time I would love if it had some more variety to it - although that's not a big issue. It can be slightly hard to find your main objective objects in scenes if you're not sure what you're doing, so I reccomend playing on beginner's mode first.

Now the main conclusion... Even if you can't or don't want to get through this full game on your own, I promise it is worth it. It is a fairly short game (Maybe about 2 hours for me to complete), but the ending scenes are so funny, and really make a nice tie-in for the end of the game. Over all, I reccomend this game - more so to those who have good patience- and am definately going to play it again. A wonderful deal for $1.09 (Or .99 like I got it) or whatever else the price may be for you. Buy this game. You won't be disapointed for long

author: {'steamid': '76561198009479699', 'num_games_owned': 4296, 'num_reviews': 30, 'playtime_forever': 33, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 33, 'last_played': 1442216375}
review: I love HIdden object games so it may make my views a little bias.  If you have not played HOG games before I would suggest you look else where, because this game might make you hate them before you have given the genre a chance.  I have played a little so far and probably plan on finishing it eventually.  This game is filler at best and not in a good way.  There are very poor tutorials and the graphics feel a little dated, then again this could be just a re-port of an older title.  When compared to other HOG games I have played this game does not seem very polished.  The voice acting is hokey,  Im not sure if it is intentional or not but it is not very good. The graphic are okay I guess but the lips of the characters don't appear to syc up with the speech.  The game comes off like a very jerky hybrid of a point and click adventure game that is trying to be an HOG game, and the soundtrack doesn't fit with the game in my opinion.  Im not sure but I don't think the way the game mechanics are very well explained and leaves you hunting around.  Honestly can I reccomend it?  Barely.  The price is not so high that you are really going to regret it (At the time it was $1.09).  If you can get it cheaper by all means do it.  But yeah if you are looking to start playing HOG games this is not for you.  As an HOG fan, sure I can reccomend IF you have tried the best why not try the rest.

author: {'steamid': '76561198129680513', 'num_games_owned': 802, 'num_reviews': 107, 'playtime_forever': 427, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 427, 'last_played': 1441729857}
review:
I left the game occasionally, and I played it three times to get all the achievements.
There is an achievement to play without skip any dialogue, and I accidentally skipped it on second attempt.
That's why my play time is more than 7 hours.
It shouldn't need more than 2 hours to finish this game.

The story is about John finding his girlfriend Nina, who is gone missing.
It is then revealed that she has been held captive by Count Dracula Orlok.
You play as John, find a way to rescue Nina.

Sound interesting right? But the plot twist makes it rather awkward.

[h1]Pros :[/h1]
[list]
[*]This game do hidden object thing well, the objects are blend well with the background. 7/10
[*]There are many mini games and puzzles. It's not too hard and not too easy either, even a kid can play this game. 9/10
[*]Full voice over, though the actor is not experienced enough with voice tone. I give more scores to a game with full voice over than ordinary games. Voice actors are not cheap. 7/10
[*]Achievements are few and easy to get. I don't like games with plenty of hard and troublesome achievements. 9/10
[/list]

[h1]Cons :[/h1]
[list]
[*]Plain story. Really... The ending is awkward
[*]I see an object with just a blank white box. It seems that the texture is missing.
[*]In some screen, the background and the npc is not matched. See my screenshot. John looked like he's floating. He should had appear lower.
[*]The dialog between John and NPC is kind of weird.
[/list]

Overall I give 7/10 for a dollar game.

author: {'steamid': '76561198024972696', 'num_games_owned': 319, 'num_reviews': 262, 'playtime_forever': 278, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 278, 'last_played': 1441507058}
review:
It's a shame that "Sinister City" is marred by technical issues.  It's a tongue-in-cheek vampire Hidden Object Game (HOG) that's got good graphics, nice puzzles and mini-games, and darn good voice acting (far better than the norm for the HOG genre).  The story is simple but interesting and the poking of fun at normal HOGs is really well done.  But, the game does suffer from bugs and some irritating design decision.

The poor design decisions are firstly that if you're playing the game in either Easy or Advanced mode, the cursor does not change to indicate hot, live, or actionable areas.  That means that as you search the scene, you have no idea if you can pick something up, use something, open a HOG or mini-game, talk to someone, or even just leave the scene.  Easy mode puts a sparkle on the screen after a few seconds for the next thing you should be doing.  But, you end up watching for that and blindly following it instead of thinking about what's showing.  In Advanced mode, there's no sparkle.  So, you're essentially reduced to just clicking on everything possible in the hopes that something will happen.  Secondly, the mini-games have no instructions at all.  It's not just that there's nothing telling you how you need to manipulate things.  It's also that there's no explanation of what the win-state (i.e., what you're supposed to do) is.  And finally, In the HOGs, the items you're searching for can be so small as to be indistinguishable.  Similarly, the HOG scenes usually have in-focus/out-of-focus, lighted/non-lighted areas implying where you're supposed to be looking for things.  Nope.  The items can be anywhere at all (the out of focus ones were a real treat).

As for bugs, I first tried playing the game in Advanced mode.  I quickly got to a point where nothing I clicked on would activate anything.  I could do no HOGs nor leave the scene.  I had to start a new game in Easy mode to play.  There are also several places where the character floats over the pavement.  In one such scene, there IS no pavement.  The characters are both floating in air.

It's a shame that those issues are spoiling an otherwise very good game.  But, at the current list price of $0.99, I can live with it (it took me 2.4 hours for my playthrough on Easy -- but I still have to go through on Advanced to get 100% Achievements).  So, I'm recommending the game.

EDIT:  I've confirmed the bug I ran into earlier.  In Advanced mode, once you're given the task to collect the magic keys to unlock the mirror, none of the active points will activate.  IOW, you can't enter the two HOGs in the area to get what you need and you can't leave the area to get some other items and unlock the mirror.  I worked around this by exiting the game, re-entering it, and selecting Continue.  When the game loaded up the scene where I was, I could finish the scene (and game) without further problems.

author: {'steamid': '76561198046807512', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 161, 'playtime_forever': 915, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 915, 'last_played': 1441465610}
review:
Criticare questo gioco mi sembra un p√≤ come sparare sulla croce rossa.

Abbiamo un buon potenziale da avventura punta e clicca azzoppato da una scrittura e da uno spirito del tutto fuori luogo. Forse sono io a non averlo preso per il verso giusto, ma il modo in cui √® narrato fa piangere il cuore ad ogni appassionato di vampiri, sembra una manifestazione di "american idiots" in salsa Dracula.

Il gameplay √® basico, si pu√≤ muovere il personaggio per la stanza (a volte per qualche bug non si pu√≤), per osservare questa o quella zona di interesse, e l√¨ bisogna cliccare su tutta una serie di oggetti da collezionare. Alla lunga √® sempre la stessa minesta e ci si annoia, per√≤ la qualit√† di certi disegni lo rende gradevole. 

La traduzione italiana √® volenterosa ma sballata e risulta del tutto fuorviante quando si vuole collezionare un oggetto che non corrisponde minimamente al nome indicato. Un p√≤ a casaccio un p√≤ per intuizione ci si arriva.

Paradossalmente, se avesse avuto meno pretese, sarebbe stato un gioco molto pi√π interessante. Non c'era bisogno di animazioni 3D e di legnose animazioni, cos√¨ come la scrittura di quei dialoghi e il loro doppiaggio fanno venir voglia di suicidarsi.

Ecco, avete presente i b-movie? Questo √® un b-game, totalmente privo di atmosfera, con un finto umorismo fuori luogo.
Lo stile da punta e clicca funziona solo in parte, e troppa ripetitivit√†.

Preso in saldo per le carte, non ha molto da offrire...

Voto 5/10

author: {'steamid': '76561198047893285', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 8, 'playtime_forever': 250, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 175, 'last_played': 1678422577}
review:
I don't know what people are smoking when they give this game a bad review. When you buy a 9 cent game, you are most likely going to get a 9 cent game. And for 9 cents, you are getting a lot.

 I was pleseantly surprised at the amount of enjoyment I got out of this game.  It's a point and click adventure with some puzzles mixed in their of varying difficulty. The story is a lot of fun and the achievements aren't too hard to get. I got all but 3 of the achievements on my first playthrough. I will probably get the rest on my second playthrough around halloween! :) The only downside of the game is that it is a littly buggy but nothing too extreme. I had to restart once or twice.

I would definently recommend purchasing this game on sale.
