author: {'steamid': '76561198141404871', 'num_games_owned': 910, 'num_reviews': 149, 'playtime_forever': 571, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 571, 'last_played': 1443347206}
review:
Vampy and campy, twitchy and glitchy, and if this game was a movie it would be shown during the late night double feature creature picture shows where all good "bad" B-rated flicks were shown.

Spoof parody of vampires and B-rated flicks in Hollywood, complete with an otaku vampire fan boy of Bela Lugosi and Nosferatu who wants to become an actor and play Count Dracula in his own film.  Since the otaku fan boy is having a mid-life crisis (at 500 years old), he is causing grief for his daughter and her fiance, who has come to find her.

For the amusement value alone this game is worth the playthrough (and the price of 99 cents).  How serious can the storyline (or the characters, for that matter) really be when the News Station is called "Plan 9"? 

Trivia 1: Plan 9 from Outer Space (1959) starring Bela Lugosi directed by Ed Wood is considered to be the worst creature feature ever made. 
Trivia 2:  Bela Lugosi's protrayal of Dracula (1931) in some circles is still considered one of the best. 
Trivia 3: The 1922 black and white German silent film 'Nosferatu: A Symphony of Horror' is considered to be a cinematic influential masterpiece, and even by today's standards is still considered to be one of the best Dracula movies ever made.  (Dracula's name in the film was changed to Count Orlock.) 
Trivia 4: Jonathan Harker and "Mina" Murray were the bethrothed and eventually married "lovers" in Bram Stroker's 'Dracula'.

Gameplay is twitchy and glitchy (if stuck just exit the game then hit continue when coming back).  There are no  instructions for any puzzles, so previous puzzle experience and a bit of intuition is needed.  (I got stuck once and had to look up the solution, which is randomized I discovered on a different playthrough.)  Plenty of HO scenes to do, and not the usual type of getting an object at the end.  I sorta wondered the entire time why the HOs scenes were even there but they do serve a purpose.  In some ways this game feels like an experiment in third person play by Jet Dogs Studios and reminscent of how Syberia and Niburu plays, without defined instructions on what to do or where to look.     

Worth a look and at least one playthrough just for the campy cheesiness of it.  (This would be perfect fodder for MSTies  (Mystery Science Theatre 3000)).

author: {'steamid': '76561198113018027', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 17, 'playtime_forever': 211, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 211, 'last_played': 1441278094}
review:
This is a very nice hidden object game. I'm surprised of the negative reviews!!

It is funny and has surprisingly a very good voice acting! The characters and dialogs are really done very well! It has memorable characters although the story is very short but in my opinion it is much better story than most hidden object games.

If you want a cliche hidden objects game with puzzles, then this is not the one to recommend, but if you want a very nice short story and funny, then this is one of the best games really. 

The price is so low, that made me doubt its quality, but I'm glad I did. It surprised me with how funny it is. 

The only negative thing is the story should be longer, but in the end I recommended it and give it 9/10 if you want to spend your time with funny story  :)

author: {'steamid': '76561198179292281', 'num_games_owned': 251, 'num_reviews': 50, 'playtime_forever': 273, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 129, 'last_played': 1441208427}
review:
It was the first hidden object game I ever played (as far as I remember), so I'm not a real fan of this sort of games and have no experience playing them. In this case, the Sinister City was really entertaining game to me. Honestly, for the money asked for this title, you could get many worse Steam games, so nothing to complain about. 
It took me 1,5h to finish the game, and I did it in one go. Why? Because it was funny, hilarious, and had some riddles to be solved. In terms of graphics, this production is not a top-notch title, but it's good enough. So, if you have an extra 1,5h of your time, buy this game, enjoy its light story and relaxing gameplay, and wander around the Sinister City.

author: {'steamid': '76561198090472752', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 7, 'playtime_forever': 121, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 121, 'last_played': 1441129122}
review:

review: Item find games are the ---hole of gaming. It kept me busy for twenty minutes while waiting on the new Mad Max game to download. But ultimately I quit and I am going to spend the rest of my time waiting for Mad Max to install by bending my head all the way backwards and slamming it up my own a--. That way I won't be tortured into sleep-submission like I was while playing this fucking game. Although put together well, it would be a cold day in hell before I recommend a game from the farthest, most hellish depths of gaming: point and click item find games. I actually found a game now where I can without pause say that I would truly rather be playing Warehouse and Logistics Simulator.

author: {'steamid': '76561198142934082', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 49, 'playtime_forever': 199, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 199, 'last_played': 1441074300}
review:
Endearingly awful...  :)

Cheesy B-movie acting, a plot that doesn't even pretend to take itself seriously, and some amusing jokes - for a mere $0.10 on sale I really can't complain too much!  It was a little dull at times, and the excuses for making you go find stuff were lame, but it was a couple of hours of mild entertainment for almost nothing.

The characters who inhabit Hidden Object Games are some of the messiest people I've ever seen - I'm no longer surprised by the piles of junk they seem to have in all their cupboards and corners and desks.  Unfortunately in this game, some of the objects you were asked to find were barely visible behind other objects (just a tiny piece poking out), were hard to see clearly, were named oddly, or were completely hidden behind other objects that you probably wouldn't know you could move unless the hint sparkles told you so...  

Speaking of which, the 'easy' mode was far too easy.  Pause in your random clicking for mere seconds and the game would show you what you needed to find, without you asking it for help.  That said, though, some tasks or locations seemed so obscure that I'm not sure I would have known I could look closer at a particular spot in the room if it hadn't shown me.

I did encounter one bug, where the game refused to respond to my clicking and I thought I'd have to restart, but it was fixed by going to the main menu and then continuing the game.  Other than that, the only issues I encountered were with the clicks picking up objects I wasn't actually clicking on in some cases, which may have something to do with it apparently being a mobile port (I presume, what with it telling you to 'tap here' or to swipe the screen in order to complete a mini game).

I had a few laughs while playing, and especially at the end credits - I'm not sure I would have been happy to pay full price even though it IS cheap, but on sale it's worth a play through.  Just don't expect anything serious and you'll be okay!  :)

author: {'steamid': '76561198188927953', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 54, 'playtime_forever': 147, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 142, 'last_played': 1467451577}
review:
I just finished this game a few minutes ago and was worth the $0.11 and was a good b grade Stephen King horror like game and you are trying to save the girl you love from her father and had a interesting story. When doing the hint button it can be spooky as a it sounds like that and also I have seen the negative views and some people did experience bugs, but I never did and was able to play the game till the end. If not using the hint system to solve puzzles then it can take longer as you are doing them on your own. 

Sometimes some objects can be tricky  but still enjoyable and also worth the price as the game is well made and more character development could of been added in and maybe more vampires trying to stop you form reaching your goal. This is worth the money and time as it is only a few hours, and have noticed that when collecting objects more get thrown in and you spend more time finding objects since the story is not that strong and still good to pass the time.

author: {'steamid': '76561197978705200', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 250, 'playtime_forever': 352, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 352, 'last_played': 1440952935}
review:
Sinister City is a ghoulish adventure that will frighten you to the bone, seize your soul, and cause your blood to run cold. You will spend the entire hour or so of this game in constant fear and...Whoops!

Got my intros mixed up.

Your fiance has been kidnapped by a vampire! Are you a bad enough dud to rescue your fiance?! Action and adventure await in Sinister City!

Hmm..Nope...That one kinda sucks too.

Truth is, there's not much to discuss when it comes to Sinister City. Not too long ago, this game was on sale for around 10 cents. On top of that, it has cards, so you're all but guaranteed to profit off of the purchase. Therefore, I'm going to assume that you already own this game, and are just reading this review because you assume there will be some funny jokes.


You know what they say about assumptions right?

In the interest of being "helpful" I'll talk about the actual game. Sinister City is a hidden-object puzzler. Look for the object, find the object, click on the object, become a winner. I must warn you though, the objects tend to be hidden. Occasionally there are puzzles to break up the monotony, but nothing too strenuous. For those exceedingly rare situations that you're actually stuck, a handy "HELP!" button is always nearby.

Not all hidden-object games are equal, and Sinister City is IMO an example of a mediocre one. The images are of a lower resolution, which makes objects muddy and difficult to spot. Yeah I know, it sounds ironic when you think about it, but bear with me on this. Another unfortunate technical issue is the prevalence of bugs. These can range from disappearing images to the game no longer properly responding to your inputs. Thankfully, these are usually cleared up by quitting to the main menu. The game saves automatically and constantly, so all you have to fear is those wacky vampires, not the possibility of losing progress.

The following couple paragraphs include SPOILERS!


----SPOILERS----

This next aspect is not so much a complaint about Sinister City, but about adventure games in general. All too often they rely on this logic that is baffling to normal human behavior. At one point in this game you have to find some books so that somebody will talk to you. There is an abandoned bookstand nearby, but the protagonist doesn't want to steal the books. In order to pay for these $20 books, he finds 75 cents in loose change scattered on the ground. If that made too much sense, consider that the protagonist steals a key from the bookstore to open a mailbox. 

Sinister City's attempts at humor are also...pretty laughable. Early on the protagonist acquires some vampire hunting equipment. He's getting geared up to kill a vampire, but then some guy points out that not everything is as it seems. The protagonist takes a closer look at a stake he picked up, and he finds the words "MADE IN CHINA" engraved on it. The "Made in China" gag is as old as time, but it doesn't work when written on a stake. A stake is a piece of wood sharpened to a point. It's possible that the Chinese stake is actually made of soft rubber, but wouldn't the protag notice that? Here's a thought: Crosses are also commonly used to fight vampires. So how about having the Cross say "MADE IN CHINA". Eh? Eh? Okay whatever. The point is this, when you're trying to make a gag out of something that's almost impossible to screw up, it doesn't really work. Yes, I have a nasty habit of nitpicking. What can I say? I love talking about mistakes. 

----END OF SPOILERS! YOU CAN BREATHE EASY NOW.----


Even with its faults, Sinister City is still an enjoyable romp. It doesn't take itself seriously at all, the voice-acting is amazing, and the game ends before you get tired of it. I'm not usually one to recommend bad games - even the ones that are "purposefully" bad - simply because they take too long to complete. This game delivers on hidden objects and puzzles, which is always nice to have when you're not in the mood for more Counterstrike or DOTA2 or Sakura Angels. It's nothing difficult, but at least it'll give you something to do if you have an hour or so to burn.

author: {'steamid': '76561198162351264', 'num_games_owned': 1232, 'num_reviews': 92, 'playtime_forever': 18, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 18, 'last_played': 1440514784}
review:
[h1]Why So Stingy?[/h1]
The majority of people complain that this game isn't worth the money, but come on, this game is 9 CENTS on sale and you can get the money back by selling the steam trading cards from this game. This game has some funny laughs and really questionable puzzles to solve, like the one at the start when the hotel owner makes you find his hotel room keys, when they were directly behind him all along. If you are up for a challenging game to complete and your brain to comprehend then this is the game for you.

author: {'steamid': '76561198078815095', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 127, 'playtime_forever': 162, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 162, 'last_played': 1440904757}
review:
Despite my dislike of hidden object games, I have to recommend this.

The absurd and silly story kept me interested. The voice acting was decent and mindless clicking could find most of the objects. It used all the standard tricks of hiding objects behind scenery as well as having moving scenery. 

The game also had various puzzles. If you didn't mind waiting, you could skip them, but they were fairly straight forward. I found them fairly enjoyable.

The game took under two hours and was well worth the 9 cents I paid.

author: {'steamid': '76561197965322630', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 160, 'playtime_forever': 176, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 176, 'last_played': 1440838605}
review:
"Teletubbies - Vampire Edition"

First thing is that I got this on 90% off so I can't complain due to it's nearly a free game for me.

Good:
- Puzzle works, few of them is fun
- Some non sense jokes deliver fun moment
- Have 3D model and Voiceacting for such budget title
- Hint system quickly recharges

Bad:
- Ridiculous Story
- Fictional characters talking non sense
- Bugs happen sometimes cause white screens or no response for any interactive object, although can be fixed by go back Main Menu and Continue again
- Pathetic voice acting
- Blurry hidden objects mixed with background. Some objects is covered too mcuh by obstacle and cannot be recognised at all
- Some objects are quite different from its description
- 3D model movement is dumb
- Very Challenging to tolerate its story and voiceacting through 2 hours

3/10, considering its trading cards and soundtrack surplus your account, I adjust it to 4.5/10 barely pass.

author: {'steamid': '76561198018726653', 'num_games_owned': 714, 'num_reviews': 7, 'playtime_forever': 160, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 160, 'last_played': 1440847348}
review:
Despite Hidden Objects being a genre I am not exactly a fan of, this cheesy example made it pretty enjyoable, if you are not good at the style, there are a few beginner friendly helps to get through the gameplay in favor of the story.

sadly in the PC version the instructions still say "tap here" or "tap anywhere", aside from that, and some low quality artwork for environments here and there, this game was surprisingly funny, and cheap to boot (bought it highly! discounted, i.e the trading cards were worth more than I paid for it).

author: {'steamid': '76561198174840903', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 19, 'playtime_forever': 102, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 102, 'last_played': 1440773066}
review:
There are a few very funny bugs in this game. While playing I sometimes had to return to the title screen, because there where some bad textures and it was impossible to find some objects. After returning to the game screen that was fixed. 
The puzzles are very very easy, I don't think that anybody needs help with this kiddy puzzles. The hidden objects are usually easy to find. So that game is not really about puzzles and hidden objects. This game is about all the trashy story and funny dialogues in it. The story is real trash and so stupid, that it makes a lot of fun to play. I am glad, that this game tooks me just 1,5h. It was 1,5 hours of fun and before the whole stuff was getting me bored, there was the final scene. 
1,5h of funny trash, funny bugs and a story so stupid that the developers must have been on a bunch of good drugs. And all that stuff for 0,09 ‚Ç¨. Thanks a lot.

author: {'steamid': '76561197985975371', 'num_games_owned': 2194, 'num_reviews': 38, 'playtime_forever': 141, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 141, 'last_played': 1440797608}
review:
I'd buy this for a dollar, or actually a euro... or actually I just paid around 0,09‚Ç¨ for this since it was on -90% discount. You get what you pay for I guess. I recommend this since I was happy with my purchase, see the pros and cons though to see what exactly you're getting with the buck this game costs. Some of the things listed are strong matters of taste.

The review

This game is an extremely short and extremely easy hidden-object puzzle game. It's very silly and the whole plot is just finding your girlfriend, freeing her and [spoilers]kickstarting her vampire father's film career[/spoilers]. Voice acting is bad and the texts don't match the lines, but due to overall campy feel of the game I really didn't mind.

Gameplay consists of you mostly clicking a person / object and seeing what he / it wants / needs, finding the items from nearby and then usually solving a puzzle of sorts. Some of these necessary items are often hidden behind some other items that are involved in a hidden object game, totalling to about 11-16 items (5 at a time), the last of which usually has the final items you are looking for hidden behind them. It's really simple and usually you can just get through most of it by randomly clicking the obvious items in the scene. If you want all of the achievements though, check the items required and then click through 5 of them (the hidden objects, not the quest items) in 10 seconds to get the achievement, that's basically the only one needing bit more effort.

The puzzles are the most interesting part in this game (beside just seeing the silly plot and clunky conversations go by). Unfortunately there were like 2 or 3 puzzles requiring actual thought while the others were passable by randomly doing stuff or just matching things together. There's not much explanation to them, but they're so simple a child will understand their point, you really don't need the included hint system. (also there's an achievement if you don't!)

- Funnily, you can actually tell the main character to walk somewhere in the scene, but it really has no function as clicking on hotspots trigger them immediately. 

That's about it. Game really doesn't span far. I played it 100% through on hardest difficulty in ~2h. More lucky person can probably do it in less time. Well, here's the pros and cons.

Pros:
+ Cheap (like really, got it for 9 cents)
+ Campy (got a few chuckles from some events, couple unexpectedly silly ones too)
+ Money's worth of entertainment and ultra-light brain exercise
+ Achievement icons look pretty cool
+/- Easy even on hardest difficulty

Cons:
- Some bugs (backgrounds messed up or characters floating in the backgrounds, also one time (in the psychic dimension) game didn't let me click any hotspots, closed and restarted the game and it worked again though)
- Typos
- Lame story (and there's barely any of it)
- Harder puzzles can be calculated with a single quaternary digit
- Finger got tired from all the basically useless random clicking
+/- Bad acting
+/- Easy even on hardest difficulty

Score 6 / 10

author: {'steamid': '76561198026051943', 'num_games_owned': 899, 'num_reviews': 25, 'playtime_forever': 229, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 229, 'last_played': 1440828169}
review:
Get it while it's cheap!  2 hours of game play to finish the story (minus 1 achievment), but it was something my kids enjoyed watching and helping me play.  A little more than just your basic hidden object game. I did enjoy it :)
2 Play throughs for 100% Achievement..  at 0.09c to buy the game (on special), the cards gets you your money back (and more), locations of items don't change, so second play though is simple.
If you have kids, definatly get the game, a nice little puzzle for them, but for adults, it runs its course quickly.

author: {'steamid': '76561198065347866', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 3, 'playtime_forever': 154, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 59, 'last_played': 1442854707}
review:
Das Spiel ist so Banane, dass es wieder gut ist. Insgesamt hat es einen hohen Trashcharakter und ist so kittschig, dass man als Liebhaber des Genres mit einer Investition von 0,99 Cents nichts falsch machen kann. Ich verstehe das Spiel als eine Parodie auf bisher erschienene Games des Horrorgenres. Irgendwie erinnert mich das Spiel an den Ed Wood Film: Plan B From Outer Space, welcher aber an Trashwert kaum zu toppen ist. Fans von trashigen Games kommen hier voll auf ihre Kosten. 

Grafik: OK - also so lala...rifari

Story: voll daneben, aber trashig ohne Ende XD

R√§tsel: sind 'nen Witz, also keine h√∂here Herausforderung f√ºr den Geist, sprich; Anspruch = 0,00001/10.000

Wimmelbilder: Manchmal ist der Kontrast unscharf, aber dank der Hint-Hilfe null Problemo

Ich geb dem Spiel auf der Richterskala f√ºr seri√∂se Spiele 2,5/10 Punkten und auf der Richterskala f√ºr Trashgames 7/10 Punkte.

review: It was a very basic, fetch quest filled hidden object game, but it holds your attention and is just absurd enough in it's story telling to be enjoyable. It also helps in can be completed in about 2 hours, so it doesn't overstay it's welcome. For a dollar (or the 10 cents I payed for it) I think you get what you pay for; a mildly enjoyable diversion for a few hours that won't particularly stay with you, but will keep you busy and entertained for it's duration if you are a fan of the genre.

review:
Das Spiel hat eine schlechte Grafik,die selbst f√ºr Wimmelbildspiele  grottig ist. Die Story macht keinen Sinn und hat ein haufen Logik l√ºcken, aber die Mischung aus beiden l√§sst es irgendwie lustig erscheinen. Wenn einen noch nicht die genialen Kerzen ausblas Animationen vom Anfang des Spiels vom Stuhl gehauen haben (vor Lachen)! Dann die R√§tsel,denn einige R√§tsel sind sogar gut w√§hrend andere R√§tsel und Wimmelbilder wie sinnlose Besch√§ftigungstherapie wirken. Das einzigste was dieses Spiel in dieser Form rechtfertigt ist der Preis denn f√ºr den Preis von einem Euro kann man es sich vieleicht mal geben,aber f√ºr den Sale Preis von 9 cent solltet ihr euch das Spiel unbedingt kaufen.Ihr kriegt ja das Geld f√ºr die Karten wieder , falls es euch nicht gef√§llt.Viele haben von Bugs und Absturz des Spiels in ihren Reviews erz√§hlt bei mir ist nichts der Gleichen passiert, bis auf eine zu gro√üe Hintergrundtextur und ein Gegenstand der f√ºr ein paar Sekunden keine Textur hatte, ist mir wirklich nichts Wiederfahren.

author: {'steamid': '76561198028390742', 'num_games_owned': 501, 'num_reviews': 15, 'playtime_forever': 426, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 282, 'last_played': 1441097487}
review: I originally bought this game just because it was only selling for $.09 and I wanted to use the exp to level up my steam profile..... but after starting to play it, I quickly found that this really is a fun nostalgic game, and I'd recommend it to anyone who was a fan of the old point and click adventure puzzle games, specially those who want a spooky themed parody twist.... this game just has a cfertain charm to it that makes you want to keep playing.... honestly, the game just makes me smile whenever I start to play it.

author: {'steamid': '76561198070053122', 'num_games_owned': 437, 'num_reviews': 65, 'playtime_forever': 13, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 13, 'last_played': 1440642709}
review:
This game is really a hit or miss. It really depends on who you are. Personally, I can't find interest in this game. It's VERY slow and dull in my opinion and the only real game aspect (that I've encountered thus far) was fetch quests- fetch quests that lead to more fetch quests. And more fetch quests. And more fetch quests. [b]And more fetch qu-[/b] 

[b]You get my point.[/b]

This game is a point-and-click game. Except, it's like one of those games from the old Windows 95 days. The "scene" is just a poorly made background that was quickly thrown together, the only 3D-ish models are the important characters (even the models are poorly programmed), and the diologue is bland as raisins. Now, when I say point-and-click, this will be NOTHING like The Walking Dead (trust me, being a VERY HUGE FAN of TWD, this is NOWHERE near comparable to the games) and like I said, rather it's more of an old point-and-click adventure game.

This game will appeal to you if you-
1. Love old classic games.
2. Love old classic point-and-click adventure games.
3. Don't mind incredi-bad voice acting.
4. Love dull love stories. Because that's what this game is.
5. Are over the age of 20 (because you'll know what an old point-and-click adventure game feels like)

This game will NOT appeal to you if you-
1. Are a normal person.


Cons:
- Incredi-bad voice acting
- Bland "love" storyline
- Bland environments
- Unintresting and nonmemorable characters and diologue
-  Horrible gameplay style (fetch-quests in a 2D environment)
- ANNOYING AS FUCK SOUNDTRACK

Pros:
- I bought this game for $0.09. So can you.


Conclusion & Rating:

........ 2/10

author: {'steamid': '76561197967366309', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 7, 'playtime_forever': 247, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 247, 'last_played': 1440681215}
review:
I bought this just to get the cards but so far I have enjoyed playing this game and will probably actually try and finish it (whers most I just play until I get the cards).
I have enountered a bug in the game but it was easily fixed by going to the menue and then continuing the game. This game is easily worth the 9c I paid when it was on sale and I am sure is worth the $.99 too. The biggest thing you need to remember as others have said this is not a serious game and I am sure you will enjoy it too.
One more thing afer now finishing the game, it is fairly short and is no more than 4 hours which I would say makes the price right.
3.5/5

author: {'steamid': '76561198197291749', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 4, 'playtime_forever': 248, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 248, 'last_played': 1440631643}
review:
Sinister city is a point and click hidden object puzzle game set as a dark comedy and revolving around vampirism. It is visually appealing as far as character design graphics, but it has standard bland backgrounds and props. The puzzles are 99% typical hidden item interactions and mini-games, with only one that stood out as unique. The click and touch recognitions are wonky in spots, but a majority operational.  The audio and dialogue are bland at best. Support for the game is untested, as it was unneeded. I was able to complete the game on both easy and advanced in a total of about 4 hrs of gameplay. It has very little replay value beyond its second playthrough.

In short, on my 10-point scale of rating games based on Concept, Appearance, Content & Replay Value, Mechanics, and Sound I would have to give Sinister City a 5/10. This is an overall decent game, but has very little replay value, is short in content, and contains minor flaws.

In the end, I would recommend this game only if it is on sale for the cheap, as in less than 50 cents, so you can make almost half your money back. Its an ok game, but doesn't have enough to it that would make it worth full price.

review: First I was meh, but then Dracula threatened to gladly bite my foot off. Then it got kinky from there while the protagnoist's waifu watched an John Mahoney hypnotize Channing Tatum into cleaning his basement and doing Alan Wake impressions. From there, the game was a great satire until I got stuck staring at Sarah Jessica Parker's face and the game wouldn't let me progress. Heterochromia aplenty, rate it 8 out of 8, mate.

author: {'steamid': '76561198205856919', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 6, 'playtime_forever': 184, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 184, 'last_played': 1440612820}
review: Completed this game twice (once on easy, and again on advanced) in just over 3 hours, while collecting all achievements. this game was funny, and the achievements managable and easy to collect during normal gameplay, giving a sense of completion. Many poeple are putting this game down for not being scary, however its clear that it does not intend to be, and it is actually quite funny. furthermore, i picked up this game for just ¬£0.07, and will make back more money selling the cards, so overall a profitable 3hrs of engagement.

author: {'steamid': '76561198121821715', 'num_games_owned': 942, 'num_reviews': 54, 'playtime_forever': 210, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 210, 'last_played': 1440585124}
review: I purchased this game on sale for 9 cents and got about 3.5 hours of entertainment.  It has good puzzles and the hidden objects while sometimes hard they are not brutal.  The story doesn't take itself seriously so if you're looking for a true vampire type story the comedy in this may put you off.  I actually enjoyed the story and found this game to be worthy.  At the low cost being able to get 100% completion and being able to sell the steam cards earned afterwards to make a profit is totally worth getting this game.

author: {'steamid': '76561198185171215', 'num_games_owned': 1043, 'num_reviews': 38, 'playtime_forever': 1050, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1050, 'last_played': 1440583558}
review:
Sinister City is an adventure game with a hidden object element which has decent vampire theme.

This game remind me of a classic cult bad movie "PLAN 9 FROM OUTER SPACE" directed by Ed Wood. The movie is bad, and the game mimic all the bad things happened on that movie. Dialougue are cheesy, story are cheesy, the cast & characters are ridicilous too. And all the things right here make me laugh because its funny.

I can't recommend this for a good game, but if you enjoying a cheesy bad movie or a bad game (not a broken game) which is entertaining and fun. You can try this.

author: {'steamid': '76561198057246223', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 93, 'playtime_forever': 86, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 86, 'last_played': 1440474259}
review:
Sinister City is a fairly short Hidden Object Game (HOG) with older graphics... but given it's age, it was  fun and for the price (on sale for  0.09 cents US), I can definitely say I got way more enjoyment out of it than I paid for. If you want a short (about 2-3 hours for most players) HOG, this is a very good choice. I DO recommend getting it on sale however.

This game is especially a good choice if you have an older system or one that has overheating issues, as it will not put a lot of strain on the system like the modern games would.  It has limited replayability (It features two difficulty settings.Difficulty setting easy gives you hints, faster help timer, etc. Normal difficultly does not give you hints as to where to go next, etc).  The story premise is simple and cornball in nature, but in an enjoyable way. 

All said and done, and considering it's age-it is a good little HOG that if you buy it on sale, is well worth the price of .09 pennies.

review: As far as HOGs go this one deserves a look. Not the best in existence but story wise it deviates a little from the generic HOG story (vampires in a situation you probably never expected), alright gameplay (though there's no clicking penalty if you're looking for that) and I liked it overall. The puzzles are easy (except the last one, had to skip it and and couldn't get the last achievement so watch out for that). Get it on sale.

review: Not bad if you're into hidden object games, and even better when it's 9 cents. This game gives off a little bit of visual novel feeling while still keeping it's hidden object charm. You have to find items to uncover the mysterious disappearance of John's fiance' Nina, which leads you to "Sinister City". The main vampire looks like it is modeled after Udo Kier in Blood for Dracula, seriously look it up, it's kind of awesome. The SFX volume is extremely loud, even on the lowest setting. Still a nice casual game to play.

author: {'steamid': '76561198032273592', 'num_games_owned': 581, 'num_reviews': 126, 'playtime_forever': 293, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 171, 'last_played': 1441648806}
review:
In Sum: Playable but not great hidden object game with some glaring flaws. Do not buy at full price.  3/5

This is another grudgingly recommended game, which I would have preferred a neutral rating on.  This is not a horrible game, and I have suffered a share of stinkers on Steam.  It is just a hidden object game, not much more or less than that, and I suspect a lot of the objection here is due to the casual nature of the game.  However even as a genre, within hidden object games, there is something to be desired.  

The concept is seemingly inspired by Dracula and early vampire movies that novel inspired, but with a twist that comes off somewhat amusing but not pulled off as well as, say, a similar theme in Magicka.  Unlike most hidden object games, you actually get to play a character and move around some parts of the game.  The visuals are actually decent for the non-searching parts of the game, and the voice acting is not bad.  It feels like it would have been a well-received, even high quality game in 1998.  I am not saying that the graphics are that ancient, just that I can't help but recall the casual  games of that era.  

The game consists of exploring very small areas for hidden objects, talking to NPCs, and solving puzzles.  Through playing, you effectively unlock search quests where you must find a certain number of specified items.  In some areas, there are item lists that must also be found before a quest item is revealed.  Once the quest is completed, a puzzle must be solved.  The puzzles are not complicated in the least.

Some HO games are difficult for various reasons, including devious trickery in design, such as putting similar looking objects, wordplay in clues, shifting images, interactive objects, and so on.  This game uses it's own method of frustrating the player, and it unfortunately is not very satisfying.  The objects are often hidden behind other objects that are not related to the puzzle (like a book or a plate), which must be clicked on to reveal the item underneath.  Makes it hard to search for something that isn't there.  Worst of all, the lighting and visibility of the objects is often terrible, to the point where I found myself clicking the screen randomly...and still succeeding!  Despite screen settings, the images can be so dim that they are practially not there, and I am sure on some monitors, would not show up at all.  And with the secret movable items and the poor display of items, and a lack of consequence for random clicking, it can become as much of a clicking game as Cookie Clicker...but without managers.  

Some seem to say that the objects are hard to find because they are not what people are expecting.  I have played many hidden object games, and as far as the genre goes, this one is actually very good at properly telling you what you are looking for.  

There are two major glitches, however.  If you are using Windows 7 or above, you will need to set the game to XP compatibility mode, or it won't even launch.  Sometimes during the game, you will not be able to interact with environments after a cutscene.  Going to the main menu then resuming will fix this.

All together, it is an acceptable HO game, purely casual and good for destressing or a waste of time.  On the easiest mode, there is no pressure and no consequence for wrong, and the soundtrack is not bad at all.  It was worth the 9 cents, but not the $10 full price by any means.

author: {'steamid': '76561198140722270', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 5, 'playtime_forever': 178, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 177, 'last_played': 1558844456}

author: {'steamid': '76561198048206769', 'num_games_owned': 861, 'num_reviews': 76, 'playtime_forever': 175, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 175, 'last_played': 1440450378}
review:
Weird story (but in an amusing way). The humour and unusual story is (IMO) certaily worth it. And it has cards!

Weird way to do Hidden Objects (in a strange way - random clicking works best). When you're stuck, you can just wait for the game to highlight the next step or item. No hints ever needed.

Weird bugs (but nothing game breaking that I encountered). It sometimes throws you out of a hidden object scene when you click on stuff. Exiting and restarting fixes that. Also, I got 'finish game on advanced' achievement while playing it on easy (which it apparrently undid in between finishing the game and finishing this review).

I got this on sale for 9 cent. Finished it in under 3h without rushing and the occasional pee break and chatting with friends on Steam. It's a bit short, but if you think 99 cent (normal price) isn't much, it's even worth that. Else, wait for a sale with a price of your preference.

author: {'steamid': '76561198121180549', 'num_games_owned': 210, 'num_reviews': 32, 'playtime_forever': 177, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 121, 'last_played': 1440455455}

(for devs)

the second one are texture bugs http://steamcommunity.com/sharedfiles/filedetails/?id=505798613
the third one was when I was trying to go somewhere I had to go, but I couldn't http://steamcommunity.com/sharedfiles/filedetails/?id=505798470
the fourth one was when I clicked the screen when searching objects I was automatically returning back. Pretty annoying.

Understand me, this is a good game, with his weird story and characters, you can pass your time on it.

author: {'steamid': '76561198049020554', 'num_games_owned': 4131, 'num_reviews': 374, 'playtime_forever': 206, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 83, 'last_played': 1450988679}
review:
This game is realy really buggy.  To start, I couldn't launch this game and I had to fiddle around with the properties from the games location in the Steam folder location. The click location is also not registering excatly where I'm clicking.  To top it off, when I got to the mirror's place, the clicks didn't work anymore, everything gave a red X.  It started off with a kind of interesting story, but the game is far too buggy for it to be considered anything good.  This game should go back to being a free app on iOS or Android.

Rating 4.7/10

author: {'steamid': '76561198045208825', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 69, 'playtime_forever': 154, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 154, 'last_played': 1440058283}
review:
[h1]Summary[/h1]
Short, decent hidden object game with a delightfully silly story. Some minor bugs and annoying mechanics are out-weighed by the exceedingly low price and the genuinely fun story and dialogue. If you enjoy the genre and you enjoy a good B-movie story, you should have a reasonably good time for a low price. 

[h1]Review[/h1]
You play as John, a generic American guy looking for his missing bride who apparently got kidnapped by her vampire father. You chase her to the titular Sinister City, the haven of all that is unholy. If that sounds rather silly, don‚Äôt worry, that‚Äôs the point. Not at any point are you supposed to be taking the game‚Äôs story seriously. That, combined with competent voice actors and well-written silly dialogue, provided a good amount of fun for me. Luckily the game does not last long enough (I finished it on advanced mode with all achievements in apparently 2.6 hours according to steam) or use the silliness too ham-fistedly for it to grow stale. I especially liked how they incorporated the silly story with the already silly ‚Äúgo find X items‚Äù or ‚Äúgo fix my Z‚Äù missions that are the staple of hidden object games. It made it amusing instead of just silly. 

The mechanics of the game were not the best admittedly. The hidden objects and mini-games were decidedly average for the genre coupled with an annoying tendency to have items hidden by other items with no indication that you can interact with the covering item. For example you are in a bookshop looking for item X. Item X is hidden behind a book‚Ä¶ you need to click the right book to show it, but your cursor will not change as you hover over it. So basically you need to click all the books in the scene to show it. Sometimes it is more obvious which item is the covering one, but quite frequently you need to click a huge number of random items to find the right one. Which is not great design. However, there are no penalties for misclicks and there is a robust hint-system so when you get used to it, it‚Äôs not a huge deal (using the hint-system will costs you an achievement though if you care about that). 

Though old areas remain open as you open new ones, the items you need to find is always in the new areas or the game makes it obvious that you need to return to an old area (like, a character tells you to go back to the castle) so there is no annoying backtracking. 

People have reported a lot of bugs it seems. I only ran into one in one area and it was partially fixed by exiting to the main menu and totally fixed by restarting the game. 

Overall, I had a good time with Sinister City. I enjoyed the silly dialogue and story. The mechanics were nothing exciting, but I quite enjoy the genre so that was fine. For the price (I got it for 0.99 euro) I would definitely say it is worth it.

author: {'steamid': '76561198012093560', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 150, 'playtime_forever': 182, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 182, 'last_played': 1439717244}

author: {'steamid': '76561198008914127', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 145, 'playtime_forever': 109, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 109, 'last_played': 1438602297}
review:
After reading the reviews, I thought it might be 'so bad it's good'. I was wrong!

Yes the dialogue did make me laugh out loud but that's about where the fun ended. This doesn't even work properly as a hidden object game or a point and click. When you have finished with a hidden object scene it doesn't tell you this, you just have to guess. As other reviews have said it's poorly rendered so it's difficult to see the objects (I swear a few were invisible) and it's buggy as hell - after 30 minutes some of the locations just whited out.

Just don't bother.

author: {'steamid': '76561197989596025', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 30, 'playtime_forever': 180, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 180, 'last_played': 1438202421}
review: Most hilariously "bad" game I've played in quite awhile. It's obviously a satire and the corny plot was clearly intentional. It did its job and entertained for a few hours, and at its $0.99 price point I can only recommend.

author: {'steamid': '76561197999329596', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 12, 'playtime_forever': 446, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 446, 'last_played': 1437197678}
review:
I am glad I ignored the negative reviews for this game, This is a misunderstood game. It was never intended to be a serious blood and gore vampire game, It was a satire on the whole vampire thing, and I found that refreshing. It was also corny like a 1950 B movie, which I believe was done intentionally. There is a lot of comedy in the game. I also liked the fact that the achievements were easy to obtain for a change. The game was also short in length which I consider a plus. I get tired of these epic 100 hour plus games that developers seem fond of creating lately.
 If you want a relaxing game that offers amusement and won't take weeks to complete then you will like this game.

author: {'steamid': '76561197991310275', 'num_games_owned': 4054, 'num_reviews': 28, 'playtime_forever': 188, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 188, 'last_played': 1436772173}
review:
Here's a thing that annoyed me: You're often collecting some number of objects (bulbs, coins, etc) that appear in hidden-object scenes. These are sometimes hidden behind things in the scene, which you have to click on to move & reveal what you're looking for. But these concealing objects won't move out of the way if you click on them before you've gotten the collection task for the object they're in front of, which seems to me like cheating, in a way. 

And since there is no apparent penalty for mis-clicks, and no clue that something is moveable in this way, the best strategy is often to just spam the screen with clicks everywhere, in case something comes into view. 

The hit zones for hidden objects are also remarkably large, so you just have to click sorta kinda *near* what you're looking for. Several times, I was able to pick up multiple things by clicking repeatedly in exactly the same place.

Aspect ratio is messed up - it's obviously a 4:3 screen stretched to 16:9, in both full-screen and windowed mode. Text size & placement was also messed up on my 3840x2160 screen, and doesn't reset properly when switching from windowed to full-screen without closing & reopening. All-in-all, not one I can recommend.

author: {'steamid': '76561198158375554', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 13, 'playtime_forever': 393, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 158, 'last_played': 1450005164}
review: all bugs.I am in the game where he went through the mirror and with hidden object game ,every time i find something,i am 'back' so  to every time i have to click on the location to search further,and with the minigame to repair the clock,every second i get the question if i am sure i want to skip the minigame..and after i talk to nina and father in law in the timezone,i can't go on because the location where i must search is blocking me out.so Irritating.And if i want to walk back,john is standing still.does not move.and this is in the beginning of the game.i am not even sure if i can finish this game.

author: {'steamid': '76561198080027046', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 31, 'playtime_forever': 725, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 723, 'last_played': 1443098671}

author: {'steamid': '76561198028216179', 'num_games_owned': 2423, 'num_reviews': 159, 'playtime_forever': 197, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 197, 'last_played': 1435545959}
review:
I bought this game based on the negative reviews and I don't regret it one bit.

This game is bad, quite bad, but on purpose. The story is dreadful but I found it amusing and unexpected. Game play is simple so nothing amazing there. Art is so-so. Everything about the game is middle ground and forgetable. I almost would regret it if it weren't for the corny story.

It starts off normal enough, John has to rescue his Nina from vampires. Then you realize everything is light hearted and not dark nor sinister. I found myself groaning more than once over the story but overall I laughed at it and enjoyed it for all it's horribleness. So for the cheap price I say give it a shot.

author: {'steamid': '76561198077867324', 'num_games_owned': 4172, 'num_reviews': 33, 'playtime_forever': 227, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 227, 'last_played': 1431587104}
review:
I almost didn't buy this game thanks to the multitude of negative reviews. It was on sale, so I took a chance & bought it despite all the bad press. 
I personally didn't have any issues running the game unlike so many others (I'm using Win 8.1 on a stock XPS 8700). Not sure if there was an update that fixed the major bugs, there was no mention of one in View Update History.
A lot of reviewers have ridiculed the storyline - show me [b]ANY[/b] Hidden Object Game that doesn't have a ridiculous, overly fantastic story! 
Yes, the game does have bad voice acting - again, show me an HOG that doesn't!
Some reviewers mentioned low-res hidden object scenes that were overly difficult - I've seen better, but I've also seen worse. I just finished playing another HOG with inferior hidden object scenes when compared to Sinister City, despite being "remastered".

[u]Bottom line:[/u] Not the most polished HOG I've ever played, however the game never crashed on me, I was able to play it all the way through with no problems, & I got 100% achievements plus trading cards. I did see a few glitches, but nothing game-breaking. If you like Hidden Object Games, pick this one up on sale.

author: {'steamid': '76561198010597228', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 309, 'playtime_forever': 130, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 126, 'last_played': 1525375179}
review:
Skurill, idiotisch, bescheuert, unrealistisch, v√∂llig verasrschend und so ernst gemeint wie ein zu Gott betender Satanist.

Besser kann man die Story nicht beschreiben, welche an sich genommen nichtmal so schlecht ist...

Aber!!! Jetzt kommt das gro√üe Aber!!!

Grafik ist eher nebens√§chlig, es ist die die beste, aber es gibt Spiele wie Tetris die schlechter aussehen ;)

Leider konnten sich die Entwickler nicht entscheiden, was sie eigentlich wollten... ein Third-Person oder First-Person... ersteres ist teilweise extrem schlecht umgesetzt, man f√ºhlt sich teilweise v√∂llig deplaziert oder man rennt in den Texturen rum, welche W√§nde oder T√ºren sind... Klickt man auf einen Bereich wird man sofort hinteleportiert, die Laufanimation h√§tte man sich so schenken k√∂nnen, die gibt es zwar, aber eigentlich nur zur unn√∂tigen Dekoration.

Die R√§tsel sind alles nur derselbe Suchkram, wobei es im Gegensatz zu den meisten Wimmelbildspielen in hektischer Klickerei ausartet, da man teilweise nicht wei√ü was man sucht, bzw. Gegenst√§nde wichtig sind von denen man es bis dato garnicht wei√ü....
Oft genug verstecken sich die gesuchten Gegenst√§nde hinter Dingen, die man erst beiseite schieben muss, nur wei√ü man das leider nicht... also probieren! Die ab und an eingestreuten Wimmelbildspiele sind meist sehr einfach und die Gegenst√§nde v√∂llig belanglos. Hinter dem letzten Gegenstand befindet sich immer etwas, was man zum Weiterkommen ben√∂tigt.
Sprecher sind ordentlich(Englisch) und die Texte gut √ºbersetzt, der Sound ist nichts besonderes Ohrenkrebs bekommt man aber nicht da er kaum vorhanden ist oder mir nicht im Ged√§chtnis geblieben.

Was gibt es noch zu sachen... glaube nichts mehr^^

Fazit: 1 Euro ist daf√ºr okay! Der Humor ist nicht jedermans Sache, stellenweise ist es einfach nur unterirdisch schlecht, manchmal aber auch komisch. Eine Empfehlung kann ich aber nicht geben!

review:
it was ok. short. story was really cheesy. some of the objects were stupid hard to find tho. find a spoon, but we only show you the handle. find a key, but we've hidden it behind this other totally unrelated object. and it was buggy. it kept kicking me out of the hidden object scenes for no aparent reason so i had to exit game and restart a couple times which seemed to fix whatever the problem was.

would recommend if you have the patience to deal with the bugs, but don't expect anything even remotely scary. the vampires in this story don't do scary.

author: {'steamid': '76561198089568445', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 23, 'playtime_forever': 283, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 283, 'last_played': 1434093649}
review:
Before I begin, I have to say, I recommend and don't recommend this game. The problem is that this game clearly isn't for everyone, the story was alright, but not the best. When I read the description, I thought, "Oh, maybe this game will be horror related perhaps or at least have that sense of 'scary' vampires as well as his future wife turning into a vampire possibly making him turn into a vampire." Although, instead it gives you more of a comedy like relief than anything else, to me it really ruined the whole dark, 'scary' vampire part that I wanted. If you want a puzzle related game with a story that has nothing to do with dark vampires, but instead gives you a light-hearted, childish related vampire scenario, then this is the game for you. Although, paying only a dollar just to get it wasn't a total waste of my money for I did enjoy the game.

The problem with this game is the lack of the horror element in the game, this is a vampire game after all and therefore the characters should feel scared. It's also easy to beat the game, I beat it the first time in roughly 3 in a half hours, although that was on 'easy' difficulty.

Overall, I did enjoy the game, it was light-hearted, seemed more like a kids game than an adults game, especially with the 'find the items' part added into play. Do I recommend this to everyone, no, I only recommend this to people who want a light-hearted, puzzle related game that is kid friendly.

I rate the game 7/10.

author: {'steamid': '76561198106810138', 'num_games_owned': 2232, 'num_reviews': 100, 'playtime_forever': 140, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 140, 'last_played': 1433330377}
review:
[b]An somewhat bland hidden object game that doesn't survive its bugs[/b].

You are John, a protagonist so bland he doesn't have a last name, personality or emotional range. You've come to Sinister City because your fiance has been kidnapped. Sinister City is where vampires live... or something? It's hardly explained, but apparently vampires and other supernatural monsters are not just fully accepted in this world but also big business.

I get what they're going for, a comical deconstruction of vampire tropes strung together with hidden object sequences, but the jokes tend to fall flat. What's worse, far worse, is that there are several glaring bugs in this less-than-two-hour game. Just after the main villain got revealed (your fiance's father objecting to your marriage) I got stuck and only after exiting back out to the menu and returning did it allow me to progress. Later on, at the big finale (...or what passes for it anyway) every click in a hidden object scene not only clicked something but also exited the scene. It was still possible to progress, but it was frustratingly tedious to automatically exit and then manually re-enter each scene after every single click. The icing on the cake is that the very last sequence even had its background bugging out, just [url=http://steamcommunity.com/sharedfiles/filedetails/?id=454353257]showing the clickable items on a white background[/url]. Comical deconstruction indeed.

With the [url=http://steamcommunity.com/id/MaraKalat/recommended/284710]Artifex Mundi games[/url] also available on Steam there is no reason at all to pick this up.

author: {'steamid': '76561198054803370', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 31, 'playtime_forever': 349, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 349, 'last_played': 1432219511}
review:
Such a bizarre and quirky game. It was like playing a bad movie. While I enjoyed the cheesiness, and the hidden pictures, as well as the mini-games, I really got frustrated because of the bugs. 
There are a lot of bugs in this game. I had to reload several times due to errors that caused the game to be unplayable.

Bug #1 Random white squares during hidden pictures parts of the game causing me to reset multiple times. (Requires restart or going back to main menu)

Bug #2 Bugs causing me to be unable to leave a certain area. (Requires restart or going back to main menu)

Bug #3 Getting stuck on the map screen. (Requires restart or going back to main menu)

Bug #4 Walking through many objects: Walls, doors, floors ETC. (not game breaking, just weird)

Various other visual bugs that aren't game-breaking, but still weird.

If you can look past all of that, then you've got an okay game. Not great, but okay.

author: {'steamid': '76561198084062834', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 206, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 206, 'last_played': 1431966765}
review:
SPOILER-GEFAHR
In dem Spiel "Sinister City" geht es um eine Liebesgeschichte zwischen zwei verlobten Menschen (?), der Vater der jungen Dame ist ein Vampierlord und entf√ºhrt seine Tochter damit diese einen lokalen Vampier-Fernsehstar heiratet. Der "neue" Verlobte hat allerdings gar keine Lust die Tochter des Lords zu heiraten, da er bereits in einer Beziehung ist. 

BEWERTUNG
Die Geschichte ist eine der typischen "Ich-muss-meine-Verlobte-retten"-Geschichten und ziemlich oberfl√§chlich. 
Hin und wieder haben ein paar Grafiken gebuggt, sodass der Charakter zum Beispiel mitten in einer Grafik steht, obwohl das nicht m√∂glich sein sollte. 
Die Stimmen, Soundeffekte und Musik waren, trotz herunterstellen in den Optionen, immer zu laut und oft √ºbersteuert. Nach den ersten paar Minuten habe ich meine Kopfh√∂rer dann neben mich gelegt und das war immer noch zu laut.
Die √úbersetzungen sind wirklich nicht gut. Das f√§llt besonders w√§hrend den Suchbilder auf. So sollte ich zum Beispiel nach "Zwiebel" suchen, der Tipp hat mir irgendwann verraten, das die "Zwiebel" eine Weihnachtsbaumkugel ist oder eine der "Palme(n)" ist eine Hand. Das tritt leider ein paar Mal auf.
Die Suchbilder sind oft viel zu dunkel/haben einen schwarzen Bereich, auf dem nichts zu erkennen ist. Da genau dort aber oft Dinge versteckt sind, hilft dort nur ein Tipp oder wildes, wilk√ºrliches Klicken.
Oft kann man Dinge, die offen herumliegen, erst nach x-maligem Klicken einsammeln, was sehr nervt. 

MEINUNG 
Meine pers√∂nliche Meinung zu dem Spiel: 
Die Story ist eigentlich gut gelungen, nur gewisse Logikfehler machen die Atmosph√§re sehr kaputt. 
Durch die nervigen Falsch-√úbersetzungen ist es teilweise nicht m√∂glich ohne Tipps.
Es hatte Potenzial, das leider nicht ausgesch√∂pft wurde.

author: {'steamid': '76561198062558470', 'num_games_owned': 903, 'num_reviews': 197, 'playtime_forever': 137, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 137, 'last_played': 1432136524}
review:
This game is a nice point and click game with some nice puzzles in it. The Story is short and cute.
The only annoying thing I saw was one of the "Quests" if you will call it that, It told me to use my finger across the screen (?) And it was really hard to control it with the mouse. 

It only got 17 Achievement and is one of the games which you can complete easily to a perfect game.

Due to the fact that it is only 2 hours long I wouldn't recommend buying this game for the full price of 5‚Ç¨. Buy this game when it is on sale for 99 cents or less.

I can recommend this game to every 90's kid due to the memories of the floppy disks!

author: {'steamid': '76561197970728484', 'num_games_owned': 3244, 'num_reviews': 103, 'playtime_forever': 363, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 218, 'last_played': 1562563757}
review:
I ususally don't play 'hidden object' titles. I picked up this one because it was a dollar and I like the vampire theme.
The game takes about 2-3 hours to complete.
The story is light, cheesey and reminicent of something I wrote in grade school.

That said, it was fun and for a dollar it's pretty hard to go wrong.

Vampire/Campy fans 6/10
Others its a 5/10

author: {'steamid': '76561198109716822', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 3, 'playtime_forever': 223, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 223, 'last_played': 1430892552}
review:
En variaci√≥n interesante en los juegos de objetos ocultos ... algunas buenas ideas, pero demasiados errores.
La historia est√° destinado a ser divertido, pero el humor es pesimo y  muy mal escrito. Hay bastantes errores que requieren reiniciar el juego con el fin de solucionarlos.
Las escenas de objetos ocultos son demasiado f√°ciles y ademas demaciado corto, lo medio decente por no decir faciles son los puzzles. 
M√∫sica aburrida, sensaci√≥n de que no te est√°s enterando de nada... en general, para mi gusto, un desastre que no merece la pena a menos que venga en un bundle 
Las animaciones en 3D a√±aden un buen toque, y la actuaci√≥n de voz es decente. Desafortunadamente, las fallas mantienen este juego a no ser divertido.

author: {'steamid': '76561198056151662', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 27, 'playtime_forever': 123, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 123, 'last_played': 1430791488}
review:
Bear in mind, just because I can't recommend it, it doens't mean it didn't entertain me for two hours. It works, doesn't crash, and the hint button fills up quickly. However, because of the way it's made, you'll be using it quite a bit.

This game is a bit rough around the edges. The objects sometimes don't look how you'd expect them to, requiring you to use the hint button. This is far from the H.O,Gs from Big Fish.

The achievements pop up as completed yet aren't. Steam says I've got 15 out of 17, but there are actually five missing. Confusing and irritating, I'd rather they be absent than not work.

The story is cringe worthy. It's just awful. I know it's supposed to be tongue in cheek, but the dialogue is the cheesiest going, and the voice acting really quite rotten. Sometimes the written text doesn't match up with the spoken dialogue, which throws one a bit. 

If you can tolerate the bizarre and insane hotel manager at the start, you'll probably have a good few hours of distraction with this game. But I can't recommend this, simply as it lacks any polish and an interesting story line. 

I don't wish to be mean to the developers, and I wish them luck in their future projects, and I will look out for their other works to see if they've improved their writing.

author: {'steamid': '76561198000669253', 'num_games_owned': 595, 'num_reviews': 34, 'playtime_forever': 183, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 22, 'last_played': 1438969880}
review:
Chock full of bugs.  Clicking hidden objects sometimes takes you away from the current puzzle.  Eventually I couldn't click into puzzles and so had to give up.  

Hides things completely out of sight (have to click on other things you have no reason to click on to find things).

author: {'steamid': '76561198144055412', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 21, 'playtime_forever': 27, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 27, 'last_played': 1430359444}
review:

Poco se puede decir de este juego. Y lo poco que se puede decir de √©l no habla a su favor. Es un juego de b√∫squedad que, supuestamente, gira en torno a la desaparici√≥n de la mujer del protagonista...

Bueno. La historia estar√≠a bien si no fuera por que la mayor parte de cosas que ocurren en la trama son sacadas de la manga.
"¬øSabes qu√©?, si me ayudas a buscar mis afcturas te dejo la habitaci√≥n gratis".

Eso sin contar con la gran cantidad de glitches que he encontrado durante mis menos de 50 minutos de juego. Uno de ellos incluso me forz√≥ a salir del juego porque no pod√≠a continuar.

Pantallas en blanco. Di√°logos insulsos y absurdos. Una historia que no te cuenta nada... (Que a ver, es un juego de b√∫squeda, la cosa es encontrar lo que est√°s buscando... pero si vas a meterle historia, por lo menos busca algo que contar... si no lim√≠tate a la b√∫squeda).

M√∫sica aburrida, sensaci√≥n de que no te est√°s enterando de nada... en general, para mi gusto, un desastre que no merece lo que cuesta.

author: {'steamid': '76561198042831386', 'num_games_owned': 598, 'num_reviews': 627, 'playtime_forever': 107, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 107, 'last_played': 1428329709}
review:
[h1]Short version: 23%[/h1]
Ever wanted a Plan 9 level of train wreck in a hidden object game format? Here it is then!

[h1]Long version:[/h1]
Do you believe that Twilight was the worst thing to happen to vampire stories? Did you think that you‚Äôll never find a hidden object game on par with [url=http://store.steampowered.com/app/321600/]The Flying Dutchman[/url]? You were wrong.

Because this game is bad. Astonishingly, mind-numbingly bad. For starters, it fails as a hidden object game with almost completely empty scenes. Don‚Äôt put much hope in the puzzles either, they are about as complex as a slab of stone.
And there is the story. Oh gods, the story. It has an interesting premise, sure: vampires are an everyday part of society, they work like anybody else. But unlike True Blood, this one was written by dumb people for dumber people. The plot is stupid. The characters are even more stupid. And the dialogues‚Ä¶ the dialogues make a five-year old child‚Äôs screenplay look like Oscar Award material.

But! If you can enjoy terrible movies like Plan 9, The Room, or Birdemic, then you will surely have a hilarious time with Sinister City.

author: {'steamid': '76561198083289730', 'num_games_owned': 1424, 'num_reviews': 115, 'playtime_forever': 139, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 138, 'last_played': 1434044714}
review: Weird plot, odd movement but humorous and not (too) difficult. This is a nice game for the younger toddlers, I found it a tad short but still it was fun to play.

author: {'steamid': '76561198112486038', 'num_games_owned': 1524, 'num_reviews': 26, 'playtime_forever': 610, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 462, 'last_played': 1428752918}
review:
For starters, the game is a hidden object game with a great title "Sinister City: Vampire Adventure".  But that is the only thing good it has to offer.  If you are looking for a dark and scary story, forget about it,  there is nothing scary about this game.  
The story evolves around a silly plot that goes like this: Your girlfriend was hidden from you by his father who turns out to be a vampire lord.  Your future father-in-law is basically against your relationship because you are just a mere mortal.  Because you are more interested in the undead than the living, you still went out and searched for your bloodsucking girlfriend.  
You do this and that. Then followed by you look for this and that.  And a little more of you fetch this and that.  Then towards the end the story takes an odd turn which was absolutely ridiculous.  I don't want to spoil the ending for you, but believe me it was rather silly.
The puzzles are rather easy and the only challenge is when you are trying to locate objects that were microscopic and finding things that blend with their backgrounds, other than that it was smooth sailing for me.
In conclusion, I would NOT recommend this game,  I like the artwork and the graphics but I just could not stand the horrible plot.  As they say " Don't judge a book by its cover" or in my case the "Title".  If you are looking of a challenging game, I suggest you find it elsewhere.

author: {'steamid': '76561198033301727', 'num_games_owned': 3018, 'num_reviews': 14, 'playtime_forever': 43, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 43, 'last_played': 1428634420}

review:
Typical hidden object game with a semi-interesting story.
A little buggy. Was floating in a door for a while.
I thought one puzzle was a loading screen for a while as there was no prompt to complete a puzzle.
It's O.K. I wouldn't reccomend buying it.

review: Puffff, bastante tonto, la verdad, pretende ser gracioso pero s√≥lo es absurdo, y con ese nombre, esperaba otra cosa del juego. Tambi√©n es demasiado corto y la interfaz es muy pobre. Los pocos puzzles que tiene son facil√≠simos y algunos se repiten bastante. Las EOO normales, tampoco para tirar cohetes. En fin, yo entiendo que son juegos que se hacen con poco presupuesto y que para lo que ha costado tampoco se puede pedir mucho, pero, lo siento, me ha resultado un poco decepcionante y bastante aburrido.

author: {'steamid': '76561198009528477', 'num_games_owned': 1986, 'num_reviews': 29, 'playtime_forever': 120, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 99, 'last_played': 1474451068}
review:
Have you ever lost your keys or any other small object and then spent a vast amount of time trying to find it ? This is the game for you, if you enjoyed the procedure. It doesn't hide its apparent mobile roots by telling you to "tap" a lot and, as if that isn't enough to sell you on this..."game", it also has bugs...I was on the edge of my seat, driven by pure adrenaline and rushing through the experience until I got stuck trying to fix some air conditioner for a vampire lady, which was impossible to do, thanks to me not being able to click and place objects. 
2 hours of gametime wasted ? Yes, sir..But it was worth every second to endure the exciting tale of you, John, some guy and your wife..soon to be wife..Nina, who is staying with her vampire Dad Orlok in SINISTER CITY (where the bats do crap and the wits are shitty..) and you are trying to WHATEVER, THIS IS GARBAGE !

review: Bardzo przyjemna gra typu hidden objects, tak na jeden wiecz√≥r. JedynƒÖ wadƒÖ sƒÖ uciƒÖ≈ºliwe bugi kt√≥re powodujƒÖ czasami ≈ºe nie mo≈ºemy kliknƒÖƒá konkretnego obiektu lub automatycznie wyrzuca nas z 'lokacji' - jednak na szczƒô≈õcie restart gry pomaga

author: {'steamid': '76561198058687420', 'num_games_owned': 685, 'num_reviews': 77, 'playtime_forever': 86, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 86, 'last_played': 1418562623}
review:
Games like this are what makes it dangerous to dig into the obscure depths of your steam backlog. Don't give in because of the cheap price, throwing that money down a gutter is a far better investment.

1) Saying the story is ludicrous doesn't even begin to cover it. It's not even funny bad, it is depressingly bad. Worse even...

2) You can't escape the story. No matter how much you try to fast click through things, the game will not allow you to go find some hidden objects or puzzles, it is *intent* on walking you through the "story". Then again, that would only be bad if you were eager to do the puzzles and HO segments. Which you aren't. Basically...

3) These are easily the stupidest hidden object scenes I have ever encountered, and I've played through alot of crap in my time. It's a hidden object game. Hide the darn thing! If I have a list of 6 items to find and I'm looking at a suitcase with 7 items in it, WHAT IS THE POINT?

4) And so as not to waste your time anymore, let's sum up everything else that's bad: There are zero redeeming elements to the gameplay and puzzles: when they aren't so boring they put you to sleep, or so easy a 2 year old would breeze through them, they're so unintuitive it's baffling. The voiceacting is so unbearably bad I was forced to mute it. As for the art and animations, cringeworthy is the only word that comes to mind. But hey, they are combined brilliantly with the game's general technical incompetence: There is a whole area where you consistently float around because they forgot to add a floor(!). And that's hardly a unique event, since there's a bottomless pit worth of bugs and glitches to enjoy here.

Which brings me to what I loved most about this game: I got a game-breaking bug. :D So I can now in good conscience remove this game from my backlog, toss it in the garbage can, and never think of it ever again.

author: {'steamid': '76561198041113007', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 7, 'playtime_forever': 226, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 121, 'last_played': 1483476966}
review:
I liked it. Yes, there were some bugs, but they disappear once you go to the menu and then come back to the game. Is really easy and short, that's true. But for this price, I'd say it's worth it. Grab it on a sale, if you're afraid. 

Anyway, it's short and has some bugs. But the story is priceless. Some people here said it was [i]bad[/i], but I found it hilarious. The voice acting, the characters, the story and the general mood of the game, is obviously a comedy. And it made me smile quite a few times, so that's good on my book!

I can't really say this is a GOOD game, but it's really cheap, it has trading cards, and it distracted me for a few hours, in addition to being funny. So hey, grab it if you don't have anything else to play.

author: {'steamid': '76561198005599387', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 189, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 189, 'last_played': 1418045491}
review:
Das Spiel ist l√§cherlich...
Es geht darum herum zu klicken und zwar auf einer willk√ºrlichen Weise...
Sinister City ist eine heitere, sp√∂ttische Kom√∂die, die so wenig Sinn ergibt und doch eine Geschichte hat..?
Man spielt das Spiel und denkt sich: "Was f√ºr ein Schwachsinn!", "Vielleicht sollte ich √ºber den Inhalt und √ºber das 'Worum' mir keine Gedanken machen..?"

Wenn das Spiel eine Parodie auf die Wimmelbildspiele sein soll, dann ist das Spiel vielleicht gar nicht mal so schlecht.
Nichts f√ºr ungut: Es muss eine Satire sein!

author: {'steamid': '76561198044668090', 'num_games_owned': 1567, 'num_reviews': 20, 'playtime_forever': 129, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 129, 'last_played': 1417900301}
review:
Just finished the game now and honestly, I'm glad I got it in a bundle. The storyline is hilariously bad, the voice acting is terrible and the lines just makes you wonder if you're not seeing a terrible (even worse..)spin-off some bad vampire movie.

Then there's the bugs.You have to quit to the main menu and go back in because you keep seeing tons of white boxes on screen; not to mention the hidden objects scenes throw you out of the scene and you need to keep clicking to go back in, object by object.

I DID have fun tho, the dialogue is so terrible you end up having a laugh or two with it. Not sure if the game devs were trolling or not, but if they were, kudos for this one!

TL,DR--> Don't bother.

author: {'steamid': '76561198060731577', 'num_games_owned': 2394, 'num_reviews': 120, 'playtime_forever': 168, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 168, 'last_played': 1417861173}
review:
Very weird mainstory, easy puzzles and low difficulty level are good for sure. But game still have many bugs and not-so-best graphic.
I would recommend this game for people who like to get easily 100% of achievements and/or funny story. 
Maybe game isn't too long (I completed it twice in less than 3 hours) and is not the best, but for that price it is very good.
My ratings:
*Story* - 4/10
*Music* - 5/10
*Graphic* - 5/10
*Gameplay* - 5/10
***Average*** - 5/10

author: {'steamid': '76561198067473432', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 4, 'playtime_forever': 55, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 55, 'last_played': 1417827615}
review: I really love hidden object games and I really wanted to love this one too since it was cheap and so. The story had potential if only it had better voice acting maybe? The thing that really brought this game down was the graphics, the hidden object areas were so pixelated that you could barely tell what you were looking at. Most of the time I ended up randomly clicking all over the screen until I found all of the objects. The game also was very buggy, in one scene the hidden object area kept kicking me out of the area everytime I clicked on something and certain places had graphic glitches. I wouldn't recommend this game even if it was discounted to barely nothing.

author: {'steamid': '76561198038910835', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 56, 'playtime_forever': 36, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 36, 'last_played': 1417743888}

author: {'steamid': '76561198141836583', 'num_games_owned': 273, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 188, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 148, 'last_played': 1419707921}
review:
First of all, this game isn't too bad. Yes, the story is ridiculous and cheesy, but I'm thinking that the devs did this on purpose. It actually made me smile several times during gameplay.

In my opinion the puzzles weren't hard at all, they didn't slow your progress down. So they were a nice change between all the clicking and searching for hidden items.
I did experience some minor bugs (closing the game and restarting it, fixed it), but nothing really gamebreaking.

All in all, if you want to play something that is light and doesn't need much concentration. And you like ridiculous "horror" stories, then this is something for you. It isn't too expensive (although i got mine from a bundle), so just give it a shot.

author: {'steamid': '76561198098229889', 'num_games_owned': 5344, 'num_reviews': 85, 'playtime_forever': 317, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 317, 'last_played': 1416583950}
review:
